tgt: mekgatlo ena e boetse e tshehetsa mosebetsi wa lefapha la kgiro le bosebetsi ho phetheng bohlahlobi dibakeng tsa tshebetso, e le ho netefatsa hore ditsamaiso tsa bophelo bo botle le polokeho di kentswe tshebetsong molemong wa basebetsi ba kgutlelang mesebetsing.

src: many of our trade unions are also providing coronavirus information to their members and employers are running awareness campaigns.
tgt: boholo ba mekgatlo ya basebetsi bo boetse bo fana ka lesedi le amanang le kokwanahloko ya corona ho ditho tsa yona, athe le basebetsi le bona ba etsa matsholo a tlhokomediso.

src: one of the challenges that has emerged in our country is the stigmatisation of people who have proven positive with coronavirus.
tgt: enngwe ya diqholotso tse ropohileng naheng ya rona ke ya ho bewa sepha ha batho ba nang le tshwaetso ya kokwanahloko ya corona .

src: as a society, we have a collective responsibility to stamp out the stig matisation of people infected with the coronavirus.
tgt: re le setjhaba re na le boikarabelo ka kopanelo, ba ho fedisa ho bewa sepha ha batho ba tshwaetsehileng ke kokwanahloko ya corona .

src: there have been disturbing reports of individuals being ostracised from their communities and of communities protesting against coronavirus patients being admitted to local hospitals and clinics.
tgt: ho bile le ditlaleho tse nyarosang tsa batho ba hoboswang dibakeng tseo ba dulang ho tsona, esita le tsa setjhaba se ipelaetsang kgahlanong le bakudi ba kokwanahloko ya corona ba amohelwang dipetleleng le ditleliniking.

src: this must stop.
tgt: ntho ena e tlameha ho fela.

src: just as we came together to promote acceptance of people living with hiv and stood firm against victimisation, we must show understanding, tolerance, kindness, empathy and compassion for those who are infected with this virus and for their families.
tgt: jwaloka ha re ile ra ipopa ngatana nngwe ho kgothaletsa kamohelo ya batho ba nang le hiv ra ba ra lomahanya meno kgahlanong le hore batho ba etswe diphofu, re tshwanela ho bontsha kutlwisiso, mamello, mosa le kutlwelanobohloko ho bao ba tshwaetsehileng ke kokwanahloko ena le bakeng sa malapa a bona.

src: it is said that this stigmatisation is driven by fear of con tracting the disease and lack of understanding.
tgt: ho utlwisa bohloko ho tseba hore taba ena ya ho bewa sepha e susumetswa ke tshabo ya ho tshwaetswa ke lefu lena esita le ke kgaello ya kutlwisiso.

src: the best way to overcome our instinctive fear of illness and contagion is to observe the hygiene protocols that are in place.
tgt: mokgwa o motle ka ho fetisisa wa ho fenya tlholeho ya rona ya ho tshaba mafu le ditshwaetso, ke ho ikobela ditsamaiso tse teng tsa bohlweki.

src: the fear of infection is wellfounded and real.
tgt: tshabo ya tshwaetso e na le mabaka a utlwahalang ebile ke nnete.

src: at the same time, we know what we have to do to protect ourselves and others.
tgt: ka ho tshwanang, re tseba seo re tshwanelang ho se etsa hore re itshireletse re be re sireletse le ba bang.

src: we know what causes the virus and what we can do to protect ourselves from becoming infected.
tgt: re a tseba hore na kokwanahloko ena e bakwa ke eng, esita le seo re ka se etsang ho itshireletsa hore re se ke ra tshwaetseha.

src: we know we have to maintain social distancing, to selfisolate if we have come into contact with those infected and to present to a hospital if we have symptoms.
tgt: re a tseba hore re tshwanela ho dula re qaqolohane re le batho, le hore re itsheke thajana haeba re ile ra atamelana le bao ba tshwaetsehileng esita le hore re itlalehe dipetlele haeba re na le matshwao.

src: we must continue to be guided by facts and not rumours.
tgt: re tlameha hore re nne re tswele pele ho tataiswa ke nnete, e seng ke hlokwana la tsela.

src: the time when anyone could say they do not know anyone who is infected or affected by coronavirus has long passed.
tgt: e fetile nako eo ka yona mang kapa mang a neng a ka re ha ho motho eo a mo tsebang ya tshwaetsehileng kapa ya anngweng ke kokwanahloko ya corona .

src: now, more than ever, our friends, families, colleagues and neighbours need our empathy and support.
tgt: mothating wa jwale, ho feta neng kapa neng pejana, metswalle ya rona, ba leloko, basebetsimmoho le baahisane, ba hloka kutlwelobohloko le tshehetso ya rona.

src: in the days, weeks and months that lie ahead, we will at times find ourselves despondent and fearful as we see the numbers of people infected and dying continue to rise.
tgt: matsatsing a tlang, dibekeng tse tlang le dikgweding tse tlang, ka dinako tse ding re tla iphumana re nyahame re bile re tshohile ha re ntse re bona manane a batho ba tshwaetsehang le ba shwang a ntse a tswelapele ho eketseha.

src: it may be that things have gotten worse, but we are certain that they will get better.
tgt: ho ka nna ha etsahala hore jwale dintho di mpefetse le ho feta, empa re na le bonnete ba hore di tla boela di ntlafala.

src: our scientists and medical advisers told us that the rate of infections will go up as we move towards our peak.
tgt: baeletsi ba rona ba tsa saense le tsa bongaka ba re bolelletse hore sekgahla sa ditshwaetso se tla nyoloha ha re ntse re atamela qhoweng ya rona.

src: but it will certainly come down.
tgt: empa qetellong se tla boela se theoha.

src: we pay tribute to the healthcare workers who lost their lives caring for the sick.
tgt: re tlotla basebetsi ba tsa bophelo bo botle ba lahlehetsweng ke maphelo a bona ka lebaka la ho hlokomela bakudi.

src: in their memory, let us keep ourselves and our fellow citizens safe by playing our part.
tgt: e le ho ba hopola, ha re ipolokeng re be re boloke le baahi ba habo rona ka ho nka boikarabelo.

src: we shall overcome this virus and rebuild our society.
tgt: re tla e fenya kokwanahloko ena re be re se ahe botjha setjhaba sa habo rona.

src: we have seen darker times and we have prevailed.
tgt: re ile ra feta dinakong tsa lefifi la bonkantjana empa re ile ra di hlola.

src: young farmer receives covid19 support vukuzenzele unnamed nomagcinandile suduka (27) is growing her family’s legacy and wealth by investing in agriculture.
tgt: motjha wa sehwai o fumana tshehetso ya covid19 silusapho nyanda sehwai se thuthuang sa kapa botjhabela ke e mong wa ba fotseng molemo letloleng la mmuso la kimollo ya kokwanahloko ya corona.

src: the o wner of 4 u and 4 me primary cooperative in mooiplaas village received support from the department of agriculture, land reform and rural development’s coronavirus (covid19) relief fund for her egg, livestock and vegetable farm.
tgt: nomagcinandile suduka (27) o hodisa lefa le maruo a habo ka ho itahlela ka setotswana temothuong.

src: the department has awarded r1.2 billion worth of vouchers to farmers in need.
tgt: monga 4 u and 4 me primary cooperative motsaneng wa mooiplaas o fumane tshehetso letloleng la kimollo ya kokwanahloko ya corona (covid19) la lefapha la temothuo, tlha bollo ya mobu le ntshetsopele ya mahae bakeng sa temothuo ya hae ya mahe, diphoofolo le meroho.

src: suduka says her vouchers will help her grow the egg producing side of her business.
tgt: lefapha le nanabeditse divaotjhara tsa boleng ba r1.2 bilione ho dihwai tse hlokang ka sebele.

src: "i received three vouchers totalling r19 000. a voucher for r12 000 to buy layer egg chickens, a voucher for r6 500 to buy feed and a r500 voucher to buy medicines.
tgt: suduka o re divaotjhara tsa hae di tla mo thusa ho hodisa karolo ya tlhahiso ya mahe kgwebong ya hae.

src: suduka, who also farms with 73 goats, 25 sheep and 25 cows, started farming in 2015 after obtaining a public management n6 certificate from ikhala training and vocational education and training college.
tgt: ke vaotjhara ya r12 000 ya ho reka dikgoho tsa mahe tse 100, ebe vaotjhara ya r6 500 ya ho reka dijo tsa dikgoho le vaotjhara ya r500 ya ho reka meriana".

src: after realising that there were not a lot of job opportunities out there, she decided to take over the family’s then subsistence farm and turn it into a profitable business.
tgt: o qadile kgwebo ya hae ya tlhahiso ya mahe ka ho fepa dikgoho tsa habo tsa setho ka phepokgodiso e ntlafatsang ho behela, e di thusang hore di behele mahe le ha di sa kopana le mekoko.

src: magwaza qualified at the university of the witwatersrand in 2019, obtaining an undergraduate degree in construction studies.
tgt: silondiwe magwaza ya dilemo di 23 ya tswang lelapeng le kojwana di mahetleng motsaneng wa kwanongoma, kwazulunatal, o fetile ditshiteng tse ngata hore a fihlelle tabatabelo ya hae ya ho ba molaodi wa dikonteraka.

src: south africa acts to address ventilator shortage silusapho nyanda a locally developed ventilator will help patients with mild covid19 symptoms to breathe easier.
tgt: afrika borwa e nka dikgato tsa ho rarolla qaka ya kgaello ya dithusaphefumoloho silusapho nyanda sethusaphefumoloho se entsweng kwano lapeng se tla thusa bakudi ba nang le matshwao a fokolang a covid19 ho phefumoloha habobebe.

src: the fight against the coronavirus disease (covid19) in south africa has been boosted with the production of the first ventilator made in the country.
tgt: twantsho ya lefu la kokwanahloko ya corona (covid19) afrika borwa e matlafaditswe ke sethusaphefumoloho sa pele se entsweng kahara naha.

src: the continuous positive airway pressure (cpap) ventilator helps patients with mild symptoms of covid19 to breathe easier by providing a mild level of oxygenated air pressure to keep their airways open.
tgt: sethusaphefumoloho sa continuous positive airway pressure (cpap) se thusa bakudi ba nang le matshwao a fokolang a covid19 ho phefumoloha habobebe, ka ho fana ka kgatello e tlase ya moya o nang le oksijene e le ho boloka dipeipi tsa bona tsa moya di bulehile.

src: the ventilator was designed by the council for scientific and industrial research (csir) in collaboration with a number of local partners and will be rolled out nationwide to patients showing respiratory distress in the early phase of covid19 infection.
tgt: sethusaphefumoloho sena se radilwe ke lekgotla la diphuputso tsa saense le indasteri (csir) ka kopanelo le balekane ba bangatanyana ba kwano lapeng, mme se nanabetswa naha ka bophara ho bakudi ba bonahalang ba na le mathata a phefumoloho qalehong ya tshwaetso ya covid19.

src: "the air a person normally breaths has a 23 percent concentration of oxygen.
tgt: "moya oo ka tlwaelo motho a o phefumolohang o na le sekepele sa dipheresente tse 23 tsa oksijene.

src: the cpap ventilator can pump a higher amount of oxygen, helping a person breathe.
tgt: sethusaphefumoloho sa cpap se ka pompa sekepele se phahameng sa oksijene e le ho thusa motho hore a phefumolohe.

src: the cpap pumps continuous concentrated oxygen.
tgt: cpap e pompa motswako wa oksijene motjhaotjhele.

src: you can increase or decrease the amount of oxygen one is breathing in," says executive manager of csir future production: manufacturing martin sanne.
tgt: o ka eketsa kapa wa fokotsa sekgahla sa oksijene eo motho a e phefumolohang," ho rialo molaodi wa phethahatso wa tlhahiso ya kamoso ya csir: manufacturing martin sanne.

src: patients using the ventilator are connected via a face mask.
tgt: bakudi ba sebedisang sethusaphefumoloho ba hokahantswe ke sekwahelasefahleho.

src: oxygen is drawn from an oxygen gas tank and is mixed with natural air in the ventilator, from where it is transmitted to the mask and breathed in by the patient.
tgt: oksijene e hulwa tankeng ya gase ya oksijene mme e tswakwa le moya wa tlhaho o kahara sethusaphefumoloho ebe ho tloha moo e fetisetswa ho sekwahelasefahleho mme mokudi o e phefumolohelwa kahare.

src: sanne says that in addition to pumping oxygenated air, the cpap also helps patients exhale.
tgt: sanne o re kahodimo ho ho pompa moya o nang le oksijene, cpap e boela e thusa bakudi ho phefumolohela ka ntle.

src: the cpap device can be used in both hightech clinical environments and temporary settings, such as field hospitals and quarantine facilities.
tgt: "sesebediswa sa cpap se ka sebediswa ditikolohong tsa bongaka ba botekgeniki bo phahameng esita le dibakeng tsa nakwana, tse kang dipetlele tse thokwana le metse esita le ditsheng tsa tshekeho.

src: sanne says the csir will have produced 10 000 ventilators by the end of august.
tgt: sanne o re csir e tla be e se e hlahisitse dithusaphefumoloho tse 10 000 mafelong a phato.

src: working with siemens, simera, akacia, gabler, umoya and the university of cape town, the csir produced the cpap according to world health organisation standards.
tgt: ka ho sebedisana hammoho le siemens, simera, akacia, gabler, umoya le yunivesithi ya cape town, csir e hlahisitse cpap ho ya ka maemo a beilweng ke mokgatlo wa lefatshe wa bophelo bo botle.

src: the first batch of ventilators will be given to state hospitals experiencing pressure due to the unavailability of equipment to deal with covid19.
tgt: lefupe la pele la dithusaphefumoloho le tla abelwa dipetlele tsa mmuso tse nang le kgatello ka lebaka la kgaello ya disebediswa tsa ho lwantsha covid19.

src: the csir started working on the cpap after the world began experiencing an extreme shortage in ventilators.
tgt: csir e qadile ho sebetsana le cpap kamora hore lefatshe lohle le qale ho ba le kgaello e kgolo ya dithusaphefumoloho.

src: "around march and april, there suddenly became a short supply of ventilators from our international suppliers.
tgt: "e ne e ka ba nakong ya tlhakubele le mmesa moo ka tshohanyetso ho bileng le phepelo e fokolang ya dithusaphefumoloho ho tswa ho bafepedi ba rona ba matjhaba.

src: where you could get them, they were very expensive so government issued a tender for the production of ventilators," says sanne.
tgt: moo o neng o ka di fumana teng, di ne di le theko e phahameng haholo mme ka hona mmuso wa ntsha thendara ya tlhahiso ya dithusaphefumoloho," ho rialo sanne.

src: the tender was part of the government’s national ventilator project within the department of trade, industry and competition.
tgt: thendara e ne e le karolo ya projeke ya naha ya dithusaphefumoloho kahare ho lefapha la kgwebisano, indasteri le tlhodisano.

src: the csir is also working on a bilevel positive airway pressure ventilator aimed at helping patients with more severe symptoms of covid19.
tgt: csir e boetse e sebetsana le ho fumana sethusaphefumoloho sa bilevel positive airway pressure, se reretsweng ho thusa bakudi ba nang le matshwao a mpefetseng a covid19.

src: help stop the spread of covid19 vukuzenzele unnamed our nation is con fronted by the gravest crisis in the history of our democracy.
tgt: thusa ho thibela ho ata ha covid19 vukuzenzele unnamed setjhaba sa habo rona se hlahetswe ke koduwa e kgolo ka ho fetisisa nalaneng ya demokrasi ya rona.

src: for more than 120 days, we have succeeded in delaying the spread of a virus that is causing devastation across the globe.
tgt: ka matsatsi a kahodimo ho 120, re ile ra atleha ho diehisa ho ata ha kokwanahloko ena e bakang qomatsi lefatsheng lohle.

src: but now, the surge in infections that we had been advised by our medical experts would come, has arrived.
tgt: empa jwale nako ya ho eketseha ha ditshwaetso tseo re ileng ra eletswa ka tsona ke ditsebi tsa rona tsa bongaka hore e tla fihla, jwale e fihlile.

src: more than a quarter of a million south africans have been infected with coronavirus, and we know that many more infections have gone undetected.
tgt: maafrika borwa a kahodimo ho kotara ya milione a se a tshwaeditswe ke kokwanahloko ya corona, mme re a tseba le hore ditshwaetso tse ding tse ngata ha di a utollwa.

src: we are now recording over 12,000 new cases every day.
tgt: ha jwale re ba le ditshwaetso tse ntjha tse kahodimo ho 12 000 letsatsi le letsatsi.

src: since the start of the outbreak in march, at least 4,079 people have died from covid19.
tgt: haesale lefu lena le ne le qale ho ropoha ka tlhakubele, ke bonnyane ba batho ba 4 079 ba shweleng ka lebaka la covid19.

src: like the massive cold fronts that sweep into our country from the south atlantic at this time of year, there are few parts of the country that will remain untouched by the coronavirus.
tgt: jwaloka maqhubu a mangata a mohatsela a parolang naha ya rona a hlaha ka borwa ho atlantic nakong ena ya selemo, ho na le dikgutlwana tse mmalwa naheng ya rona tseo kokwanahloko ya corona e sa tlo fihla ho hang ho tsona.

src: the coronavirus storm is far fiercer and more destructive than any we have known before.
tgt: sefefo sa kokwanahloko ya corona se kotsi ebile se ruthutha le ho feta kokwanahloko efe kapa efe eo re kileng ra e tseba.

src: it is stretching our resources and our resolve to their limits.
tgt: e monyolla mehlodi le ditjhelete tsa rona ho isa moo di fellang teng.

src: the surge of infections that our experts and scientists predicted over 3 months ago has now arrived.
tgt: keketseho ya ditshwaetso tseo ditsebi le boramahlale ba rona ba ileng ba e lepa dikgweding tse kahodimo ho tse tharo tse fetileng, jwale e fihlile.

src: it started in the western cape and is now underway in the eastern cape and gauteng.
tgt: e qadile kapa bophirimela mme jwale e ntse e ata kapa botjhabela le gauteng.

src: yet, while infections rise exponentially, it is important to note that our case fatality rate of 1.5 percent is among the lowest in the world.
tgt: empa leha ditshwaetso di eketseha ka potlako hakaalo, ho bohlokwa ho tseba hore sekgahla sa ho shwa ha batho ba habo rona sa 1.5% ke se seng sa tse tlase ka ho fetisisa lefatsheng.

src: this is compared to a global average case fatality rate of 4.4 percent.
tgt: sena ke papisong le sekgahla se tlwaelehileng lefatsheng lohle sa 4.4% ya batho ba shwang.

src: we owe the relatively low number of deaths in our country to the experience and dedication of our health professionals and the urgent measures we have taken to build the capacity of our health system.
tgt: re na le palo ena e tlase ya mafu naheng ya rona ka lebaka la boiphihlelo le boikitlaetso ba diporofeshenale tsa rona tsa bophelo bo botle, esita le mehato ya tshohanyetso eo re e nkileng ho aha bokgoni ba tsamaiso ya rona ya bophelo bo botle.

src: even as most of our people have taken action to prevent the spread of the virus, there are others who have not.
tgt: leha boholo ba batho ba habo rona ba nkile dikgato tsa ho thibela ho ata ha kokwanahloko ena, ho na le ba bang ba sa itshwenyang ka ho etsa jwalo.

src: there are some among us who ignore the regulations that have been passed to combat the disease.
tgt: ho na le ba bang kahara rona mona ba sa natseng melawana e beilweng ya ho kgina lefu lena.

src: in the midst of such a pandemic, getting into a taxi without a face mask, gathering to meet friends, attending parties or even visiting family, can too easily spread the virus and cost lives.
tgt: setsiketsing sa sewa sena, ho kena ka tekesing ho sa kenngwa sekwahelanko le molomo, mmoka wa ho teana le metswalle, ho ya meketjaneng kapa hona ho etela ba leloko, ho ka akofisa ho ata ha kokwanahloko ena habobebe ho be ho fete le maphelo a batho.

src: this may be a disease that is caused by a virus, but it is spread by human conduct and behaviour.
tgt: lena e ka nna ya eba lefu leo sesosa sa lona e leng kokwanahloko, empa lona le ata ka lebaka la boitshwaro ba batho.

src: through our own actions – as individuals, as families, as communities – we can and we must change the course of this pandemic in our country.
tgt: ka diketso tsa rona, re le batho ka bomong, re le malapa, re le setjhaba, re ka kgona ebile re tlameha ho fetola ho ata ha sewa sena naheng ya rona.

src: we need to wear a cloth mask that covers our nose and mouth whenever we leave home.
tgt: re lokela ho rwala sekwahelanko le molomo sa lesela se kwahelang nko le molomo kgafetsa ha re tloha malapeng.

src: we must continue to regularly wash our hands with soap and water or sanitiser.
tgt: re lokela ho tswela pele ho hatlela matsoho a rona ka metsi le sesepa kapa ka sebolayadikokwanahloko kgafetsa .

src: we must continue to clean and sanitise all surfaces in all public spaces.
tgt: re tlameha ho tswela pele ho hlwekisa le ho nyanyatsa bokahodimo ba dibaka tsohle, dibakeng tsohle tseo ho phetheselang setjhaba ho tsona.

src: most importantly, we must keep a safe distance – of at least 2 metres – from other people.
tgt: taba ya bohlokwa ka ho fetisisa ke ya hore re tlameha ho siya sebaka se bolokehileng sa bonyane ba dimithara tse pedi dipakeng tsa rona le batho ba bang.

src: there is now emerging evidence that the virus may also be carried in tiny particles in the air in places that are crowded, closed or have poor air circulation.
tgt: jwale ho na le bopaki bo botjha ba hore kokwanahloko ena e ka nna ya fetiswa ka dikarolwana tse nyenyane haholo tse moyeng dibakeng tseo ho tsona ho subuhlellaneng batho, tse kwalehileng kapa tse nang le lephallo le fokolang la moya.

src: for this reason we must immediately improve the indoor environment of public places where the risk of infection is greatest.
tgt: ka lebaka lena, re tlameha ho ntlafatsa bokahare ba tikoloho ya dibaka tse phetheselang batho, moo kotsi ya tshwaetso e leng kgolo ka ho fetisisa.

src: our decision to declare a nationwide lockdown prevented a massive early surge of infections when our health services were less prepared, which would have resulted in a far greater loss of lives.
tgt: qeto ya rona ya ho phatlalatsa ho kginwa ha metsamao ya batho le ditshebeletso tseo e seng tsa mantlha naha ka bophara, e ile ya thibela sekgahla se hodimo sa keketseho ya ditshwaetso di sa tloha ha ditshebeletso tsa rona tsa bophelo bo botle di ne di so loke hantle, e leng ntho e neng e ka baka ho shwa ha batho ba bangata le ho feta.

src: in the time that we had, we have taken important measures to strengthen our health response.
tgt: ka nako eo re bileng le yona, re nkile mehato ya bohlokwa ya ho matlafatsa karabelo ya rona mabapi le bophelo bo botle.

src: we have conducted more than two million coronavirus tests and community health workers have done more than 20 million screenings.
tgt: re se re entse diteko tsa kokwanahloko ya corona tse kahodimo ho dimilione tse pedi mme basebeletsi ba setjhaba ba tsa bophelo bo botle ba se ba entse ditlhahlobo tse kahodimo ho dimilione tse 20. re fumane dibethe tse ka bang 28 000 tsa dipetlele bakeng sa bakudi ba covid19 ra ba ra aha dipetlele tse sebetsang tse thokwana le metse ho pharalla le naha.

src: we have made available almost 28,000 hospital beds for covid19 patients and have constructed functional field hospitals across the country.
tgt: jwale re na le dibethe tsa tshekeho tse kahodimo ho 37 000 ditsing tsa kokelo tsa poraefete esita le tsa setjhaba ho pharalla le naha, mme di malalaalaotswe ho tsheka bao ba sa kgoneng ho itsheka malapeng a bona.

src: we now have over 37,000 quarantine beds in private and public facilities across the country, ready to isolate those who cannot do so at home.
tgt: re ile ra fumana ra ba ra fana ka dimilione tsa thepa ya boitshireletso dipetleleng, ditleliniking le dikolong ho pharalla le naha ho basebetsi ba habo rona ba tshwereng teu.

src: we have procured and delivered millions of items of personal protective equipment to hospitals, clinics and schools across the country to protect our frontline workers.
tgt: re thaothile ebile re ntse re tswela pele ho thaotha baoki ba tlatsetso, dingaka le basebetsi ba ditshebeletso tsa tshohanyetso tsa bophelo bo botle.

src: we continue to make progress in our efforts to deal with covid 19, but our greatest challenge still lies ahead.
tgt: re tswela pele ho etsa kgatelopele mekutung ya rona ya ho lwantsha covid 19, empa phephetso ya rona e kgolo e sa ntse e tla.

src: across all provinces, we are working to further increase the number of general ward and critical beds available for covid19 patients.
tgt: diprovenseng tsohle, re sebeletsa hore re boele re eketse lenane la diphaposi tse akaretsang tsa bakudi esita le hore dibethe tsa bohlokwa di fumanehe bakeng sa bakudi ba covid19.

src: ward capacity is being freed up in a number of hospitals by delaying nonurgent care, the conversion of some areas of hospitals into additional ward space and the erection or expansion of field hospitals.
tgt: bokgoni ba diphaposi tsa bakudi bo ekeditswe dipetleleng tse ngata ka hore ho diehiswe tlhokomelo e sa potlakang hakaalo, le ho fetola dikarolo tse ding tsa sepetlele hore e be diphaposi tse ding tsa bakudi esita le ho aha kapa ho atolosa dipetlele tse thokwana le metse.

src: we are working to increase supplies of oxygen, ventilators and other equipment for those who will need critical care, including by diverting the supply of oxygen from other purposes.
tgt: re sebetsana le ho eketsa phepelo ya oksijene, ya dithusaphefumoloho le thepa e nngwe bakeng sa bao ba tla hloka tlhokomelo e hlokolotsi, ho akga le ya ho faposwa ha phepelo ya oksijene e reretsweng mabaka a mang.

src: we are deploying digital technologies to strengthen the identification, tracing and isolation of contacts, and to provide support to those who test positive.
tgt: re sebedisa mekgwa ya theknoloji ya dijithale ho matlafatsa boitsebahatso, ho fofonela le ho kgethela ba ileng ba atamelana le batshwaetsuwa, esita le hona ho fana ka tshehetso ho bao diteko di reng ba fela ba na le tshwaetso.

src: as we now approach the peak of infections, we need to take extra precautions and tighten existing measures to slow down the rate of transmission.
tgt: ha e le mona re atamela sehlohlolong sa ditshwaetso, re lokela ho ba sedi haholo re be re tiise mehato e seng e le teng ya ho sisithehisa sekgahla sa tshwaetsano.

src: regulations on the wearing of masks will be strengthened.
tgt: melawana ya ho kenya dikwahelanko le molomo e tla matlafatswa.

src: employers, shop owners and managers, public transport operators, and managers and owners of any other public building are now legally obliged to ensure that anyone entering their premises or vehicle must be wearing a mask.
tgt: bahiri, beng ba mabenkele le baokamedi, balaodi ba dipalangwang tsa setjhaba, le baokamedi kapa beng ba moaho ofe kapa ofe oo ho phetheselang setjhaba ho ona, jwale ba tlangwa ke molao hore ba etse bonnete ba hore mang kapa mang ya kenang meahong kapa makoloing a bona, o tlameha ho kenya sekwahelanko le molomo.

src: taxis undertaking local trips will now be permitted to increase their capacity to 100 percent, while long distance taxis will not be allowed to exceed 70 percent occupancy, on condition that new risk mitigation protocols related to masks, vehicle sanitising and open windows are followed.
tgt: ditekesi tse potolohang haufinyane jwale di tla dumellwa ho eketsa sekepele sa bapalami hore di tlale tswete, ha ditekesi tsa maeto a malelele tsona di sa tlo dumellwa ho palamisa bapalami ba kahodimo ho lenane le etsang 70%, ha feela ho latelwa ditsamaiso tse ntjha tsa thibelo ya kotsi tse amanang le dikwahelanko le molomo, ho nyanyatsa makoloi ka dibolayadikokwanahloko le ho bula difenstere.

src: there is now clear evidence that the resumption of alcohol sales has resulted in substantial pressure being put on hospitals, including trauma and icu units, due to motor vehicle accidents, violence and related trauma.
tgt: jwale ho na le bopaki bo totobetseng ba hore ho bulelwa ha thekiso ya jwala ho bakile kgatello e matla dipetleleng, ho kenyeletswa le diyuniting tsa dikotsi le tsa ba kulang haholo tsa icu, ka lebaka la dikotsi tsa makoloi, dikgoka le dikotsi tse amanang le tseo.

src: we have therefore decided that in order to conserve hospital capacity, the sale, dispensing and distribution of alcohol will be suspended with immediate effect.
tgt: kahoo re entse qeto ya hore, hore re boloke bokgoni ba dipetlele, thekiso, le thomello le kanetso ya jwala e tla kwalwa hanghang.

src: as an additional measure to reduce the pressure on hospitals, a curfew will be put in place between the hours of 9pm and 4am.
tgt: e le mohato o ekeditsweng wa ho fokotsa kgatello dipetleleng, ho tla ba le thibelo ya motsamao dipakeng tsa hora ya borobong bosiu le hora ya bone hoseng.

src: we are taking these measures fully aware that they impose unwelcome restrictions on people’s lives.
tgt: re nka mehato ena re tseba hantle hore e qobella dithibelo tse sa amohelehang maphelong a batho.

src: they are, however, necessary to see us through the peak of the disease.
tgt: empa leha ho le jwalo, mehato ena e a hlokeha hore re ipone re fetile sehlohlolong sa lefu lena.

src: there is no way that we can avoid the coronavirus storm.
tgt: ha ho kamoo re ka se qobang kateng sefefo sena sa kokwanahloko ya corona.

src: but we can limit the damage that it can cause to our lives.
tgt: empa re ka e fokotsa tshenyo eo se ka e bakang maphelong a rona.

src: as a nation we have come together to support each other, to provide comfort to those who are ill and to promote acceptance of people living with the virus.
tgt: re le setjhaba re ikentse kgokanyana phiri ka sepheo sa ho tshehetsana, ho tshedisa bao ba kulang esita le ho kgothaletsa kamohelo ya batho ba seng ba tshwaeditswe ke kokwanahloko ena.

src: now, more than ever, we are responsible for the lives of those around us.
tgt: hona jwale, ho feta neng kapa neng, re na le boikarabelo ka maphelo a bao ba mathokong a rona.

src: crew juliet firefighter shares her story dale hes young firefighter vuyiseka arendse (26) is part of crew juliet, south africa’s first allfemale wildland firefighting team.
tgt: moifo wa ditimamollo wa crew juliet o pheta pale ya hae dale hes basadi ba tlameha ho ba bopulamadiboho ba tsa ho tima mollo, ho rialo setimamollo sena.

src: her strength and determination to make a name for herself in the maledominated world of firefighting is a true inspiration to all women.
tgt: motjha eo e leng setimamollo, vuyiseka arendse ya dilemo di 26, ke karolo ya moifo wa juliet oo e leng moifo wa pele wa basadi feela ba timang mollo wa hlaha.

src: arendse grew up in the small western cape town of beaufort west.
tgt: arendse o holetse torotswaneng ya beaufort west kapa bophirimela.

src: after school, she tried studying at a college in oudtshoorn, but decided to move back home to support her family.
tgt: kamora dithuto tsa hae tsa sekolo, o ile a leka ho ntshetsa dithuto pele kholetjheng ya oudtshoorn, empa a etsa qeto ya hore a kgutlele habo ho ya tshehetsa lelapa labo.

src: she worked at a supermarket for a while, but then firefighting caught her eye.
tgt: o ile a sebetsa suphamaketeng nakwana empa a kgahlwa ke mosebetsi wa ho tima mollo.

src: "i saw the firefighters in their uniforms and the big red trucks.
tgt: "ke ile ka bona ditimamollo di apare diyunifomo di tsamaya ka dilori tse kgolo tse kgubedu.

src: i immediately became interested and wanted to find out more," says arendse.
tgt: ke ile ka ba le thahasello hanghang ka ba ka labalabela ho ba le tsebo e tomanyana," ho rialo arendse.

src: arendse was one of the graduates of the western cape government’s chrysalis academy youth development programme in 2016. after the programme, she worked at the fire station in beaufort west, earning only r1 900 per month.
tgt: arendse e ne e le e mong wa baithuti ba pejana ba lenaneo la 2016 la ntshetsopele ya batjha la akhademi ya chrysalis la mmuso wa kapa bophirimela.

src: but then she came across an opportunity offered by ncc environmental services last year.
tgt: empa jwale o ile a fumana monyetla o neng o fanwa ke ba ncc environmental services ngwahola.

src: "i was at chrysalis academy as a facilitator when ncc came to talk to the students about the opportunity to apply for training for the first allfemale wildland firefighting team.
tgt: "ke ne ke le mohlophisi akhademing ya chrysalis ha ba ncc ba fihla ho tla buisana le baithuti mabapi le monyetla wa ho etsa kopo ya kwetliso bakeng sa moifo wa pele wa basadi feela ho tsa ho tima hlaha.

src: even though i was not one of the students, i was very interested and applied for the training, and i was accepted," arendse says.
tgt: le hoja ke ne ke se karolo ya baithuti bana, ke ile ka ba le thahasello yaba ke etsa kopo ya ho fumantshwa kwetliso mme ka amohelwa," ho rialo arendse.

src: arendse went through the training, which combined theory and practical aspects of firefighting.
tgt: arendse o ile a fumana kwetliso e neng e kenyeleditse dithuto tsa bukeng esita le ho tshwariswa ha matsoho twantshong ya ho tima mollo.

src: "i learnt so much.
tgt: "ke ithutile boholo.

src: for one, i didn’t know that there were firefighters tasked with putting out wildfires.
tgt: nna ka bonna, ke ne ke sa tsebe hore ho na le ditimamollo tse reretsweng ho tima mollo wa hlaha.

src: i had previously thought they only worked in towns to put out fires in buildings," she says.
tgt: ke ne ke ntse ke nahana hore ba sebetsa feela ditoropong ho tima mollo meahong e tjhang," o rialo.

src: arendse adds that it was an amazing feeling to pass the training and become part of the first allfemale firefighting team of its kind.
tgt: arendse o eketsa ka hore o ile a ikutlwa a thabile haholo ka ho atleha kwetlisong ena esita le ho ba e mong wa moifo wa pele wa basadi feela wa mofuta wa ona wa ditimamollo.

src: "i felt very excited, especially because when i had told people i wanted to be a firefighter, many of them said i could not do it because i am a woman and would not cope with the job.
tgt: "ke ile ka ikutlwa ke nyakalletse, haholoholo hobane ha ke ne ke bolella batho hore ke batla ho ba setimamollo, ba bangata ba bona ba ile ba re nke ke ka kgona ho etsa mosebetsi oo hobane ke mosadi ebile nke ke ka o besa wa tuka mosebetsing oo.

src: this pushed me to show them that i can actually do it, not only for myself but for the rest of the women in south africa.
tgt: hona ho ile ha ntsosa molota hore ke ba bontshe hore nka o etsa, e seng feela bakeng sa ka empa le ka lebaka la basadi bohle ba afrika borwa."

src: "arendse says that fighting her first major fire in noordhoek was a challenging but highly rewarding experience.
tgt: arendse o re mosebetsi wa hae wa pele wa ho lwantshana le mollo o matla noordhoek o ne o phephetsa haholo, empa e ile ya eba malebela a kgothatsang haholo.

src: "it was my first full 24hour shift and the first time we were working with all the other male firefighters.
tgt: "e ne e le lekgetlo la pele ke sebetsa ka dihora tse 24 ebile e ne e le lekgetlo la pele re sebetsa le banna ba bang bohle ba ditimamollo.

src: it was tiring and very hot in our protective gear but we finished the job and the feeling afterwards was very rewarding.
tgt: ho ne ho qeta matla ebile ho tjhesa haholo ka lebaka la diaparo tsa rona tsa boitshireletso, empa re ile ra o qeta mosebetsi mme kamora moo re ile ra ikutlwa re kgotsofetse haholo.

src: "arendse encourages the women of south africa to never underestimate themselves.
tgt: "arendse o kgothaletsa basadi ba afrika borwa hore ba se ke ba ikgella fatshe le ka mohla.

src: "don’t be defined by what people say you can and can’t do."
tgt: "le se ke la laolwa ke seo batho ba reng le ka se etsa kapa le ke ke la se etsa."

src: celebrating women through economic inclusion vukuzenzele unnamed in august south africa celebrates women’s month.
tgt: re keteka basadi ka kenyeletso re keteka basadi ka kenyeletso ya bona moruongya bona moruong vukuzenzele unnamed ka phato afrika borwa e keteteka kgwedi ya basadi.

src: this occasion marks the anniversary of the day in 1956 when 20,000 women marched to the union buildings – a great sea of womankind speaking many languages, from different places and of all races.
tgt: keteko ena e tshwaya sehopotso sa letsatsi la 1956 ha basadi ba 20 000 ba ne ba hwanta mane union buildings – phallo e kgolokgolo ya batho ba basadi ba neng ba bua dipuo tse fapaneng, ba tswa dibakeng tse fapaneng mme e le ba merabe e fapaneng.

src: they were united in their demand for an end to the dreaded pass laws and for their right to live in freedom.
tgt: ba ile ba kopana boitsekong ba bona ba ho fedisa melao ya dipasa e nyarosang le ho fumana tokelo ya bona ya ho phela tokolohong.

src: the status and position of women in south africa today is vastly different to that faced by our mothers and grandmothers in 1956. we have come a long way in realising a south africa that is nonracial, nonsexist, democratic, prosperous and free.
tgt: boemo le maemo a basadiafrika borwa kajeno a se a fapane haholo ha o a bapisa le ao a neng a tobane le bomme le bonkgono ba rona ka 1956. re tswa hole hore re fihlelle afrika borwa e hlokang kgethollo ya merabe, kgethollo ya bong, e nang le demokrasi, e nang le katleho mme e lokolohile.

src: there has been real progress in improving the lives of south african women in the economy, in the political sphere and in public life.
tgt: ho bile le kgatelopele ya nnete ntlafatsong ya maphelo a basadi ba afrika borwa moruong, lekaleng la dipolotiki le phedisanong ya setjhaba.

src: at the same time, we know there is so much further we still have to go.
tgt: le ha ho ntse ho le jwalo, re a tseba hore ho ntse ho ena le tse ngata tseo re tlamehang ho di fihlella.

src: women still face discrimination, harassment and violence, and bear the greatest brunt of poverty.
tgt: basadi ba ntse ba tobana le kgethollo, tlhekefetso le ho ketekwa, mme ke bona ba futsanehileng ka ho fetisisa.

src: if we are to truly realise the promise of our constitution we have to tackle the economic and financial exclusion that makes women more vulnerable to abuse and violence.
tgt: haeba ka nnete re batla fihlella tshepiso ya molaotheo wa rona re tlameha ho lwantshana le dikgato tse etsang hore basadi ba se kgone ho iketsetsa lekeno le dijthelete e leng tsona etseng hore basadi ba iphumane ba mamelletse tlhekefetso ho ketekwa.

src: we have joined a groundbreaking campaign that links us to global efforts to achieve gender equality by 2030. generation equality is an ambitious and transformative agenda to end discrimination and violence against women and for their equal participation in political, social and economic life.
tgt: re kene letsholong le itlhommeng pele le re kopantshang le maiteko a matjhabeng a ho fihlella tekatekano ya bong ka 2030. tekatekano ya moloko ke tabatabelo le phethoho ya ajenda ya ho fedisa kgethollo le dikgoka kgahlano le basadi le ho ba le seabo se tshwanang dipolotiking, le maphelong a bona le moruong.

src: as part of this campaign, we have joined two ‘action coalitions’, one for economic justice and rights and another against genderbased violence.
tgt: jwalo ka karolo ya letsholo lena, re kopantshitse ‘diketso tsa tshebedisano’ tse pedi, ya pele e leng ya tokoloho ya moruo le ditokelo mme enngwe ke e kgahlano le dikgoka ho basadi (gbv).

src: both of these themes are critical to our own national agenda.
tgt: bobedi mekotaba ena e hlokolotsi ho ajenda ya naha ya rona.

src: eleven months since the emergency response action plan to combat genderbased violence and femicide was implemented we have made progress in expanding support and care to survivors, and progress is being made in legal reforms to afford them greater protection.
tgt: dikgwedi tse 11 esale re phethahaditse moralo wa ketso tsa karabelo ya tshohanyetso ho lwantsha dikgoka tsa bong le dipolao tsa basadi (gbvf) re se re bile le kgatelopele ho atoloseng tshehetso le ho tsotella mahlatsipa, mme kgatelopele e entsweng ho tsa tlhabollo ya molao e ba nehela tshireletso e ngata haholo.

src: during the month of august, we begin the implementation of the national strategic plan to combat genderbased violence and femicide.
tgt: kgwedi ya phato, re qala ka phethahatso ya moralo wa lewa la naha la ho lwantsha gbvf.

src: a key aspect of the plan is on ensuring greater women’s financial inclusion.
tgt: ntlha e ka sehlohlolong ya moralo ona ke ho netefatsa hore basadi ba bangata ba kenyeletswa boholo mo moruo.

src: this is because economic inequality and social inequality are interconnected.
tgt: sena ke hobane tlhokeho ya tekatekano ya moruo le tlhokeho ya tekatekano ya phedisano di a nyallana.

src: the economic status of women in south africa makes them more vulnerable to abuse.
tgt: maemo a ditjhelete a basadi afrika borwa a ba beha kotsing e kgolokgolo ya tlhekefetso.

src: we must therefore scale up support for women to enable them to become financially independent.
tgt: ka hoo, re tlameha ho tshehetsa basadi ho etsa hore ba kgone ho ikemela le ho iketsetsa tjhelete ya bona.

src: we have made a number of commitments under generation equality that will be given effect to through the national strategic plan.
tgt: re entse boitlamo bo mmalwa tlasa tekatekano ya moloko e tla phethahatswang ka moralo wa lewa la naha.

src: firstly, we are going to drive women’s economic inclusion through public procurement.
tgt: ya pele, re tlo kenyeletsa seabo sa basadi moruong ka diphu mantsho tsa mmuso.

src: we have set the target of ensuring that at least 40 percent of goods and services procured by public entities are sourced from womenowned businesses.
tgt: re entse boipehelo ba ho netefatsa hore bonyane 40% ya dihlahiswa le ditshebeletso tse fumantshwang ke dikgwebo tsa mmuso di tswa dikgwebong tsa basadi.

src: secondly, we are going to scale up support for womenowned smmes and for women who work in the informal sector or are unemployed.
tgt: ya bobedi, re tlo eketsa tshehetso ya dikgwebo tse nyanyane, tse bohareng le tse kgolo (dismme) tse laolwang ke basadi mmoho le dikgwebo tse thuthuhang tse laolwang ke basadi kapa tsa basadi ba sa sebetseng.

src: this will include engagement with the financial sector to make financial services accessible and affordable for women.
tgt: hona ho tla kenyeletsa dipuisano le lekala la ditjhelete ho etsa hore ditshebeletso tsa ditjhelete di fumanehe ha bobebe ka theko e tlase ho basadi.

src: thirdly, we want to ensure more women have access to productive assets such as land.
tgt: ya boraro, re batla ho netefatsa hore basadi ba bangata ba fumana thepa ya bohlokwa e jwalo ka lefatshe.

src: it is essential that women are beneficiaries of the accelerate land reform programme.
tgt: ho bohlokwa hore basadi ba fumane molemo ho tswa potlakisong ya ho kgutlisetswa lefatshe.

src: it is significant that of the r75 million in covid19 relief earmarked for farming input vouchers 53 percent of the beneficiaries will be rural women.
tgt: ho tshwanehile hore karolo ya r75 milione ya divaotjhara tsa matlole a dithuso a covid19 a tshwaetsweng tlhahiso ya temo 53% e be molemong wa basadi ba mahaeng.

src: we must ensure that women subsistence and smallscale farmers continue to receive support beyond the pandemic.
tgt: re tlameha ho netefatsa hore tshehetso ya basadi le rapolasi/mmapolasi ba ithuthuhang ba tswella ho fumantshwa tshehetso le ka mora sewa sena.

src: fourthly, we want to ensure that women are protected from genderbased violence in the workplace.
tgt: ya bone, re batla ho netefatsa hore basadi ba tshireletsehile kgahlano le gbv mesebetsing.

src: in this regard, we will be working at a national and regional level towards the ratification of the ilo convention on violence and harassment in the workplace.
tgt: ntlheng ena, re tla tswella ho sebetsa boemong ba naha le lebatowa ho tshwaela monwana seboka sa mokgatlo wa matjhaba (ilo) wa mosebetsi sadikgako le tlhekefetso mesebetsing.

src: it is said that freedom is not given, but taken.
tgt: ho thwe tokoloho ha e nehelwe, e ya nkwa.

src: the emancipation of women is only words on paper unless it is matched by commitment from all sectors of society.
tgt: tokollo ya basadi ke mantswe feela a pampering ntle le haeba e tsamaelana le boitlamo bo tswang ho makala ohle a setjhaba.

src: as we prepare for the reconstruction of our economy in the wake of the coronavirus pandemic, we have said that we cannot simply return to where we were before the outbreak of the virus.
tgt: ha re itukisetsa kahobotjha ya moruo wa rona hara sewa sa kokwanahloko ya corona , re itse ha ho sa kgonanahale hore re ka kgutlela setlwaeding sa pele kokwanahloko e phahlalla.

src: we must build a fundamentally different economy which, among other things, substantially improves the material position of women.
tgt: re tlameha ho theha moruo o motheo wa ona o fapaneng ka, ho tse ding tsa dintho, ho ntlafatsa boemo ba leruo la basadi.

src: this means that our investment in infrastructure must support not only the development of local industry, but also womenowned businesses.
tgt: hona ho bolela hore botsetedi ba moralo wa motheo bo tlameha ho tshehetsa eseng feela ntshetsopele ya indastri ya lehae, empa le dikgwebo tsa basadi.

src: it must deliberately create employment opportunities for women in all stages of planning, financing, building and maintaining infrastructure.
tgt: e tlameha ho ikemisetsa ho theha menyetla ya mesebetsi molemong wa basadi mekgahlelong kaofela ya ho rala, ya ditjhelete, ya kaho le ya ho disa meralo ya motheo.

src: by the same measures, as we scale up our public employment programmes, we must ensure that young women in particular are identified as participants.
tgt: ka mekgwa e tshwanang, re tla phahamisa mananeo a rona a khiro makaleng a mmuso, re tlameha ho netefatsa hore boholo ba dikgarabe e ba tsona tse thongwang.. hodima lekeno, mananeo ana a tla ba nehela monyetla wa ho fumana boitsebelo le boiphihlelo bo hlokehang ho kena moruong wa sehlohlolo.

src: as much as it is government’s responsibility to provide economic opportunities for women and create an enabling framework for advancing gender equality, everyone in society needs to play their part.
tgt: le ha feela e le maikarabelo a mmuso ho nehela ka menyetla ya moruo ho basadi ho theha leano la tshebetso le tla bakang hore ho ntlafatswe tekatekano ya bong, bohle setjhabeng ba tlameha ho bapala karolo ya bona.

src: businesses must support womenowned enterprises in the procurement of goods and services.
tgt: dikgwebo di tlameha ho tshehetsa dikgwebo tsa basadi ka ho reka dihlahiswa le ditshebeletso dikgwebong tsa bona.

src: they should employ more women and appoint more women to management positions.
tgt: ba tlameha ho hira basadi ba bangata le ho thonya basadi ba bangata maemong a bolaodi.

src: this is all the more important considering that the private sector’s record on genderrepresentation at management level lags behind that of the public sector.
tgt: sena se bohlokwa haholoholo ha o sheba direkoto tsa lekala la poraefete boemong ba kemedi ya bong e saletseng morao ha o bapisa le lekala la mmuso.

src: this is an issue that is repeatedly raised in engagements i have had with a number of women’s business organisations.
tgt: bona ke bothata bo hlahellang kgafetsa dipuisanong tseo ke bileng le tsona le boholo ba mekgatlo ya dikgwebo tsa basadi.

src: by equal measure, we must eliminate gender disparities in pay for men and women, and give effect to the principle of equal pay for equal work contained in the employment equity act.
tgt: hore ho be le tekatekano re tshwanetse ho fedisa setlwaedi sa mekgolo e e sa lekalekaneng ho ya ka hore motho ke monna kapa mosadi, mme re itlwaetse ho lefa batho ba entseng mosebetsi o tshwanang ka ho lekalekana jwalo ka ho totobaditswe molaong wa tekatekano ya mese betsing.

src: women must also be protected from harassment and discrimination in the workplace.
tgt: basadi ba tlameha ho tshireletswa kgahlano le tlhekefetso le kgethollo mosebetsing.

src: it is up to transport operators, university administrators, school governing bodies and religious organisations to create conditions for women and girls to travel, study and worship in safety.
tgt: ke boikarabelo ba batsamaisi ba dipalangwang, ba tsamaiso ya diyunivesithi, makgotla a taolo ya dikolo le mekgatlo ya tumelo ho theha maemo a tshireletsehileng molemong wa basadi le bananyana ha ba le maetong, dithutong le dikerekeng.

src: we must forge ahead with our efforts to eradicate chauvinism, sexism and patriarchy.
tgt: re tlameha ho hatelapele ka maiteko a rona a ho qeta kgatello ka banna, kgethollo ya basadi le ho fa banna maemo a ho ba dihloho.

src: it is these attitudes that enable the oppression of women.
tgt: ke mehopolo ena e bakang kgatello ya basadi.

src: it is up to us – both men and women – to affirm that a woman’s value, position and opinions are no less than that of a man.
tgt: ho ho rona – banna le basadi bobedi – ho netefatsa hore boleng ba mosadi, boemo le maikutlo a hae ha a ka tlase ho a monna.

src: it is up to us as parents and grandparents to treat and raise our sons and our daughters the same.
tgt: ke boikarabelo ba rona jwalo ka batswadi le bonkgono le bontatemoholo ho tshwarwa le ho hodisa bara le baradi ka mokgwa o tshwanang.

src: it is up to us as men to reject and speak out against genderbased violence wherever we see it, even if it is against our friends, fathers or brothers.
tgt: ho ho rona jwalo ka banna ho hana le ho bua kgahlano le diketso tsa gbv moo re di bonang, le haeba ke kgahlano le metswalle, bontate le boabuti ba rona.

src: let us be the generation that ends the oppression of women in all its forms, in our lifetime.
tgt: ha re beng moloko o tla fedisang kgatello ya basadi ka tsela efe kapa efe, nakong ya rona.

src: the brave generation of 1956 marched for us all.
tgt: moloko wa 1956 o ile wa itseka molemong wa rona bohle.

src: back to work after covid19 a full guide allison cooper when can you return to work if you have tested positive for the coronavirus (covid19)?
tgt: ho kgutlela mosebetsing ka mora ho tshwarwa ke covid19 allison cooper ka kgutlela mosebetsing neng ka mora ho tshwarwa ke kokwanahloko ya corona (covid19)?

src: the national institute for communicable diseases has the answers you need.
tgt: institjhuti ya naha ya mahlo ko a tshwaetsanang e na le dikarabo tseo o di hlokang.

src: when i test positive for covid19, how long do i have to stay in isolation?
tgt: ha ke fumana sephetho se ha ke fumana sephetho se reng ke na le reng ke na le covid19covid19 , ke , ke tlamahe ho dula boikgethotlamahe ho dula boikgethollong nako e kae?

src: people who test positive for covid19, but don’t have any symptoms, must remain in isolation at home or in a government isolation facility for 10 days, from the day they receive their positive test result.
tgt: batho ba fumanang sephetho se reng ba na le covid19 , empa ba sena matshwao ho hang, ba tlameha ho dula boikgethollong lapeng kapa ditsing tsa boikge thollo tsa mmuso ka matsatsi a 10, ho tloha ka letsatsi leo ba fumaneng sephetho sa bona se reng ba tshwaetsehile.

src: those who have mild symptoms must remain in isolation at home or in a government isolation facility for 10 days, from the day their symptoms start.
tgt: bao ba nang le matshwao mahareng ba tlameha ho tswella ho dula boikgethollong lapeng kapa setsing sa boikgethollo ba mmuso ka matsatsi a 10, ho tloha ka letsatsi leo matshwao a bona a qalang ho bonahala.

src: those who have severe disease, who have to go to hospital, must remain in isolation for 10 days, from when they are stable and don’t need oxygen anymore.
tgt: bao ba nang le tshwaetso e mpehadi, ba tlamehang ho ya sepetlele, ba tlameha ho dula boikgethollong ka matsatsi a 10, ho tloha ha ba se ba ena le botsitsa mme ba se ba sa hloke ho fepelwa oksejene.

src: how can a covid19 positive people transfer the disease to others?
tgt: batho ba nang le batho ba nang le covid19covid19 ba ka tshwaetsa ba bang ka ba ka tshwaetsa ba bang ka lefu lena jwang?

src: according to health minister zweli mkhize, most people who have a mild infection can spread the virus for between seven to 12 days.
tgt: ho ya ka letona la bophelo bo botle ngaka zweli mkhize, boholo ba batho ba nang le tshwaetso e mahareng ba ka atisa kokwanahloko dipakeng tsa matsatsi a supileng ho ya ho a 12. empa, batho ba kulang haholo ba ka tshwaetsa ba bang le ho kgona ho fetisetsa kokwanahloko ho ba bang ka nako e telele.

src: however, people who become very sick could be infectious and be able to transmit the virus to others for a longer period of time.
tgt: na ke tlameha ho etsa teko na ke tlameha ho etsa teko enngwe hape ya enngwe hape ya covid19covid19 , , ho bontsha hore ha ke sana ho bontsha hore ha ke sana tshwaetso, pele nka kgutlela tshwaetso, pele nka kgutlela mosebetsing?

src: retesting people who have experienced mild illness and have recovered is not recommended.
tgt: ho hlahloba lekgehlo la bobedi batho ba neng ba ena le bohloko bo mahareng mme ba fodile ha ho kgothaletswe.

src: a person is considered safe to return to work and come out of isolation if they are no longer infectious.
tgt: motho o nkwa a bolokelehile ho kgutlela mosebetsing le ho tswa boikgethollong haeba a se a sena tshwaetso.

src: this means they developed their first symptoms more than 10 days ago and have not had any symptoms for at least three days.
tgt: hona ho bolela hore ba bile le matshwao a bona a pele matsatsing a fetang a 10 a fetileng mme ha ba soka ba eba le matshwao afe kapa afe ka matsatsi a mararo bonyane.

src: in most cases, employees can return to work without testing again if: they have completed 10 days of mandatory quarantine or selfisolation.
tgt: boholo ba nako, basebetsi ba ka kgutlela mosebetsing ntle le ho etsa diteko lekgehlo la bobedi haeba: ba phethetse matsatsi a 10 a setlamo a khwarantine kapa a boikgethollo.

src: those who had moderate or severe symptoms undergo a medical evaluation.
tgt: bao ba bileng le matshwao a mahareng kapa a mpehadi mme ba kena tlasa tekolo ya bongaka.

src: they continue to practice personal hygiene and social distancing.
tgt: ba tswella ho ikamantsha le boitlhwekiso le ho sielana sebaka.

src: the employer monitors the worker to ensure they do not regress.
tgt: bahiri ba beha mosebetsi leihlo ho netefatsa hore ha ba kule hape.

src: they wear a mask, from the date of diagnosis for at least 21 days.
tgt: ba rwala maske, ho tloha ka letsatsi la ho etsa diteko ho fihla matsatsi a 21 bonyane.

src: i have tested negative but i still have symptoms.
tgt: sephetho sa diteko tsa ka ha sephetho sa diteko tsa ka ha sena tshwaetso empa ke ntse sena tshwaetso empa ke ntse ke ena le matshwao.

src: what now?
tgt: jwale ho etswa jwang?

src: it is possible to get a false negative test result.
tgt: ho na le kgonahalo ya hore o fumane sephetho sa diteko se fosahetseng se senangtshwaetso.

src: this means that your first test could be negative, but you could test positive at a later stage.
tgt: hona ho bolela hore sephetho sa hao sa pele se ka tla se sena tshwaetso, empa ha mmamora sephetho sa tla se ena le tshwaetso.

src: if you continue to have covid19 symptoms contact your healthcare professional.
tgt: haeba o ka tswella ho bontsha matshwao a covid19 ikopantshe le mosebetsi wa tlhokomelo ya bophelo bo botle.

src: what if i am still showing symptoms after 10 days?
tgt: jwale haeba ke ntse ke jwale haeba ke ntse ke bontsha matshwao ka morabontsha matshwao ka moramatsatsi a 10?

src: it is common for patients to continue to have symptoms for longer than 10 days.
tgt: ho tlwaelehile hore bakudi ba tswelle ho bontsha matshwao ka mora matsatsi a fetang 10. ho fola ka phethahalo ho ka nka dibeke tse mmalwa.

src: if you still have symptoms, seek advice from your healthcare professional.
tgt: haeba o ntse o ena le matshwao, kopa keletso ho mosebetsi wa tlhokomelo ya bophelo bo botle.

src: for more information about covid19, visit the national institute for communicable diseases’ website at www.
tgt: mabapi le tlhahisoleseding e batsi ka covid19 , etela websaete ya institjhuti ya naha ya mahloko a tshwaetsanang howww.

src: nicd.
tgt: nicd.

src: ac.
tgt: ac.

src: za, the covid19 free website at coronavirus.
tgt: za, websaete ya mahala ya covid19 ho coronavirus.

src: managing covid19: at home and at a dedicated facility allison cooper if you are not able to selfisolate, call the national coronavirus hotline at 0800 029 999 for more information about your closest isolation or quarantine facility.
tgt: ho laola covid19 : lapeng le setsing se hlwahilweng allison cooper haeba o sa kgone ho ikgetholla, letsetsa mohala wa naha wa ka nako tsohle wa kokwanahloko ya corona ho 0800 029 999 mabapi le tlhahisoleseding ka setsi sa boikgethollo kapa khwaranteni.

src: it’s extremely important to separate yourself from others, either at home or at a free isolation facility, if you have tested positive for covid19.
tgt: ho bohlokwahlokwa ho ikgetholla ho ikgetholla ho batho ba bang, ekaba ho batho ba bang, ekaba lapeng kapa setsing sa boikgethollo sa mahala, haeba o ena le lapeng kapa setsing sa boikgethollo sa mahala, haeba o ena le covid19covid19 .. boholo ba maafrika borwa a nang le kokwanahloko ya corona (covid19) ha ba kgone ho kena boikgethollong hobane matlo a bona a manyenyana haholo hore ba ka kgona ho phela le ho robala ka phaposing eo ba sa e kopanelang le motho e mong.

src: many south af ricans who test positive for the coronavirus (covid19) cannot selfisolate because their home is too small for them to live and sleep in a room that’s not shared by anyone else.
tgt: mmuso o netefaditse hore ditsi tse hlwailweng tsa boikgethollo di a fumaneha ho batho ba nang le tshwaetso, le ditsi tse hlwailweng tsa khwarantine di a fumaneha ho batho ba ntseng ba emetse diphetho tsa bona tsa diteko.

src: both services are free.
tgt: ditshebeletso tsena bobedi ke tsa mahala.

src: according to dr marlin mccay, a general practitioner based in florida on the west rand, the first thing you need to do when diagnosed with covid19 is to limit the spread of the infection.
tgt: ho ya ka ngaka marlinmccay, ngaka e sebetsang mane florida, west rand, ntho ya pele eo o tlamehang ho e etsa ha o se o fumanwe o ena le covid19 ke ho fokotsa ho ata ha tshwaetso.

src: "you want to protect your family," he says.
tgt: "o batla ho tshireletsa ba lelapa la hao," o rialo.

src: to do this, you need to go into isolation – either at home or at an isolation facility.
tgt: ho etsa sena, o tla hloka ho ya boikgethollong – ekaba lapeng kapa setsing sa boikgethollo.

src: "if you are selfisolating it means you have to find a part of the house where you are totally cut off from the rest of the family.
tgt: "haeba o le boikgethollong hoo ho bolela hore o tlameha ho fumana karolo ya ntlo moo o tla bang mong mme o sa kopane le batho bohle ba lelapa.

src: no one should come within three metres of you.
tgt: ha ho motho ya tlamehang ho atamela ho wena sebaka sa dimetara tse tharo.

src: you must eat on your own; use your own cutlery and crockery; use your own bathroom, if possible; and make sure there’s no contact with anyone else in the family.
tgt: o tlameha ho ja o le mong; o sebedise dikgaba le dijana tsa hao o le mong; o sebedise phaphosi ya ho hlapela o le mong; haeba ho kgonahala; mme o netefatse hore ha o be le kamano le mang kapa mang ka lapeng.

src: "your doctor or primary care giver should help you with certain basic medications to ease most of the symptoms, especially things like body aches and pains, headache and fever.
tgt: "ngaka ya hao kapa mohlokomedi wa hao wa sethatho o tlameha o thusa ka meriana e itseng ya bohlokwa ho bebofatsa boholo ba matshwao, haholoholo dintho tse kang mmele o opang kapa mahlaba, hlooho le feberu.

src: there are also some good vitamins one can use to stay healthy," he says.
tgt: ho boela ho ena le divithamini tse hantle tseo o ka di sebedisang ho dula o phetse hantle," o rialo.

src: it’s also important to get enough rest and drink enough water or clear fluids to make sure that your urine stays a pale clear colour.
tgt: ho boela ho le bohlokwa ho fumana phomolo le metsi a lekaneng kapa dino tse hlakileng ho netefatsa hore moroto wa hao o dula o hlakile.

src: most people with mild illness will start feeling better within a week of the first symptoms, but it’s important to monitor your symptoms carefully.
tgt: boholo ba batho ba nang le bohloko bo mahareng ba tla ikutlwa ba eba beterenyana ka mora beke eo ba bontshitseng matshwao a bona a pele, empa ho bohlokwa ho beha leihlo matshwao a hao ka hloko.

src: if you develop any emergency warning signs, such as trouble breathing, chest pain or pressure in your chest that does not go away, coughing up blood, becoming confused, severe sleepi ness or blue lips or face you must call an ambulance or go to hospital immediately.
tgt: haeba o ka ba le matsh waoa tshohanyetso, jwalo ka ho sokola ho hema, mahlaba a ka sefubeng kapa kgatello ka sefubeng e sa feleng, wa kgohlela madi, wa ikutlwa o ferekane, mme o dula o robetse haholo kapa o ba le melomo kapa sefahleho se bolou o tlameha ho letsetsa ambolense kapa o ye sepetlele hanghang.

src: for those who are not able to keep themselves away from others living in the home, government has setup free quarantine facilities around the country to keep you and your loved ones safe.
tgt: ditsi tsa kwaranteniho ba sa kgoneng ho ikge tholla ho bao ba dulang le bona ka tlung, mmuso o thehile ditsi tsa kwaranteni tsa mahala hohle naheng ho o tshireletsa le baratuwa ba hao.

src: the western cape government recently published some comments from patients about its isolation facilities.
tgt: mmuso wa profensi ya kapa bophirima o phatlaladitse tse ding tsa ditshwaelo tsa bakudi ba tswang ditsing tsa boikgethollo.

src: marie jantjies from witzenberg decided to follow healthcare workers’ advice and go to the isolation facility because her 97yearold mother lives with her and her children and she wanted to protect them.
tgt: marie jantjies ya tswang witzenberg o nkile qeto ya ho latela keletso ya basebetsi ba tlhokomelo ya bophelo bo botle ya hore a ye setsing sa boikgethollo hobane o dula le mme wa hae ya nang le dilemo tse 97 le bana ba hae mme o ne a batla ho ba tshireletsa.

src: "i was treated very well.
tgt: "ke ne ke tshwarwe hantle haholo.

src: the food was nice – even nicer than at home.
tgt: dijo di ne di le monate – le ho feta tsa hae.

src: i realised i just had to stay positive.
tgt: ke ile ka elellwa hore ke tlameha ho dula ke na le tshepo.

src: i was anxious, but i prayed and tried to relax," she said.
tgt: ke ne ke ngongorohile, empa ke ile ka rapele mme ka leka ho phuthuloha," o rialo.

src: "that place can save lives!
tgt: "tulo eo e ka pholosa maphelo!

src: it really is the best," said john arnoldus, who recovered from covid19 at an isolation facility in drakenstein.
tgt: e itlhomme pele," ho rialo john arnoldus, ya phekotsweng covid19 setsing sa boikgethollo se drakenstein.

src: "one of my friends was in quarantine at home and he struggled to recover on his own.
tgt: "e mong wa metswalle ya ka o ne a le boikgethollong hae mme o ile a sokola ho iphodisa ka bo yena.

src: i told him to contact the people who cared for me – that is the way to get better.
tgt: ke ile ka mo jwetsa hore a ikopantshe le batho ba ileng ba ntlhokomela – ke ona mokgwa wa ho ba betere oo.

src: the support of the medical staff and the manager there – that pulls you through," he said.
tgt: tshehetso ya basebetsi ba bongaka le mookamedi wa moo – ke yona e tla o phahamisa," o rialo.

src: arnoldus was initially hesitant to go to the isolation facility because of the wrong perception that if you go to a facility like this you will get sicker and die.
tgt: maqalong arnoldus o ne a qeaqea ka ho ya setsing sa boikgethollo ka lebaka la mohopolo o fosahetseng wa hore ha o ya setsing ka o kula o tlo kula le ho feta mme o shwe.

src: "i expected the worst, but i was received so well.
tgt: "ke ne ke lebeletse tse mpehadi, empa ke ile ka amohelwa hantle haholo.

src: hats off to the staff!
tgt: ke ba rolela kgaebane basebetsi ba moo!

src: they explained to me that as i already have covid19, no one at the facility could make me sick," he said.
tgt: ba ile ba ntlhalosetsa hore ka ha ke se ntse ke ena le covid19 , ha ho motho ya setsing ya ka nkudisang," o rialo.

src: what can you expect from a quarantine facility?
tgt: o ka lebella eng ho tswa setsing sakhwaranteni?

src: according to the western cape government, all of your needs are taken of.
tgt: ho ya ka mmuso wa profensi ya kapa bophirima, ditlhoko tsohle tsa hao di a hlokomelwa.

src: let’s keep each other safe vukuzenzele unnamed our country has moved to alert level 2 in our response to the coronavirus pandemic.
tgt: ha re bolokaneng vukuzenzele unnamed naha ya bo rona e se e fetetse mo hatong wa bobedi wa tlhokomediso karabe long ya rona ho sewa sa kokwanahloko ya corona .

src: this has come as a relief to all south africans who have had to live under stringent restrictions for the last five months.
tgt: sena se tlile e le kimollo ho maafrika borwa ka ofela a neng a tshwanela ho phela tlasa dithibelo tse matla bakeng sa dikgwedi tse tsheletseng tse fetileng.

src: it is a sign of the progress we are making in reducing new infections and demand on our health facilities.
tgt: ke letshwao la kgatelopele eo re e etsang mabapi le ho fokotsa ditshwaetso tse ntjha le boima hodima ditsha tsa rona tsa kalafo.

src: it is also a very important development as we strive to restart our economy.
tgt: e boetse ke ntshetsopele ya bohlokwa jwaloka ha re tsitlallela ho qala botjha moruo wa rona.

src: but it is too soon to celebrate.
tgt: feela e sa le hoseng hore re ka keteka.

src: we are still very much in the middle of a deadly pandemic that has taken over 11,000 lives in south africa alone.
tgt: re ntse re le mahareng haholo a sewa sena se bolayang se seng se fetile ka maphelo a fetang 11 000 ka hara afrika borwa feela.

src: at more than half a million confirmed cases, we still have the fifth highest number of infections in the world.
tgt: re iphumana re na le di tlaleho tse etsang halofo ya milione tse tiiseditsweng, re ntse re na le ditshwaetso tse maemong a bohlano tse phahameng ka ho fetisisa lefatsheng.

src: and there is always a chance of a resurgence of the disease.
tgt: ho ntse ho na le monyetla wa hore lefu lena le ropohe botjha.

src: if we ever need a stark reminder of the need for vigilance, we should look to recent events thousands of kilometres away in new zealand.
tgt: haeba re batla se re hopo tsang ka botlalo hore re lokele ho fadimeha, ke hore re shebe se etsahetseng dikilomithara tse dikete hole le rona e leng naheng ya new zealand.

src: three months since the country was declared coronavirusfree, new zealand is once again under lockdown.
tgt: dikgwedi tse tharo esale naha eo e tsebahatsa hore ha e sa na kokwanahloko ya corona , new zealand e boetse e hlasetswe ke ho kginwa ha ditshebeletso hape.

src: although the latest outbreak was of relatively few cases, the government swiftly reimposed lockdown restrictions.
tgt: leha ho ropoha ha moraorao e ne e le ha ditlaleho tse mmalwa, mmuso oo o ile wa potlakela ho kenya dithibelo tshebe tsong hape.

src: similar restrictions have had to be reimposed in several parts of europe as they experience a ‘second wave’ of infections.
tgt: dithibelo tse tshwanang le tseo di ile tsa lokela ho kenngwa tshebetsong hape dikarolong tse mmalwa tsa yuropa kaha di ile tsa hlaselwa ke ‘leqhubu la bobedi’ la ditshwaetso.

src: these experiences show just how swiftly things can change when it comes to covid19.
tgt: diketsahalo tsena di bontsha feela kamoo dintho di ka fetohang ka potlako ha re tla tabeng ya covid19 .

src: it is a wakeup call to any among us who may harbour illusions that we are even close to seeing the end of this grave public health emergency.
tgt: sena ke tlhokomediso ho rona ba ntseng ba ithetsa ka hore re se re le haufi le ho bona pheletso ya bothata bona ba maemo a hlobae tsang bophelong ba setjhaba.

src: certainly, there are signs of hope.
tgt: ehlile ho na le matshwao a tlisang tshepo.

src: the number of new confirmed cases in south africa continues to decline.
tgt: palo ya ditlaleho tse ntjha tse tiiseditsweng ka hara afrika borwa e ntse e tswella ho theoha.

src: at the peak of the disease just one month ago, we were recording around 12,000 new cases a day.
tgt: sehlohlolong sa lefu lena kgweding e le nngwe feela e fetileng, re ne re ba le ditlaleho tse ntjha tse ka fihlang ho 12 000 ka letsatsi.

src: this has dropped to an average of around 5,000 a day over the past week.
tgt: sena se theohetse ho palohare ya bonyane 5 000 ka letsatsi bekeng ena e fetileng.

src: our recovery rate stands at 80 percent.
tgt: sekgahla sa rona sa ho hlaphohelwa se eme ho 80%.

src: as the country moves to alert level 2, many restrictions on social and economic activity have been lifted.
tgt: jwaloka ha naha e fetela mohatong wa bobedi wa tlhokomediso, dithibelo tse ngata tsa diketsahalo tsa kahisano le tsa moruo di nyehlisitswe.

src: with this comes increased risk of transmission.
tgt: sena se tla tla ka kotsi ya ho eketseha ha ditshwaetso.

src: we now need to manage this risk and ensure the gains we have made thus far in containing the pandemic’s spread are not reversed.
tgt: jwale re lokela ho laola kotsi ena le ho netefatsa hore seo re se fihletseng ho fihlela mona mabapi le ho laola ho ata ha sewa sena ha se re kgutlisetse morao.

src: the greatest threat to the health of nation right now is complacency.
tgt: tshoso e matla ka ho fetisisa bophe long ba setjhaba hajwale ke ho itebala.

src: it may be that we are now permitted to meet friends and family, to visit entertainment venues, to travel for leisure and to consume alcohol in restaurants, bars and taverns.
tgt: e ka nna ya ba re dumeletswe ho etela me tswalle le ba malapa, ho ya dibakeng tsa boithabiso, ho tsamaela monate le ho nwa tahi le ho ya direstjhure nteng, dibareng le ditame neng.

src: but as the old adage goes, just because you can, doesn’t mean you should.
tgt: feela maele a kgale a re, ho kgona, ha ho bolele ho tlameha.

src: many people who have the coronavirus do not have symptoms and may not even know they are infected.
tgt: batho ba bangata ba nang le kokwanahloko ya corona ha ba na matshwao mme ha ba tsebe le hore ba na le tshwaetso.

src: this is a sobering reality because it means that any of us could be infected right now and could unwittingly infect others.
tgt: sena ke nnete e tshosang hobane se bolela hore mang le mang e ka nna ya ba o na le tshwaetso mme a ka tshwaetsa ba bang ntle le maikemisetso.

src: this is particular the case when visiting relatives, especially the elderly and those with preexisting medical conditions that render them vulnerable to infection.
tgt: sena e ka ba ntho e etsa halang ha motho a etela ba leloko, haholoholo ba seng ba hodile le ba ntseng ba tshwerwe ke mafu a mang a ka etsang hore ba tshwae tsehe ha bonolo.

src: it is also true for attending religious services or cultural activities.
tgt: ho boetse ho jwalo ka ho ya ditshebe letsong tsa bodumedi kapa mesebetsing ya botjhaba.

src: the ‘second wave’ of infections that several other countries have experienced is an everpresent possibility for us too.
tgt: ‘leqhubu la bobedi’ la ditshwaetso leo dinaha tse ding tse mmalwa di bileng le lona ke kgonahalo e dulang e le teng ya hore le rona le ka re fihlela.

src: although many restrictions have been lifted, it does not mean they will not return should we experience a significant rise in infections.
tgt: leha ho nyehlisitswe dithibelo tse ngata, ha ho bolele hore di keke tsa kgutla haeba ho ka ba le ho phahama ho matla ha ditshwaetso.

src: this pandemic is a matter of life and death.
tgt: sewa sena ke taba ya bophelo le lefu.

src: we need to adapt and we need to be vigilant.
tgt: re lokela ho se tlwaela le ho dula re fadimehile.

src: in the days, weeks and months that lie ahead, we must urgently focus our efforts on recovery.
tgt: matsatsing a tlang, dibekeng le dikgweding tse tlang, re lokela ho tsepamisa maikutlo ka matla maite kong a ho hlaphohelwa.

src: our economy and our society has suffered a great deal.
tgt: moruo wa rona le setjhaba di thefulehile haholo.

src: as we return to economic activity across almost all industries – and work to repair the damage done – we have a responsibility to not let our guard down as individuals, employers, communities, families, professionals, workers and citizens.
tgt: jwalo ka ha re kgutlela mesebe tsing ya moruo ho phatlalla le diindasteri kaofela – mme re ilo sebetsa le ho lokisa moo ho senyehileng – re na le boikarabelo ba hore re se itebale jwaloka batho ka bo mong, bahiri, badudi, malapa, ditsebi, basebetsi le baahi.

src: none of us wants a return to the early days of extreme lockdown restrictions.
tgt: ha ho le ya mong wa rona ya batlang ho kgutlela ma tsatsing a pele a ho kginwa ho matla ha ditshebeletso le metsamao ya batho.

src: we want to move on with our lives.
tgt: re batla ho tswela pele ka maphelo a rona.

src: we want our friends and loved ones to remain healthy and safe.
tgt: re batla ho bona me tswalle le baratuwa ba phe tse hantle le ho bolokeha.

src: as a nation, let us continue to work together to ensure that we progress.
tgt: jwaloka setjhaba, ha re tswe lleng ho sebetsa mmoho ho netefatsa hore re hatela pele.

src: the move to alert level 2 of the lockdown is not a ‘free for all.’ the rules on social distancing, mask wearing, social gatherings and international travel remain.
tgt: ho fetela mohatong wa bobedi wa ho kginwa ha ditshebeletso ‘ha se ma ntlwane.’ melawana ya ho sielana sebaka, ho kenya di maske, dikopano tsa setjhaba le maeto a matjhabeng e ntse e dutse e le jwalo.

src: our success rests on our ability to abide by these regulations and to ensure that we each behave carefully and responsibly.
tgt: katleho ya rona e itshetle hile hodima bokgoni ba rona ba ho ikobela melawana ena le ho netefatsa hore bohle re itshwara ka hloko le ka boikarabelo.

src: every time we are considering any form of nonessen tial activity, we should ask: what is the risk of infection to ourselves and to others?
tgt: kamehla ha re nahana ka ho etsa mosebetsi o sa hlokeheng, re lokela ho ipo tsa hore: kgonahalo e ka ba efe ya ho tshwaetsa ba bang kapa ho tshwaetswa?

src: where there is a risk, even a slight one, it is better not to do it.
tgt: moo ho ka bang kotsi, leha e ka ba e nyane, ho molemo hore o se be moo.

src: let us proceed, as ever, with caution.
tgt: ha re tswelleng, jwaloka kamehla, re fadimehe.

src: nsfas powered my dreams more matshediso the national student financial aid scheme (nsfas) has bridged the financial gap between karabo mashego (21) and his plan to further his studies.
tgt: nsfas e tiisetsa ditoro tsa ka more matshediso sekema sa dithuso tsa ditjhelete tsa baithuti (nsfas) se ngotlile sekgeo sa mathata a ditjhelete pa keng tsa karabo mashego (21) le morero wa hae wa ho ntshetsa dithuto tsa hae pele.

src: mashego of sebokeng in gauteng’s vaal area says he would not have managed to afford tuition fees and the other expenses that come with postmatric education had he not received a bursary from nsfas.
tgt: mashego wa sebokeng ho la gauteng tulong ya lekoa o re o ne a sa tlo kgona ho fihlella ditefello tsa dithuto le ditjeo tse ding tse tsa maelanang le thuto ya ka mora materiki hoja a ne a sa thola basari ya nsfas.

src: "in addition, the monthly allowance i receive from nsfas enables me to sleep and study on a full stomach," he says.
tgt: "hodima moo, ditsiane tsa kgwedi ka nngwe tseo ke di fumanang ho tswa ho nsfas di nthusa ho robala le ho bala ka mpa e tle tseng," o rialo.

src: mashego is a thirdyear student studying towards a degree in civil engineering at the university of pretoria.
tgt: mashego ke moithuti wa selemo sa boraro ya ithute lang kgerata ya boenjinere ba kaho yunivesithing ya pretoria.

src: "tuition fees are very expensive.
tgt: "ditefello tsa dithuto di bitsa haholo.

src: for the course that i have chosen, i really could not afford to pay for a semester, never mind a single academic year," he explains.
tgt: bakeng sa le kala leo ke le kgethileng, ke ne ke sa tlo kgona ho lefella le kgweditshelela, re sa bue ka selemo se le seng," o a hlalosa.

src: mashego matriculated in 2016 and was a top learner in his class, but had no means to pay for his studies.
tgt: mashego o qetile lengolo la materiki ka selemo sa 2016 mme e le moithuti ya ka sehloohong sehlopheng sa hae, empa a se na mo kgwa wa ho lefella dithuto tsa hae.

src: he successfully applied for funding from nsfas for the 2018 academic year.
tgt: o ile a atleha ho etsa kopo ya matlole ho tswa nsfas bakeng sa selemo sa dithuto sa 2018.

src: "this gave me the opportunity to make my dream of studying engineering come true.
tgt: "sena se mphile monyetla wa ho phethahatsa toro ya ka ya ho ithutela boenjinere.

src: education plays a huge role in my personal development and it helps me to progress in all that i intend to achieve.
tgt: thuto e bapala karolo e kgolo ntshetsopeleng ya ka mme e nthusa ho ha tela pele ho tsohle tseo ke labalabelang ho di fihlella.

src: moreover, it empowers me to empower other people in my community and thus contribute to the economy of our country," mashego explains.
tgt: ho feta moo, e mpha matla a ho matlafatsa ba bang ka hara motse wa heso mme kahoo ba nyehele moruong wa naha ya rona," mashego o a hlalosa.

src: "i urge young people to apply for nsfas funding because following your dream is not a free exercise, it needs funding, and nsfas will bridge that gap for you," he says.
tgt: "ke kgothaletsa batjha ho etsa dikopo tsa matlole a nsfas hobane ho latella toro ya hao ha se mahala, ho batla tjhelete, mme nsfas e tla o ngotlela sekgeo seo," o rialo.

src: the minister of higher education, science and innovation, dr blade nzimande, has opened the nsfas 2021 application cycle for a period of four months, from 3 august to 30 november 2020. students from disadvan taged and workingclass backgrounds who wish to further their studies at any public technical and vocational education and training (tvet) college or university may apply.
tgt: letona la thuto e phaha meng, saense le ntjhafatso, ngaka blade nzimande, o butse sehla sa dikopo sa nsfas 2021 bakeng sa dikgwedi tse nne, ho tloha ka la 3 phato ho isa ka la 30 pudungwana 2020. baithuti ba tswang mala peng a neng a tinngwe menyetla le a basebetsi ba lakatsang ho ntshetsa dithuto pele koletjheng leha e le efe ya mmuso ya thuto le thupello ya mosebetsi (tvet) kapa yunivesithing ba ka etsa dikopo.

src: to be eligible for nsfas funding, an applicant must be a south african citizen and come from a family with a combined annual household income of not more than r350 000. the household annual income for students with a disability should not be more than r600 000.
tgt: ho tshwaneleha bakeng sa ditjhelete tsa nsfas, moikopedi o lokela ho ba moahi wa afrika borwa ya tswang lelapeng le nang le lekeno le kopanetsweng la selemo le sa feteng r350 000. lekeno la selemo la lelapa la moithuti ya qhwadileng ha le a lokela ho feta r600 000.

src: "in the current academic year, nsfas has funded over 700 000 students, 248 242 at tvet colleges and 481 339 at universities (students with registrations data).
tgt: "selemong sa hajwale sa dithuto, nsfas e thusitse baithuti ba fetang 700 000 ka ditjhelete, 248 242 ke ba dikoletjheng tsa tvet ha 481 339 e le ba diyuni vesithing (tlhahisoleseding ya baithuti ba ingodisi tseng).

src: this is a 20 percent increase from the previous year when we compared registration data received in the same period of 2019 versus 2020," says minister nzimande.
tgt: sena ke keketseho ya 20% ho tloha selemong se fetileng ha re ne re bapisa tlhahisoleseding ya nako e tshwanang le ena ya selemo sa 2019 kgahlanong le sa 2020," ho rialo letona nzi mande.

src: nsfas accounts for 40 percent of the undergraduate population at universi ties and 70 percent at tvet colleges.
tgt: nsfas e ikarabella bake ng sa 40% ya baithuti ba so ka ba phethela dithuto diyunivesithing le 70% dikoletjheng tsa tvet.

src: v applicants must visit www.
tgt: vtsela ya ho etsa kopo baikopedi ba lokela ho etela www.

src: nsfas.
tgt: nsfas.

src: org.
tgt: org.

src: za and click on mynsfas.
tgt: za mme ba tobetse ho mynsfas .
