src: they should continue to produce journalism that goes beyond the headlines and front pages and that contributes to human development.
tgt: ba tshwanela ho tswela pele ho hlahisa boqolotsi bo phunyeletsang ka nqane ho dihlooho tsa ditaba le maqephe a ka pele a ditaba, hape bo nang le seabo ntla fatsong ya setjhaba.

src: they should report both the good news and the bad news, the progress we make and the challenges we face.
tgt: ba tshwanela ho tlaleha bobedi ditaba tse molemo le tse mpe, tswelopele eo re e etsang le diphephetso tseo re tadimaneng le tsona.

src: credibility is key to sustaining trust between journalists and the public.
tgt: ho tshepahala ke ntho ya bohlokwa ntlheng ya ho boloka ho tshepana pakeng tsa baqolotsi le setjhaba.

src: when journalists allow themselves or their platforms to be used to fight political battles or settle scores on behalf of vested interests, their credibility suffers.
tgt: ha baqolotsi ba itumella kapa ba dumella dipolate fomo tsa bona hore di sebedi setswe ho lwana dintwa tsa sepolotiki kapa di etse boi phetetso lebitsong la ba nang le kgahleho, botshepehi ba bona bo a lemala.

src: when media disseminate stories that are inaccurate or that they know to be false, the public loses faith in them.
tgt: ha boraditaba ba hasanya ditaba tse sa nepahalang kapa tseo ba tsebang hore ke tsa leshano, setjhaba se fellwa ke tshepo ho bona.

src: tobacco addiction: your health could go up in smoke kgaogelo letsebe to commemorate world no tobacco day on 31 may, vuk’uzenzelechats to a recovering tobacco addict about overcoming his addiction.
tgt: bokgoba ba ho tsuba: o ka ipitsetsa malwetse a mangata bophelong ba hao kgaogelo letsebe ho ketekela letsatsi la lefatshe la ho se tsube mohla la 31 motsheanong, vuk’uzenzele e qoqa le lekgoba la ho tsuba le hlaphohelwang malebana le ho hlola bokgoba ba lona.

src: katlego makhanda, from moiletswane in the north west, knows all too well how hard it is to stop smoking.
tgt: katlego makhanda ya tswang motse ng wa moiletswa ne provinseng ya bokone bophirima o tseba hantle hore na ho thata jwang ho tlohela ho tsuba.

src: until he stopped four years ago, makhanda (28) used to smoke over 30 cigarettes a day.
tgt: ho fihlela a tlohela di lemong tse nne tse fetileng, makhanda, ya dilemo di 28, o ne a tsuba disikarete tse fetang 30 ka letsatsi.

src: he started smoking when he was 18 as a result of peer pressure.
tgt: o ne a qale ho tsuba ha a ne a ena le dilemo tse 18 ka lebaka la kgatello ya thaka tsa hae.

src: "i was not interested in smoking – it didn’t appeal to me until i was in matric and a group of guys i used to hang out with started picking on me for not being cool enough to smoke."
tgt: "ke ne ke sa ho rate ho tsuba – ho ne ho sa nkgahle ho fihlela ke le sehlopheng sa materiki, mme sehlopha sa bashemane bao ke neng ke utlwana le bona se qalang ho nnyatsa ka ho re ha ke a hla lefa ka hobane ke sa tsube.

src: makhanda initially smoked one or two cigarettes a day, but this increased over time.
tgt: sethathong, makhanda o ne a tsuba sikarete e le nngwe kapa tse pedi ka letsatsi, empa hona ho ile ha eketseha ho tsamayeng ha nako.

src: "after matric, i went to varsity and the freedom that came with not staying with my parents meant i could drink alcohol as frequently as i wanted.
tgt: ka morao ho materiki, ke ile ka ya univesithi, mme hobane ke sa dule le ba tswadi ba ka, ka nwa jwala kgafetsa ka moo ke ratang kateng.

src: this increased my rate of smoking."
tgt: hona ho ile ha eketsa sekgahla sa ka sa ho tsuba.

src: in 2017, makhanda fell ill and was hospitalised.
tgt: ka selemo sa 2017, makha nda o ile a kula, mme a amohelwa sepetlele.

src: he was diagnosed with type 2 diabetes and for weeks was too weak to get out of bed.
tgt: o ile a fumanwa a ena le lefu la tswekere, mme ka dibeke tse ngata o ne a fokola hoo a neng a sa tsohe diphateng.

src: "the doctor was very specific that managing my illness couldn’t be done if i continued to smoke.
tgt: "ngaka e ile ya totobatsa hore ho hlaphohelwa ha ka lefung lena ho ne ho ke ke ha etsahala haeba ke ne ke tswela pele ho tsuba.

src: that is when i decided to quit for good.
tgt: ke nakong ena moo ke ileng ka etsa qeto ya ho tlohella ruri.

src: "dr midah maluleke from mpumalanga says smoking is harmful to nearly every organ.
tgt: "ngaka midah maluleke ya tswang mpumalanga o re ho tsuba ho batla ho le kotsi dithong tsohle tsa mmele.

src: "illnesses such as cancer, heart disease, stroke, lung diseases, diabetes and chronic obstructive pulmonary disease can result from smoking.
tgt: "mafu a kang kankere, lefu la pelo, ho shwa lehlakore, mafu a matshwafo, lefu la tswekere le lefu le sa phe koleheng la kgoreletso ya matshwafo a ka bakwa ke ho tsuba.

src: "research shows that smokers are 30% to 40% more likely to develop type 2 diabetes than nonsmokers.
tgt: "diphuputso di supa hore batho ba tsubang ba na le di peresente tse 30 ho ya ho 40 tsa kgonahalo ya ho tshwa rwa ke lefu la tswekere ho feta ba sa tsubeng.

src: smoking also creates difficulty in managing the disease," he says.
tgt: ho tsuba ho boetse ho tlisa bothata phekolong ya lefu lena.

src: tips to stop smokingthe cancer association of south africa (cansa) offers the following tips if you are trying to stop smoking: decide on a date to stop smoking and then do it.
tgt: malebela a ho tlohela ho tsubamokgatlo wa kankere wa afrika borwa (cansa) o fana ka dikeletso tse latelang haeba o leka ho tlohela ho tsuba: etsa qeto malebana le letsatsi leo o tla tlohela ho tsuba ka lona, mme o etse jwalo.

src: throw away everything that reminds you of smoking.
tgt: lahlela hole ntho e nngwe le e nngwe e ka o hopotsang ho tsuba.

src: this includes cigarette packets, ashtrays, lighters.
tgt: 0tsena di kenyeletsa dipakethe tsa disika rete, dijananyana tsa ho tlhotlhorela molora, dihotetsi.

src: drink lots of water – it will help flush the nicotine from your body.
tgt: enwa metsi a mangata – hona ho tla o thusa ho phallisetsa bokwadi kantle ho mmele wa hao.

src: israel, palestine urged to emulate sa by pursuing peace vukuzenzele unnamed our experience with the democratic transition is a lesson about the power of empathy, negotiation and compromise.
tgt: ho ipiletswa dinaheng tsa iseraele le palestina ho nka mohlala ho afrika borwa ka ho tsitlallela kgotso vukuzenzele unnamed boiphihlelo ba rona ka ho kena mmu song wa demokra si bo re rutile ka matla a kutlwelano, ditherisano le tshebedisano.

src: the escalating situation in israel and palestine affirms once more what we south africans know too well, that intractable conflicts can only be solved through peaceful negotiation.
tgt: maemo a ntseng a tota na heng tsa iseraele le palestina ke bopaki ba tseo rona ma afrika borwa re di tsebang ha ntle, e leng hore dikgohlano tse sa feleng di ka rarollwa ka ditherisano tsa kgotso feela.

src: it also demonstrates that unless the root causes of a conflict are addressed, in this case the illegal occupation by israel of palestinian land and the denial of the palestinian people’s right to selfdetermination, there will never be peace.
tgt: maemo ana a boetse a bo ntsha hore ebang ho sa toba nwe le sesosa sa dikgohlano tsena e leng ho nkuwa ha naha ya palestina ke iseraele ka tsela e seng molaong, le ho amohuwa ha mapalestina boikemelo ba bona, kgotso e ke ke ya ba teng.

src: the latest violence was sparked by an israeli court decision to evict a group of families from their homes in the sheikh jarrah neighbourhood in east jerusalem to make way for israeli settlements.
tgt: dintwa tsa morao tjena di bakilwe ke qeto ya lekgotla la dinyewe la iseraele e itseng ho ntshuwe malapa moo a dulang teng motseng wa sheikh jarrah, botjhabela ba jerusalema, hothwe a suthele maiseraele.

src: the sight of men, women and children being evicted from the homes their families have lived in for generations brings back painful collective and personal memories for the majority of south africans – of forced removals and land dispossession.
tgt: ho bona banna, basadi le bana ba ntshuwa mahaeng ao meloko ya malapa a bona e phetseng ho ona ho hopotsa bongata ba maafrika borwa tse bohloko tsa kgale tsa ho lelekwa dibakeng tsa ona le ho nkelwa naha.

src: it was a pain and humiliation faced by my own family, and by many south african families.
tgt: ke bohloko le tlontlollo eo lelapa leso le ileng la tobana le tsona, le malapa a mang a mangata a afrika borwa.

src: my family was forcibly moved to different parts of the country on two occasions.
tgt: baheso ba ile ba qobellwa ho fallela dibakeng tse fa paneng naheng ena makgetlo a mabedi.

src: being forced from one’s home at gunpoint is a trauma not easily forgotten and is carried across generations.
tgt: ho lelekwa haeno o su pilwe ka sethunya ke ketso e bohloko e sa lebaleheng mme e dula e le menahanong ya meloko e latelang.

src: as a country, we are still living with the residual effects of the callous acts carried out in the name of apartheid spatial planning.
tgt: re naha e ntseng e ikoka maqeba a diphetho tsa diketso tse mahlonoko tse neng di amana le ho beha baahi dibakeng tse itseng ho ya kamoo mmuso wa kge thollo o neng o batla kateng.

src: for all who believe in equality, justice and human rights, we cannot but be moved and indeed angered, at the pain and humiliation being inflicted on the palestinian people; for it echoes our own.
tgt: jwalo ka batho ba dume lang tekanong, tokeng le ditokelong tsa botho, re a kgathatseha le ho halefa ha re bona bohloko le tlontlollo ya mapalestina hoba ke dintho tse re hopotsang nalane ya rona.

src: israel’s actions are a violation of international law.
tgt: diketso tsa iseraele ke tlolo ya molao wa matjhaba.

src: they show a total disregard for successive united nations security council reso lutions that call for an end to the occupation of palestinian land and for the fulfilment of the rights of the palestinian people.
tgt: di bontsha ho se hlomphe ka hohlehohle dipehelo tsa lekgotla la tshireletseho la matjhaba a kopaneng, tse reng palestina e se ke ya amo huwa naha mme le baahi ba naha eo ba nkuwe e le batho ba nang le ditokelo.

src: since israeli security forces launched assaults on worshippers at alaqsa mosque in jerusalem, the violence has now engulfed the gaza strip, large parts of the west bank and a number of israeli cities.
tgt: ditlhaselo di se di aparetse motjhophoro wa gaza, diba ka tse kgolo tsa west bank le metse e meholo ya iseraele esale mabotho a tshireletseho a iseraele a hlasela badumedi sebakeng sa borapedi sa al aqsa,jerusalema bekeng e fetileng.

src: it has claimed the lives of dozens of people, including children.
tgt: batho ba bangata ba hlokahetse ho kenyeletsa le bana.

src: it is also deeply troubling that israeli forces destroyed a multistorey building that housed a number of media organisations, sending a chilling message to media reporting on the violence.
tgt: ho bile bohloko ho bona masole a iseraele a heletsa moaho wa mekato e mengata oo ho ona ho neng ho dula mekgatlo ya ditaba, mme sena se rometse molaetsa o tshosang ho ba ditaba ba tlalehang ka dikgoka tsena.

src: the senseless and continued israeli bombardment of gaza will have devastating consequences for more than two million people who have been suffering under an illegal israeli blockade for 14 years.
tgt: tlhaselo e sa hlokeheng le e ntseng e tswela pele ya ise raele baahing ba gaza e tla ba le diphetho tse mpe bakeng sa batho ba fetang dimili yone tse pedi bao esaleng ba sotleha ka dilemo tse 14 tsa dithibelo tsa iseraele.

src: we call on all parties involved to show restraint, to respect human life and to cease the current hostilities.
tgt: re ipiletsa ho bohle ba amehang ho itshwara, ho hlompha maphelo a ba bang, leho beha marumo fatshe.

src: as south africa, we are committed to being part of international efforts aimed at reviving a political process that will lead to the establishment of a viable palestinian state existing sidebyside in peace with israel and within internationally recognised borders.
tgt: rona re le afrika borwa re ikemiseditse ho ba karolo ya maiteko ohle a dinaha tsa matjhaba ao sepheo sa ona e leng ho tsoseletsa motjha wa sepolotiki o tla lebisa ho thehweng ha palestina e phethahetseng e ikemetseng, eo baahi ba yona ba tlang ho phela ka kgotso le naha ya iseraele, meeding e tsejwang tlasa melao ya matjhaba.

src: the twostate solution remains the most viable option for the peoples of israel and palestine and must continue to be supported.
tgt: tharollo ya dinaha tse pedi ke yona e tla tswela baahi ba iseraele le ba palestina mo lemo mme e lokela ho nna e tshehetswa.

src: just as israeli security forces were attacking worshippers at the alaqsa mosque, we in south africa were preparing to commemorate the centenary of the bulhoek massacre at a religious site in ntabelanga in the eastern cape.
tgt: nakong eo mabotho a ise raele a neng a hlasela badu medi sebakeng sa borapedi sa al aqsa, afrika borwa mona re ne re itokisetsa ho hopola polao ya batho ya bulhoek ya dilemong tse lekgolo tse fetileng sebakeng sa borapedi sa ntabelanga provenseng ya kapa botjhabela.

src: on 24 may 1921, colonial security forces armed with machine guns and artillery opened fire on worshippers, killing more than 160 people and wounding nearly 130. the massacre laid bare the brutality not only of the police force of the union of south africa, but also the racist system that it was charged to uphold.
tgt: ka la 24 motsheanong 1921, masole a mmuso wa mehleng a neng a hlometse ka dithu nya a ile a hlasela badumedi a bolaya batho ba fetang 160 ka palo ha tswa dikotsi ba batlang ba ba 130. ketsahalo ena e sehloho e ile ya hlakisa bokgopo ba mapolesa a union of south africa , le kgethollo eo mmuso wa nakong eo o neng o kge thetswe ho e netefatsa.

src: just like the dispute in the sheik jarrah neighbourhood, the atrocity at bulhoek was not just about a local dispute; it was fundamentally about the forced dispossession of land, about colonial occupa tion, about racial discrimi nation and about the violent suppression of dissent.
tgt: jwalo ka qhwebeshano ya motseng wa sheik jarrah, sehloho sa bulhoek e ne e se feela hobane batho ba motse ba ne ba hulela nxane ka me hopolo; se ne se amana le ho amohuwa naha, ho nkelwa lefatshe ka leano la bokolo neale, kgethollo ya mmala le dikgoka kgahlano le ba sa dumellaneng le mmuso.

src: as we reflect on the crisis in the middle east and particularly on the suffering of the palestinian people, we would do well to recall the words of selby msimang, a founding member of the african national congress.
tgt: nakong eo re tsepamisang maikutlo bothateng ba dinaha tsa botjhabela bo bohareng, haholoholo tsho tlehong ya mapalestina, re ka ikgopotsa mantswe a selby msimang, e mong wa bathehi ba african national congress.

src: in the aftermath of the bulhoek massacre he wrote: "history has shown that the human soul naturally revolts against injustice".
tgt: kamora polao e sehloho ya batho bulhoeko ile a ngola mantswe ana: "nalane e bontshitse horebatho ba qe tella ba lwantsha kgethollo."

src: the protests and the revolt of the oppressed people of south africa against colonialism and apartheid proved the veracity of this prophecy.
tgt: boipelaetso ba batho ba neng ba hatelletswe ba afrika borwa kgahlano le bokolo neale le mmuso wa kgethollo bo bontshitse matla a sena seileng sa porofetwa.

src: protect children from cyberbullying kgaogelo letsebe csir experts use technology to try and eliminate cyberbullying the cruelty and devastating effects of cyberbul lying on children have been laid bare in recent months.
tgt: sireletsa bana tlhorisong ya metjheng ya kgokahano kgaogelo letsebe ditsebi tsa csir di sebedisa thekenoloji ho leka ho lwantsha tlhoriso ya bana metjheng ya kgokahano.

src: in a recent case of cyberbullying, grade 10 learner lufuno mavhunga, from mbilwi secondary school in limpopo, died by suicide after being beaten by another learner.
tgt: sehloho le ditlamo rao tse tshosang tsa tlhoriso ya bana metjheng ya kgokahano di bile pepeneneng dikgwedi ng tse sa tswa feta.

src: mavhunga overdosed on prescription pills after the video of the beating was shared on social media.
tgt: tabeng ya moraorao e amanang le tlhoriso metjheng ya kgokahano , morutwana wa kereiti ya 10 lufuno mavhunga, wa sekolo sa se kondari sa mbilwi, limpopo, o ipolaile kamora ho tetekwa ke morutwana e mong.

src: cyber security experts from the council for scientific and industrial research (csir) say cyberbullying is extremely harmful to children and can lead to depression, sadness, anger, frustration, anxiety and fear.
tgt: ditsebi tsa tshireletso tlhori song ya metjheng ya kgoka hano tsa lekgotla la dipatli siso tsa mahlale le tshibollo ya tsebo (csir) di re tlhoriso ya metjheng ya kgokahano e kotsi haholo baneng mme e ka baka ho tetebela maikutlo, ho hlora, kgalefo, ho teneha, ngongereho le tshabo.

src: "it can also lead to low selfesteem, delinquency, school violence, family problems and suicidal thoughts," explains csir senior researcher sipho ngobeni.
tgt: "e ka baka le ho se itshepe, diketso tsa tlolo ya molao, dikgoka sekolong, mathata lapeng le menahano ya ho ipolaya," ho hlalosa sipho ngobeni eo e leng mofuputsi ya ka sehloohong csir.

src: cyberbullying occurs when someone uses electronic communication to intentionally harass, threaten, embarrass, intimidate, stalk, humiliate or make fun of another person.
tgt: tlhoriso ya metjheng ya kgokahano e etsahala ha motho a sebedisa dipuisano tsa elektroniki ka sepheo sa ho hlekefetsa, ho tshosa, ho tlontlolla, ho latella le ho soma motho e mong.

src: ngobeni says research shows that 41% of children develop social anxiety after experiencing cyberbullying, 37% develop depression, 26% have suicidal thoughts and 25% engage in selfharm.
tgt: ngobeni o re dipatlisiso di bontsha hore 41% ya bana e ba le bothata ba ho phedisana le batho ba bang kamora ho hloriswa metjheng ya dikgo kahano, 37% ya bana e ba le kgatello maikutlong, 26% e ba le menahano ya ho ipolaya ha 25% e intsha dikotsi.

src: "these findings show that cyberbullying is a serious issue... getting everyone involved – youth, parents, educators, law enforcement and social media companies – is the key to dealing with this problem," he adds.
tgt: "diphetho tsena di bontsha hore tlhoriso ya bana metjheng ya kgokahano e tebile.

src: most cyberbullying, 42%, occurs on instagram, 31% on facebook, 31% on snapchat, 12% on whatsapp, 10% on youtube and 9% on twitter.
tgt: bongata ba diketsahalo tse amanang le tlhoriso metjheng ya kgokahano, e leng 42%, di ho instagram , 31% ho facebook , 31% ho snapchat , 12% ho whatsapp , 10% ho youtube le 9% ho twitter .

src: csir expert rofhiwa netshiya says there is a need for public education about all forms of cyberbullying.
tgt: setsebi sa csir rofhiwa netshiya se re setjhaba se lokela ho rutwa ka mefuta yohle ya tlhoriso ya metjheng ya kgokahano.

src: "we need to educate children that cyberbullying can lead to serious consequences," she says.
tgt: "re lokela ho ruta bana hore tlhoriso ya metjheng ya kgo kahano e ka ba le diphetho tse mpe," ho boletse yena.

src: to tackle cyberbullying, the csir team is working on a platform that detects bullying in chatrooms.
tgt: ho lwantsha bothata bona , sehlopha sa csir se leka ho theha mokgwa wa ho elellwa tlhoriso ya metjheng ya kgokahanodiphaposing tsa ho qoqa tse inthaneteng.

src: "the platform will automatically detect cyberbullying on chat groups and block users who continue to send hate speech.
tgt: "mokgwa ona o tla fofonela diketso tsa ho hloriswa ha ba bang dihlopheng tsa meqoqo, o thibele ba romelang me laetsa e sa lokang.

src: it will give the user three warning messages and, if they persist, it will block them," says netshiya.
tgt: ba etsang jwalo ba tla kgalengwa ka ho hlokomediswa makgetlo a mararo ka melaetsa ya bona mme ebang ba tswela pele ba tla thibelwa ho romela mela etsa," ho bolela netshiya.

src: she advises parents to install basic internet monitoring software on their children's devices to monitor their activities.
tgt: o eletsa batswadi ho kenya software e behang dike tsahalo tsa inthanete leihlo diselfounung le ho tse ding tsa bana ba bona ho bona tse etsahalang.

src: "there are lowcost products that can invisibly monitor the activities of your kids and privately email you the results as often as you like.
tgt: "ho na le disebediswa tseo e seng tsa ditjeho tse hodimo tse ka shebang tse etswang ke bana ba lona mme tsa le romella diimeili tsa sephiri ka makgetlo ao le a behang.

src: these are very important to track internet sites visited, downloads, chatroom conversations and instant messaging.
tgt: sena se bohlokwa haholo ha o batla ho lekola diwe bsaete tseo ngwana a kenang ho tsona, ho bona seo ba se monyollang inthaneteng le meqoqo ya diphaposing tsa ho qoqa tsa inthanete.

src: "the csir offers the following tips for parents who suspect their children are victims of cyberbullying: ensure the child feels safe, show unconditional support.
tgt: "csir e eletsa batswadi ho etsa tse latelang ebang ba belaela hore bana ba bona ke mahlatsipa a tlhoriso ya metjheng ya kgokahano: etsa bonnete ba hore ngwa na o ikutlwa a bolokehile, o mo tshehetse ka dinako tsohle.

src: work with your child to arrive at a course of action that you both agree on.
tgt: thusa ngwanahao le nke mohato o loketseng oo le dumellanang ka ona wa ho rarolla bothata bona.

src: discuss the cyberbullying matter with the relevant school.
tgt: bua le sekolo sa ngwana ka tlhoriso ya metjheng ya kgokahano.

src: contact parents of the aggressor to investigate the matter and remove offending material.
tgt: ikopanye le batswadi ba ya hlekefetsang o batlisise taba ena mme o tlose tse phatlaladitsweng ho intha nete tse sa lokang.

src: report the issue to police in the case of physical threats or extortion, stalking, blackmail and the sexual exploitation of minors.
tgt: tlaleha taba ena mapo leseng ebang e amana le ditshoso tsa ho otla kapa ho qhekella, ho latella le tlatlapo ya motabo ya bana.

src: educate your child about appropriate online behaviour.
tgt: ruta ngwanahao ka boitshwaro bo loketseng ha a sebedisa inthanete.

src: sa strives to realise the vision of the constitution vukuzenzele unnamed sixty years ago, on 31 may 1961, apartheid south africa became a republic, cutting its ties with the british empire.
tgt: afrika borwa e ikemiseditse ho phethahatsa pono ya molaotheo vukuzenzele unnamed dilemong tse 60 tse fetileng, ka la 31 motsheanong 1961, afrika borwa e ile ya fetoha rephaboliki ya kgethollo, ya kgaola dikamano tsa yona le mmuso wa brithani.

src: while a ‘republic’ is generally defined as a state in which supreme power is held by the people and their elected representatives, this was not the case in south africa.
tgt: empa le ha ‘rephaboliki’ e hlaloswa e le naha eo e laolwang ke batho ba yona le bakgethwa ba bona, hone ho se jwalo afrika borwa.

src: the constitution of the apartheid republic pledged allegiance to god, "who gathered our forebears together from many lands and gave them this as their own".
tgt: molaotheo wa rephaboliki ya kgethollo o ne o ena setlamo le modimo, "ya ileng a jara baholoholo ba bona mmoho ho tswa mafatsheng a mangatangata a ba fa lena lefatshe ho ba la bona".

src: it was a constitution written by and for a racial minority, and it used faith to justify tyranny.
tgt: e ne e le molaotheo o ngotsweng le ho ngollwa ba morabe o monyane, mme o ne o sebedisa tumelo ho buella bohanyapetsi.

src: it outlined the administration of government, providing that only white people were eligible to vote and serve as public representatives.
tgt: o ne o totobatsa tsamaiso ya mmuso, o dumellang batho ba basweu feela ho kgona ho kgetha le ho eba baemedi ba setjhaba.

src: it contained no bill of rights.
tgt: o ne o sa kenyeletsa bili ya ditokelo.

src: the country’s majority was relegated to a footnote towards the end of its 121 provisions, in a section titled ‘administration of bantu affairs, etc.’.
tgt: boholo ba batho ba naha bo ne bo wela tlasa mongolong o tlase leqepheng pheletsong ya diphumantsho tsa ona tse 121, mokgahlelong wa sehlooho sa ‘tsamaiso ya ditaba tsa bathobatsho, jwalojwalo.’molaetseng o neng o haswa telebesheneng, tonakgolo hf verwoerd o ile a re: "re hloka ntshetsopele ya merabe ya rona ka tsela e itseng.

src: here the solution is openly sought by retaining the white man’s guiding hand.
tgt: morerong ona ho totobetse hore re tlameha ho tswella ka ho buswa ke motho ya mosweu.

src: "we are very happy to be a united people," he declared to the world.
tgt: ""re thabetse haholo ho ba batho ba kopaneng," o ile a tsebisa lefatshe.

src: but the reality was that we were not a united people.
tgt: empa nnete ke hore re ne re se batho ba kopaneng.

src: we were inhabitants of a country where one’s rights, prospects and life expectancy was determined by one’s race.
tgt: re ne re le baahi ba naha eo ditokelo tsa motho, katleho ya hae le bophelo ba hae bo leng matsohong a motho wa morabe o mong.

src: for two decades, the republic of south africa constitution act of 1961 was the legal impetus for the repression of nearly 90% of the south african population.
tgt: ka dilemo tse mashome a mabedi, molao wa molaotheo wa rephaboliki ya afrika borwa wa 1961 e ne e le tshusumetso ya semolao ya mola wa kgatello ya batho ba kabang 90% wa setjhaba sa afrika borwa.

src: this unhappy anniversary took place in the same month that we celebrated the 25th anniversary of the adoption by the constitutional assembly of our new democratic constitution, which became the birth certificate of a real united nation.
tgt: sehopotso sena se sa thabiseng se nkile sebaka hona kgweding eo re ketekang sehopotso sa dilemo di 25 tsa phatlalatso ya seboka sa molaotheo sa molaotheo wa rona o motjha wa demokrasi, o ileng wa ba bopaki ba tswalo e ntjha ya nnete ya naha e kopaneng.

src: now we have one law for one nation.
tgt: ha jwale re na le molao o le mong o laolang setjhaba se le seng.

src: together, we have chosen for ourselves a system of government that gives true meaning to the concept of a republic.
tgt: mmoho, re ikgethetse tsamaiso ya mmuso e fanang ka tlhaloso ya nnete ya mohopolo wa rephaboliki.

src: we have said that in our democratic republic, everyone is equal before the law and has the right to equal protection and benefit of the law.
tgt: re ile ra re ka hara rephaboliki ya rona ya demokrasi, bohle ba ya lekana ka pela molao mme ba na le tokelo ya tshireletso le ho una molemo molaong ka ho lekana.

src: south africa today is a country where the administration of justice is vested in independent courts and a judiciary that is subject only to the constitution.
tgt: kajeno afrika borwa ke naha eo tsamaiso ya toka e tsetetsweng makgotleng a ikemetseng le tsa toka tse ikamahantshang le molaotheo feela.

src: we live in a country where everyone has the right to approach the courts for the fulfilment of their rights.
tgt: re phela naheng eo bohle ba nang le tokelo ya ho ya makgotleng ho ya phethahatsa ditokelo tsa bona.

src: we live in a country where communities can stake a legal claim on land they were forcefully moved from, and where individuals or families are protected against arbitrary eviction from their homes.
tgt: re phela naheng eo ditjhaba di ka kenyang kopo ya molao ho tseka mobu oo ba ileng ba tloswa ho ona ka dikgoka, mme moo batho kapa malapa ba tshireleditsweng kgahlano le ho lelekwa malapeng a bona.

src: we live in a country where everyone is permitted to freely practise their culture and traditions.
tgt: re phela nahaneg eo bohle ba dumeletsweng ho phethahatsa setso le meetlo ya bona ka bolokolohi.

src: it is a country where anyone can freely protest in support of social, political and other causes anywhere.
tgt: ke naha eo mang kapa mang a ka ipiletsang ka bolokolohi ho tshehetsa matsholo a setjhaba, a dipolotiki kapa a mang kae kapa kae.

src: our constitutional dispensation is premised on accountable government, where the executive is answerable to the people and where parliament is representative of the people.
tgt: motheo wa molaotheo wa rona o thehilwe hodima mmuso o ikarabella, moo komiti ya phethahatso e ikarabellang komiting ya palamente e leng kemedi ya batho.

src: it is a country where the law applies equally to any citizen.
tgt: ke naha eo molao o akaretsang moahi ofe kapa ofe ka ho lekana.

src: we now have a government of the people, for the people and by the people.
tgt: ha jwale re se re ena le mmuso wa batho, o busang batho, o buswang ke batho.

src: when the apartheid regime triumphantly paraded its racist constitution to the world 60 years ago, it had misplaced confidence that it would endure.
tgt: ha mmuso wa kgethollo o ne o bapatsa molaotheo wa ona o nang le kgethollo ka sebete lefatsheng dilemong tse 60 tse fetileng, o ne o ena le tshepo e fosahetseng ya hore o tlo kgona ho tshwarella.

src: in an unanswered letter to verwoerd a month before the republic was declared, nelson mandela affirmed the liberation movement’s rejection of the forcibly imposed white republic.
tgt: lengolong le ileng la se arabelwe ke verwoerd kgwedi pele rephaboliki e phatlalatswa, nelson mandela o ile a tiisa tatolo ya mokgatlo wa tokoloho ya rephaboliki ya ba basweu e kentsweng pusong ka qobello.

src: he said that no constitution or form of government decided without the participation of the african people would enjoy moral validity.
tgt: o itse ha hona molaotheo kapa karolo ya mmuso e phethahaditsweng ntle le ho nka karolo ha batho ba maafrika o ka netefallwang ke boitshwaro ba nnete.

src: indeed no system that entrenches the systematic denial of people’s rights can be sustained.
tgt: ka nnete, ha ho mmuso o thehilweng ka tsamaiso e iphapanyetsang ditokelo tsa batho o ka bang wa mokoka.

src: though it would be over three decades before the demands of the liberation movement were met, we eventually won our freedom.
tgt: le ha feela ho nkile dilemo tse fetang mashome a mararo pele dikopo tsa mokgatlo wa tokoloho di phethahatswa, re ile ra qetella re hlotse tokoloho ya rona.

src: in relegating the apartheid constitution to the dustbin of history, we committed ourselves to a new constitution and a new set of values.
tgt: ho theoleng molaotheo wa kgethollo ho ya moqomong wa nalane, re itlamme ka molaotheo o motjha le ditekanyetso tse nang le boleng tse ntjha.

src: when i addressed the constitutional assembly 25 years ago, i said our constitution must become more than words on a page; it must become a reality in the lives of our people.
tgt: ha ke ne ke fana ka puo ya seboka sa molaotheo dilemong tse 25 tse fetileng, ke ile ka re molaotheo wa rona o tlameha ho ba hofeta mantsweng a leqhepeng; o tlameha ho fetolwa nnete maphelong a batho ba rona.

src: unless we do so, this progressive and revolutionary document will be rendered irrelevant and meaningless.
tgt: ntle le ha re ka etsa jwalo, tokomane ena ya kgatelopele le phetoho e keke ya re tswela molemo mme e tlabe e sena le moelelo.

src: it is a society rooted in human dignity, equality, freedom and nondiscrimination.
tgt: re batla ho ba setjhaba se tsepameng hodima seriti sa botho, se nang le tekatekano, se nang le tokoloho le ho hloka kgethollo.

src: for a quarter of a century we have worked to build such a society.
tgt: re na le kotara ya dilemo tse lekgolo re sebetsa ka thata ho aha setjhaba se jwalo.

src: we have made undeniable progress, but we still have many challenges and there is much work still to be done.
tgt: re fihleletse kgatelopele e ngata, empa re ntse re ena le diphepetso tse mmalwa mme ho ntse ho setse mosebetsi o mongata o hlokang ho phethahatswa.

src: as we mark the anniversary of the adoption of our democratic constitution, let us remember what a decisive break it was with the system underpinned by racism, exploitation, dispossession and oppression that had come before.
tgt: ha re tshwaya keteko ya kamohelo ya molaotheo wa demokrasi, ha re hopoleng hore re tswa hole jwang mmusong o neng o tsamaiswa ka kgethollo, bohanyapetsi, kamoho ya mobu le kgatello tsa nako e fetileng.

src: let us also remember that it is up to us to make the vision contained in our constitution a reality.
tgt: ha re boeleng re hopole hore ho rona re tlameile ho phethahatsa pono e leng ka hara molaotheo wa rona.

src: dreams come true for tafelkop community vukuzenzele unnamed a group of black farmers in tafelkop in grob lersdal, limpopo are the proud owners of 189 hectares of land, which they have been farming for the past 25 years.
tgt: ditoro tsa setjhaba sa tafelkop di ya phethahala vukuzenzele unnamed sehlopha sa di hwai tsa batho ba batsho se dulang tafelkop, mane gro blersdal, limpopo, ke beng ba dihektare tsa mobu tse 189 ba motlo tlo, tseo esale ba ntse ba di lema ka dilemo tse fetang 25. dihwai tsena tse 30 di ile tsa fumantshwa dititle deed tsa mobu ke mopresidente cyril ramaphosa ka mora hore lefapha la ditshebeletso tsa setjhaba le metheo le fetisetse mobu oo sepheong sa kabobotjha.

src: the 30 farmers received title deeds for the land from president cyril ramaphosa after the department of public works and infrastructure transferred it for land redistribution purposes.
tgt: boleng ba mobu oo bo feta r25.5 milione empa o fuwe dihwai mahala.

src: "this is indeed a great day for the community of tafelkop, for the people of limpopo and for the whole of south africa.
tgt: "ka nnete lena ke letsatsi le leholo ho setjhaba sa tafelkop, ho batho ba limpopo, le afrika borwa ka kakaretso.

src: "today we are witnessing a community’s dream being fulfilled.
tgt: "kajeno re paka ha toro ya setjhaba e phethahatswa.

src: it is the vision that this community has spent the past 25 years fighting to see realised," said the president at the handover ceremony.
tgt: ke pono eo setjhaba sena se qetileng dilemo tse 25 tse fetileng se ntse se lwanela ho e bona e phethahala," ho rialo mopresidente moketeng wa phetisetso.

src: the farmers have been successfully farming various agricultural produce on the land since 1996. they organised themselves in the 1990s to be registered commercial farmers under the banner of the tafelkop farmers association and started to engage government.
tgt: ho tloha ka 1996 esale dihwai tsena di atleha ho hlahisa dihlahiswa tse fapaneng ho tswa mobung ona.

src: in 2000, the then national department of agriculture entered into lease agreements with the tafelkop farmers association in terms of the land redistribution for agricultural development programme.
tgt: dilemong tsa bo1990 ba ile ba ikgobokanya ho ingodisa jwalo ka dihwai tsa kgwebo ka tlasa flolaga ya tafelkop farmers association mme ba kena dipuisanong le mmuso.

src: in 2009, the former limpopo department of agri culture recommended to the department of public works that the land be transferred to the farmers.
tgt: ka 2000, lefapha la naha la temothuo le ile la kena tumellanong ya khiriso le tafelkop farmers association ho ya ka kabobotjha ya mobu ya lenaneo la ntshetsopele ya temothuo.

src: the deeds were registered in the names of the farmers earlier this year.
tgt: ka 2009, lefapha la temothuo la limpopo la nako e fetileng le ile la kgothaletsa lefapha la ditshebeletso tsa setjhaba hore le fetisetse mobu ho dihwai tsena.

src: the land is currently being used to farm tobacco, cotton and fresh produce.
tgt: ha jwale mobu o sebedisetswa ho lema kwae, le khothone le meroho le ditholwana.

src: thirtytwo households are supported by the land and farming activities which provide employment to 128 permanent workers and up to 320 seasonal workers.
tgt: malapa a 32 a iphedisa ka temo le bohwai mobung ona e leng se fanang ka mesebetsi e 128 ho basebetsi ba moshwelella le mesebetsi e 320 ho basebetsi ba nakwana.

src: justice for the communitythe president said the com munity had endured many hardships over the years and the "title deeds bring justice to a dispossessed community".
tgt: tokoloho ya setjhabamopresidente o itse setjhaba se ile sa mamella tshotleho ka dilemo tse ngata mme "mangolo a ho ba beng ba mobu a tlisa toka ho setjhaba se neng se amohuwe mobu".

src: "we have not forgotten the dispossession, land theft and forced removals that the people of this community and many communities across the country had to endure.
tgt: "ha re so lebale kamoho, boshodu ba mobu le ho tloswa ka mahahapa ha batho ba setjhaba sena le ditjhaba tse ding tse ngatangata naheng ka bophara di ileng tsa di mamella.

src: "we have not forgotten the harsh legacy of farming here in limpopo, where farmdwellers were forced to be labour tenants on their forefathers’ land and not allowed to own land to feed their families or graze their animals."
tgt: "ha re so lebala lefa le sehloho la temo mona limpopo, moo baahi ba dipolasing ba ileng ba qobellwa ho sebetsa dipolasing e le tsela ya ho lefella bodulo ba bona mobung wa bontatamoholo ba bona, mme ba sa dumellwa ho eba le mobu kapa ho fepa ba malapa a bona kapa ho fulisa mehlape ya bona.

src: he added that black farmworkers were exploited and abused in what was previously the northern transvaal.
tgt: "o ile a tlatsaletsa ka hore basebetsi ba dipolasing ba ile ba hanyapetswa le ho hlekefetswa nakong eo profense ena e neng e bitswa northern transvaal"re boela re hopola le mokgwa oo mmuso wa kgethollo ka mmala o neng o tshehetsa dihwai tsa ba basweu ka disebediswa, tshehetso ya thekheniki le ho fumantshwa mekitlana ya ho aha dikgwebo tsa bona, empa dihwai tsa batho ba batsho tse neng di thuthuha di ile tsa sokola ho iphedisa.

src: "we also recall how the apartheid government supported white farmers with equipment, technical support and access to credit to build their businesses, but black subsistence farmers struggled to survive.
tgt: "ho fetola indasteri ya temothuomopresidente o itse phano ya mobu e fana ka tshepo hobane e bontsha hore ka tshehetso le menyetla e napahetseng, indasteri ya temothuo e ka fetolwa molemong wa naha.

src: "transforming the agricultural industrythe president said the trans fer of land inspires hope because it shows that with the right support and opportunities, the agricultural industry can be transformed for the benefit of the country.
tgt: "re keteka kgatelopele, hobane letsatsi le letsatsi lenaneo la rona la kabobotjha ya mobu le ntse le hatela pele.

src: "to date, government has redistributed over five million hectares of land, totalling around 5 500 farms, to more than 300 000 beneficiaries."
tgt: "ho fihlela ha jwale, mmuso o se o abilebotjha dihektara tse fetang dimilione tse hlano tsa mobu, ho lekantshang dipolasi tse 5 500, ho batho ba uneng molemo ba fetang 300 000.

src: so far, the land restitution process has benefited over two million land claimants and resulted in the transfer of around 2.7 million hectares.
tgt: "ha jwale, tsamaiso ya kgutlisetso ya mobu e tswetse molemo bakenyi ba dikopo tsa mobu ba uneng molemo ba fetang dimilione tse pedi mme dihektara tse ka bang dimilione tse 2.7 di abuwe.

src: "land reform isn’t just in the interests of redress, justice and social cohesion.
tgt: "kabobotjha ya mobu ha e molemong wa ho lokisa, toka le momahano ya setjhaba feela.

src: it is also about economic development.
tgt: e boela e le le ka ntshetsopele ya moruo.

src: agriculture and the agriculture value chain can and must transform rural economies," said president ramaphosa.
tgt: temothuo le tsamaiso ya ho eketsa boleng ho tsa temothuo di tlameha ho fetola meruo ya mahaeng," ho rialo mopresidente ramaphosa.

src: government plans to establish a land and agrarian reform agency to fasttrack land reform.
tgt: mmuso o ikemiseditse ho thakgola kemedi ya tlhabollo ya tsa temo ho potlakisa kabobotjha ya mobu.

src: "we are looking at how effective our past policies have been.
tgt: "re shebile ka mokgwa oo maano a rona a nako e fetileng a ileng a sebetsa ka teng.

src: we are going to address this issue of land reform urgently.
tgt: re tlo shebana le ntlha ena ya kabobotjha ya mobu ka potlako.

src: "addressing past mistakesthe president said govern ment was working hard to correct what went wrong during the apartheid years and since the start of de mocracy.
tgt: "ho lokisa diphoso tsa nako e fetilengmopresidente o re mmuso o sebetsa ka thata ho lokisa se ileng sa senyeha nakong ya dilemo tsa mmuso wa kgethollo ka mmala le diphoso tse entsweng ka mora qalo ya demokrasi.

src: "we do this in tribute to those who lived among us; who resided here.
tgt: "re etsa sena ho ananela ba ileng ba phela hara rona; ba neng ba dula mona.

src: "land reform is vital to improving the country’s food security, building an inclusive economy and providing a better future for all south africans, added the president.
tgt: "kabobotjha ya mobu e bohlokwahlokwa ntlafatsong ya hore naha e be le dijo tse lekaneng, e ahe moruo o kenyeletsang bohle le ho nehela ka bokamoso bo betere ho maafrika borwa ohle, ho tlatseletsa mopresidente.

src: he urged the tafelkop farmers to use the land wisely and for the benefit of the community.
tgt: o ipileditse ho dihwai tsa tafelkop ho sebedisa mobu ka bohlale moleng wa setjhaba sa bona.

src: "for me, today has been the best day in the office; to kick the soil and dust and see your produce.
tgt: "ho nna, kajeno ke letsatsi le thabisang haholo mosebetsing wa ka; ho itlisa mona ka seqo ho tla bona ditholwana tsa lona.

src: "i have no doubt that with the commitment and energy of all involved, this project will continue to thrive," he said.
tgt: "ha ke na qeaqeo ya hore ka boitelo le mafolofolo a batho bohle ba bileng le seabo, projeke ena e tla tswella ho atleha," o rialo.

src: chairperson of the tafelkop farmers association jerry sefoloshe thanked government for making it possible for the farmers to become the owners of the land they have worked for decades.
tgt: modulosetulo wa tafelkop farmers association, jerry sefoloshe, o lebohile mmuso ka ho phethahatsa hore dihwai e be beng ba mobu oo ba o sebeditseng ka mashomeshome a dilemo.

src: the youth are our greatest asset vukuzenzele unnamed on june 16th 1976, the youth of soweto and other parts of the country rose up against the iniquity of bantu education.
tgt: batjha ba bohlokwa haholo ho rona vukuzenzele unnamed ka la 16 phupjane 1976, batjha ba soweto le ba dikarolo tse ding tsa naha ba ile ba tsohela matla bo kgopo bo neng bo amana le thuto e neng ereretswe batho ba batsho.

src: on that day and in the days that followed, many lost their lives.
tgt: letsatsing leo le matsatsing a latelang batho ba bangata ba ile ba timela.

src: they were killed by a callous regime that had little regard for black lives and thought nothing of opening fire on unarmed, uniformed schoolchildren.
tgt: ba bolawa ke mmuso o kgopo o neng o sa kgathalle maphelo a batho ba batsho mme o sa qeaqee ho thunya barutwana ba sa hlomelang ba apereng yunifomo.

src: these events hardened international opinion against the apartheid regime and gave further impetus to the liberation struggle.
tgt: diketsahalo tsena di ile tsa baka hore dinaha tsa matjhaba di be le kgalefo kgahlano le mmuso wa kgethollo mme tsa matlafatsa le ntwa ya tokoloho.

src: young people have always been at the forefront of social protest, from the antiauthoritarian protests in latin america in the late 1950s, to the protests across africa in the late 1960s.
tgt: batjha esale ba itlhomme pele boipelaetsong ba batho, ho tloha boipelaetsong kgahlano le bokgehlepetsi dinaheng tsa latin america ho ella mafelong a bo 1950, le mehwantong ya boipelaetso ho phatlalla le afrika ho ella mafelong a bo 1960. seabo sa moloko wa 1976 boipelaetsong ba baithuti boemong ba matjhaba le ntwa ya bona kgahlano le kgatello le tlhokeho ya toka di ke ke tsa lebalwa.

src: this historic event 45 years ago continues to be commemorated across africa and the world.
tgt: ketsahalo ena ya bohlokwa ya dilemong tse 45 tse fetileng e ntse e hopolwa afrika le lefatsheng.

src: it is therefore disturbing that knowledge of june 16th is diminishing among young south africans.
tgt: ka hona ho a swabisa ho bona letsatsi la la 16 phupjane le ntse le lebaleha batjheng ba afrika borwa.

src: this is particularly so among the socalled generation z, or young people born between 1997 and 2015. the 2019/2020 south african social attitudes survey published by the human sciences research council found that close to 40% of generation z has not heard of the historical events of june 16th.
tgt: sena se jele setsi batjheng ba generation z e leng ba hlahileng pakeng tsa 1997 le 2005. lekgotla la diphuputso tsa mahlale a batho le phatlaladitse diphuputso tsa maiku tlo a setjhaba afrika borwa tsa 2019/2020 tse fumaneng hore batjha ba batlang ba etsa 40% ba generation z ha ba tsebe letho ka diketsahalo tsa la 16 phupjane.

src: a similar percentage has heard about it but knows very little or nothing about it.
tgt: ba bang ba ballwang persenteng eo ba utlwile ka letsatsi lena empa ba tseba hanyenyane kapa ha ba tsebe letho ka lona.

src: nevertheless, the survey also found that young people of this generation are open to learning about key historical events and believe in their continued importance.
tgt: leha ho le jwalo phuputso ena e boetse e fumane hore batjha ba moloko ona ba na le thahasello ya ho ithuta ka diketsahalo tsa kgale tsa bohlokwa mme ba dumela hore di molemo.

src: we need to do more as a country to ensure that the message of 1976 is transmitted faithfully.
tgt: re lokela ho sebetsa ka matla re le naha ho netefatsa hore molaetsa wa 1976 o fetiswa hantle.

src: this is a collective responsibility of government, schools, tertiary institutions, parents, families, musicians, artists, and all of society.
tgt: bona ke boikarabelo ba bohle ho kenyeletsa mmuso, dikolo, ditheo tsa thuto e phahameng, batswadi, malapa, dibini, ba tsa bono no, le setjhaba ka kakaretso.

src: the generation that was born after apartheid ended inherited a country with a democratic constitution and where fundamental freedoms are protected.
tgt: moloko o hlahileng kamora ho putlama ha mmuso wa kgethollo o tswaletswe naheng e nang le molao wa motheo wa demokrasi le moo bolokolohi bo sireletswang.

src: the opportunities young black people have today are both vastly different and greatly improved.
tgt: menyetla eo batjha ba kajeno ba nang le yona e fapane haholo ha e bapiswa le ya ba kgale.

src: keeping the story of june 16th alive is a reminder to today’s generation of the great sacrifices made to secure their freedom.
tgt: ho bua ka letsatsi la la 16 phupjane ke sehopotso ho batjha ba kajeno, sa sehlabelo se seholo seo ba intshitseng sona molemong wa tokoloho.

src: youth day is a reminder of the immense power and agency that young people have to create a better future for themselves.
tgt: letsatsi la batjha ke sehopotso se matla ho batjha le hore ba lokela ho nka bohato ho ipetlela bokamoso bo botle.

src: the struggles of young people in south africa today are many.
tgt: a mangata mathata a batjha ba afrika borwa kajeno.

src: young people have remained at the forefront of activism, whether in pursuit of free education or against social ills like genderbased violence.
tgt: batjha esale ba itlhomme pele matsholong a ho tseka thuto e sa lefellweng,le kgahlano le mathata a setjhabeng a kang dikgoka haholoholo kga hlano le basadi le banana.

src: today the greatest struggle young people wage is against unemployment, which has worsened under the covid19 pandemic.
tgt: ntwa eo batjha ba e lwanang kajeno e kgahlano le tlhokeho ya mosebetsi, e mpefadi tsweng ke sewa sa covid19.

src: creating more opportunities for young people, and access to these opportunities, is government’s foremost priority.
tgt: mosebetsi wa bohlokwa wa mmuso ke ho bulela batjha menyetla le ho netefatsa hore ba a e fihlella.

src: everything that we do as a government contributes towards improving the lives of young people.
tgt: sepheo ka tsohle tseo re di etsang re le mmuso ke ho kenya letsoho ntlafatsong ya maphelo a batjha.

src: tackling youth unemployment requires accelerating economic growth, particularly in labourintensive sectors, and building the capability of the state to fulfil its developmental role.
tgt: ntwa kgahlano le tlhokeho ya mosebetsi batjheng e hloka hore ho potlakiswe kgolo ya mosebetsi, haholoholo makaleng a hlokang basebetsi ba bangata, ho ahwe bokgoni ba mmuso ba ho phethahatsa mosebetsi wa ona wa ho hodisa moruo le ho lwantsha bofuma.

src: we are also driving this agenda through targeted interventions.
tgt: re tsamaisa leano lena ka matsholo a kgethehileng.

src: these include the presidential employment stimulus, which has provided work opportunities and livelihoods support for many young people.
tgt: a kenyeletsa letsholo la mmuso la presidential employment stimulus le nehang batho menyetla ya mosebetsi le le thusang batjha ba bangata ho iphedisa.

src: we have launched a range of additional measures to create opportunities, enhance skills development, support young entrepreneurs and enable the full participation of young people in the economy.
tgt: re thakgotse mehato e meng e mengata ya ho theha menyetla, ya ho ntlafatsa ntshetsopele ya tsebo ya mosebetsi, ya ho tshehetsa beng ba dikgwebo ba banyenyane le ho thusa batjha ho kena moruong ka botlalo.

src: this includes the establishment of a national pathway management network, sa youth, to make it easier for young people to view and access opportunities and receive active support to find pathways into the labour market.
tgt: sena se kenyeletsa ho thehwa ha national pathway management network, sa youth, ho thusa batjha ho bona le ho fihlella menyetla le ho fumana tshehetso le ho kgona ho kena mosebetsing.

src: these are among the priorities of the presidential youth employment intervention, which was launched just weeks before we entered a national lockdown last year and which is now entering full implementation.
tgt: tsena ke tse ding tse behilweng pele ke presidential youth employment interve ntion, e thakgotsweng dibeke pele ho kwalwa ditshebeletso naheng ngwahola, eo jwale e kenang tshebetsong ka ho phethahala.

src: the presidential youth employment intervention was built on the understanding that addressing the youth unemployment crisis requires innovative thinking and strong partnerships across society.
tgt: presidential youth emplo yment intervention e thehilwe ho utlwisiswa hore ho lwa ntshwaha bothata ba tlhoke ho ya mosebetsi batjheng ho hloka mawa a matjha le tshebedisano pakeng tsa bohle setjhabeng.

src: its ultimate objective is to find models that work, whether in skills development or active labour market policies, and to scale these rapidly to reach as many young people as possible.
tgt: maikemisetso a ka sehloohong ka lenaneo lena ke ho sibolla mekgwa e sebe tsang hantle, ntshetsopeleng ya tsebo ya mosebetsi kapa maanong adibakeng tsa mosebetsi, le ho hlophisa tsena ka potlako hore di finyelle batjheng ba bangata kamoo ho ka kgonehang kateng.

src: most importantly, it recognises that young people must be at the centre of any effort to boost youth employment.
tgt: sa bohlokwa haholo ke hore ka lenaneo lena ho dumelwa hore batjha ba lokela ho ba pele matsapeng afe kapa afe a ho matlafatsa khiro ya bona.

src: young people are our greatest asset, and our greatest weapon in this fight.
tgt: batjha ba bohlokwahlokwa ho rona, mmeke sebetsa se seholo sa rona ntweng ena.

src: we salute the resilience of every young person playing their part to build and develop this country.
tgt: re tlotla batjha ka ho bontsha sebete,le ka seabo sa bona kahong le ntshetsopeleng ya naha ena.

src: they are the young people volunteering in our communities, building our country through the presidential employment stimulus, running their own businesses and studying to better themselves.
tgt: ke batjha bao e leng baithaopi metseng ya rona, ba aha naha ena ka lenaneo la mmuso la presidential employment stimulus la ho thusa batho ho iphedisa, ba tsamaisale dikgwebo tsa bona, ba boetse ba shebane le dithuto tsa bona ka sepheo sa ho ntlafafatsa maphelo a bona.

src: they are the young people who are forging their own path and bringing their families along with them.
tgt: ke batjha ba ipetlelang tsela ya bona ba sa siye morao beng ka bona.

src: we salute young people who keep working to improve their lives.
tgt: re tlotla batjha ba rona ba ntseng ba sebeletsa ho ntshe tsa pele maphelo a bona.

src: prevent burns this winter allison cooper just as winter brings with it the need to keep warm, it also increases the risk of burn injuries from candles, fires, stoves, heaters and boiling water.
tgt: thibela dikotsi tsa ho tjha mariheng ana allison cooper mariha a baka hore batho ba batle ho iphuthumatsa, mme a boetse a atisa dikotsi tsa ho tjheswa ke dikerese, mello, ditofo, dihitara le metsi a belang.

src: "burn injuries inc rease dramatically during winter and parents and caregivers need to be extra careful to ensure their own and their children’s safety," says doctor gary dos passos.
tgt: "dikotsi tsa ho tjha di ata haholo mariha mme batswadi le bahlokomedi ba bana ba lokela ho ba sedi haholo ho netefatsa hore bona le bana ba a bolokeha," ho bolela ngaka gary dos passos.

src: he is the head of the burns unit at the red cross war memorial children’s hospital (rcwmch) and an executive committee member of the burn society of south africa.
tgt: ke hlooho ya yuniti ya dikotsi tsa ho tjha red cross war memorial children’s hospital (rcwmch) mme o boetse ke setho sa komiti ya phethahatso sa burn society of south africa.

src: while accidental fires are inevitable, many burn injuries can be prevented with vigilance, proper adult supervision and safer practices.
tgt: leha dikotsi tse itlhahelang di sa lebellwa di etsahala, dikotsi tse ngata tsa ho tjha di ka thibelwa ka ho ba hlokolosi, ka tlhokomelo ya batho ba baholo e nepahetseng le ka ho nka mehato ya polokeho.

src: "flame burns are devastat ing injuries with substantial lifelong physical and psychosocial consequences for the affected survivors and their families," says dr dos passos.
tgt: "maqeba a mollo ke dikotsi tse mpe tse nang le ditlamorao tse matla mmeleng le maikutlong le bophelong ho mahlatsipa le beng ka ona," ho boletsengaka dos passos.

src: here are some tips: keep matches, lighters, accelerants (petrol and paraffin), candles, gas and paraffin lamps and heaters out of children’s reach.
tgt: ke tsena dikeletso: netefatsa hore bana ha ba fihlelle dithutswana tsa mollo, dilaetara, petrole le parafini, dikerese, kgase le mabone a parafini.

src: this is extremely dangerous.
tgt: sena se kotsi haholo.

src: do not let children play near paraffin or gas lamps or heaters.
tgt: se dumelle bana ho bapalla haufi le mabone a parafini kapa a kgase kapa dihitara.

src: do not hold a child while cooking or leave children unsupervised in or near the kitchen.
tgt: se ka sikara ngwana ha o phehile mme o se ka siya bana ba le bang ka kitjhining kapa pela yona.

src: ensure the kettle is out of reach.
tgt: netefatsa hore bana ha ba fihlelle ketlele.

src: buy a cordless kettle if you can.
tgt: reka ketlele e se nang thapo ebang ho kgoneha.

src: put candles in a deep glass bottle with sand at the bottom so that they will go out if they fall over.
tgt: fetola mehele ya pitsa hore e se shebe bokapeleng ba setofo kenya kerese botlolong e tebileng ya kgalase e nang le lehlabathe tlase mane le tla etsa hore kerese e time ebang e ewa.

src: the heat stays in the sand for hours.
tgt: motjheso o dula lehlabatheng dihora.

src: put cold water in the bath first, and then add hot water.
tgt: tshela metsi a batang pele ka bateng, o latele ka a tjhesang.

src: always test the bath water with your elbow first.
tgt: utlwa motjheso wa metsi a bateng ka setswe pele.

src: if you sustain a burn injury involving flames, stop, drop to the ground and roll to put out the flames.
tgt: ebang o tswa kotsi ka lebaka la malakabe a mollo, itahlele fatshe o pitike, malakabe a tlo tima.

src: "heat from a fire, hot water or electrical burn will continue to burn the tissue long after the contact is removed.
tgt: "motjheso wa mollo, wa metsi a tjhesang kapa wa motlakase o tswela pele ho tjhesa letlalo leha motho a se a tlohile ho se mo tjhesang.

src: soes must drive economic growth and transformation vukuzenzele unnamed for some years now, south africa’s stateowned enterprises (soes) have mostly been associated in the public eye with state capture, financial mismanagement and inefficiency.
tgt: dikhampani tsa mmuso di tlameha ho ntshetsa pele kgolo ya moruo le diphetoho vukuzenzele unnamed e se e le dilengwana jwale dikgwebo tsa mmuso (disoe) tsa afrika borwa, mahlong a setjhaba, di amahanngwa le ho hulwa ha puso ka nko, tshebediso e mpe ya ditjhelete le ho se sebetse hantle.

src: in addition to needing regular bailouts from government, some of the country’s biggest and most important stateowned companies have been struggling to meet their mandates.
tgt: hodima hore mmuso o nne o di ntshe dikolotong hangatangata, tse ding tsa dikhampani tsa mmuso, tse kgolo ka ho fetisisa, tse bileng di le molemo ka ho fetisisa, di nnile tsa hloleha ho phetha merero ya tsona.

src: these soes should be at the forefront of economic and social transformation.
tgt: dikgwebo tsena tsa mmuso di tshwanela ho ba tsona tse hulang ka pele phetolo ya moruo le ya setjhaba.

src: they are responsible for providing the infrastructure and the services on which the economy depends, whether it be in the generation of electricity, commuter transport, water provision, freight logistics or telecommunications.
tgt: ke boikarabelo ba tsona ho fana ka dibopeho tsa motheo le ditshebeletso tseo moruo o itshetlehileng ho tsona, le ha e ka ba lekaleng la phehlo ya motlakase, la dipalangwang tsa setjhaba, la phepelo ya metsi, la ho thothwa ha thepa kapa la dibopeho tsa motheo tsa dikgokahanyo.

src: our approach to state ownership is informed by the need for the effective functioning of key network industries, such as energy and ports, and by the need to ensure that the basic needs of all south africans, particularly the poor, can be met.
tgt: ditsela tseo re di sebedisang ha mmuso o rua thepa di shebane le tlhoko ya tsamaiso e ntle ya diindasteri tsa sehlooho, tse kang tsa motlakase le tsa madiboho, hape le tlhoko ya ho netefatsa hore ditlhoko tse mahlonoko tsa maafrika borwa wohle, haholoholo bafumanehi, di ka phethwa.

src: we firmly believe that public ownership is necessary in critical sectors of the economy and that the country needs robust soes that are able to drive economic growth and transformation.
tgt: re kgodisehile haholo hore thuo ya thepa ya mmuso e a hlokeha makaleng a hlokolosi a moruo le hore naha ya rona e hloka dikhampani tsa mmuso tse matla tse nang le bokgoni ba ho ntshetsa pele kgolo ya moruo le diphetoho.

src: this is particularly the case in the delivery of public goods such as electricity and water, where soes are able to pursue a developmental mandate in the public interest as opposed to a purely commercial one.
tgt: ena ke ntlha e tobileng phano ya thepa ya setjhaba e kang motlakase le metsi, moo dikhampani tsa mmuso di kgonang ho phetha morero wa tsona wa ntshetsopele molemong wa setjhaba, e seng feela ho phetha morero wa ho fumana kuno.

src: that is why we have made it a priority of this government to turn these companies around to root out corruption, improve their governance and enable them to play the role they should in driving economic growth and employment creation.
tgt: ke ka lebaka lena re entseng hore morero o ka sehloohong wa mmuso ona e be ho hlophisa botjha dikhampani tsena le ho tsomula bobodu, ho ntlafatsa makgotla a tsona a taolo le ho di fa bokgoni ba ho phetha tema e di tshwanelang morerong wa kgodiso ya moruo le ho thewa ha mesebetsi.

src: to this end, we have embarked upon a number of reforms to strengthen these soes so that they can produce the results that the country needs and expects.
tgt: morerong wa ho fihlela tsena, re tshebetsong ya ho tlisa diphetoho tse ngata tse reretsweng ho matlafatsa dikgwebo tsena tsa mmuso, e le hore di hlahise diphetho tseo naha e di hlokang, le tseo e di lebeletseng.

src: one of the most important reforms is in the energy sector.
tgt: e nngwe ya ditlhoko tsa bohlokwahlokwa e lekaleng la motlakase.

src: we have begun the process of restructuring eskom into three different soes, responsible for generation, transmission and distribution, respectively.
tgt: re se re qadile tshebetso ya ho hlopholla eskom re e etsa dikgwebo tsa mmuso tse tharo, moo e nngwe e tla ikarabella ho phehlo ya motlakase, e nngwe e tla ikarabella ho kgokelo ya motlakase, ha ya ho qetela e tla ikarabella phepelong ya motlakase.

src: this is because the previous structure of eskom was illsuited for a changing energy landscape.
tgt: sena se etsuwa ka lebaka la hobane sebopeho sa pele sa eskom se ne se sa lokela dinako tse fetohang tsa phepelo ya motlakase.

src: it had become inefficient and costly and was not sufficiently transparent.
tgt: eskom e ile ya hloleha ho sebetsa hantle, ya eba le ditshenyehelo tse fetang tekano, hape ya hloka ponahaletso e anetseng.

src: the establishment of a transmission entity in particular will mean that eskom will be able to purchase power from a broader range of providers, both private and public.
tgt: ho thewa ha khampani e ikarabelang kgokellong ya motlakase ho tla bolela hore eskom e tla kgona ho reka motlakase ho tswa mefuteng e fapafapaneng ya barekisi, ba ikemetseng le ba puso.

src: this will improve transparency, increase competitiveness and promote the purchase of lowestcost electricity.
tgt: hona ho tla ntlafatsa ponahaletso, ho eketse maemo a tlhodisano, hape ho kgothaletse ho rekwa ha motlakase o theko e fihlellehang.

src: through the renewable energy independent power producers programme, there has been significant private investment in energy generation.
tgt: ka lenaneo la renewable energy independent power producers programme, ho bile le matsete a eneji a mangata ho tswa lekaleng la poraefete.

src: with the proposal to raise the licencing exemption for embedded generation – where companies produce electricity for themselves and other commercial users – from 1mw to 100mw, we can expect even more private investment.
tgt: ka ditshitshinyo tsa ho phahamisa sekgeo se hlokang laesense bakeng sa phehlo e etswang ke dikhampani tse nyenyane – moo dikhampani di itlhahisetsang motlakase, hape di hlahisetsang dikgwebo tse ding – ho tloha tekanyong ya megawate e le nngwe ho isa ho tse lekgolo, re ka lebella hore matsete a poraefete a tla eketseha ho feta mona.

src: this is vital at a time when the country is suffering from severe and sustained electricity shortages and where neither eskom nor the state is able to invest in new generation capacity.
tgt: sena ke sa bohlokwa haholo nakong ena eo naha ya rona e tshwenngwang ke kgaello e kgolo ya motlakase, ka nako e telele, hape e le moo eskom kapa naha e sa tsebeng ho tsetela mokgweng o motjha wa phehlo ya motlakase.

src: importantly, these reforms will give eskom the space to address its financial and operational challenges.
tgt: seo e leng sa bohlokwa ke hore diphetoho tsena di tla neha eskom sebaka sa ho shebana le diphephetso tsa yona tsa ditjhelete le tsa tshebetso.

src: another critical reform is the establishment of the national ports authority as an independent subsidiary of transnet.
tgt: phetoho e nngwe ya bohlokwahlokwa ke ya ho thewa ha national ports authority, eo e leng lekala le ikemetseng la transnet.

src: this a crucial part of transnet’s broader strategy to revitalise our logistics infrastructure.
tgt: ena ke karolo ya bohlokwa ya leano le batsi la transnet la ho tsosolosa dibopeho tsa rona tsa motheo tsa ho thothwa ha thepa.

src: transnet plans to invest r100 billion over the next five years in upgrading its infrastructure across the ports system.
tgt: transnet e rerile ho tsetela dibilione tse lekgolo tsa diranta nakong ya dilemo tse hlano tse tlang ho ntlafatseng dibopeho tsa yona tsa motheo ka bophara ba tshebetso ya madiboho.

src: this will make our ports more efficient and our exports more competitive, and benefit the entire economy.
tgt: sena se tla etsa hore madiboho a rona a sebetse hantle, mme dihlahiswa tsa rona tse romelwang dinaheng tse ding di emelane le tlhodisano, me di tswele molemo moruo wohle wa naha.

src: for the ordinary consumer, it will mean reduced prices in the long term for many of our goods.
tgt: hona ho bolela hore ho tsamayeng ha nako moreki o tla iphumana a reka thepa ka ditheko tse theohileng.

src: for our exporters, it will mean greater competitiveness in global markets.
tgt: bakeng sa bahwebi ba rona ba romelang thepa dinaheng tse ding, hona ho tla eketsa dimmaraka tseo ba di rekisetsang, jwalo ka ha ba tla rekisetsa dimmaraka tse kgolo tsa matjhaba.

src: as our exports grow, our economy will expand and create more jobs.
tgt: ha dithomello tsa rona di hola, moruo wa rona le ona o tla hola, mme ho eketsehe mesebetsi.

src: more efficient ports will make the entire economy work better – and as port volumes increase, jobs will be created at the ports themselves.
tgt: madiboho a sebetsang hantle ho feta pele a tla etsa hore moruo wohle o eketse ho sebetsa hantle – mme ha methamo ya madiboho e eketseha, mesebetsi e tla thewa madibohong moo.

src: establishing the national ports authority as a transnet subsidiary with its own board will, among other things, mean that revenues generated by the ports can be used to replace old equipment and upgrade and expand our ports, work which has been delayed for more than a decade.
tgt: ho thewa ha national ports authority e le lekala la transnet le nang le lekgotla la lona la taolo, hara tse ding, ho bolela hore kuno e hlahiswang ke madiboho ana e ka sebedisetswa ho reka thepa e ntjha le ho ntlafatsa katoloso ya madiboho a rona, e leng mosebetsi o diehisitsweng ka dilemo tse fetang leshome.

src: among other things, these reforms will encourage greater private investment in the country’s economic infrastructure.
tgt: hara tse ding, diphetoho tsena di tla kgothaletsa keketseho ya matsete a poraefete dibopehong tsa motheo tsa moruo wa naha ya rona.

src: some people have expressed concerns that this will diminish the importance or reduce the value of soes.
tgt: ho na le batho ba hlahisitseng dingongoreho tsa hore sena se tla nkela mmuso matla le ho fokotsa bohlokwa ba dikgwebo tsa mmuso.

src: prevent identity theft kgaogelo letsebe shenki mabitsela (28) is all too aware of identity theft and the crimes relating to it, as he has been a victim of it.
tgt: thibela ho utswetswa mangolo a boitsebiso kgaogelo letsebe shenki mabitsela ya dilemo di 28 o ho tseba hantle ho utswe tswa mangolo a boitsebiso le diketso tsa tlolo ya molao tse etswang ka mangolo ana, hobane o ile a ba phofu ya honamabitsela, ya tswang modimolle provinseng ya limpopo, o ile a etsa kopo ya kadimo ya tjhelete bankeng ka kgwedi ya pudungwana selemong sa 2020, empa a bolellwa hore o qwetse dikolotong, mme a ke ke a adingwa.

src: mabitsela, from modimolle in limpopo, applied for a loan at a bank in november 2020, but was told he was overindebted and didn’t qualify.
tgt: "ke ile ka ya etsa kopo ya kadimo ya tjhelete ya nako e kgutshwane hobane ke ne ke hloka ho iphedisa ka morao ho fokotswa mosebetsing ka phupu selemong sa 2020. ho mmakaditse hore ke fumanwe ke sa lokela ho adingwa.

src: "i went to apply for a shortterm loan as i needed to make ends meet after being retrenched in june 2020. to my surprise, i was told i did not qualify.
tgt: "sethathong ke ile ka nahana hore mohlomong ke ka lebaka la hobane ke amohela moputso o sa tsitsang, empa lena e ne e se lona lebaka.

src: "i initially thought it was because of my unstable income, but it wasn’t.
tgt: ke ne ke tseba hore ke na le mokitlane o le mong feela wa diaparo, mme ke se na o mong hape molato, ka hona ka kopa kgatiso ya profaele ya ka," o rialo.

src: i knew i only had one clothing account and no other debt, so i asked for a printout of my profile," he says.
tgt: mabitsela o ile a hlokomela hore mekitlane ya difouno tse pedi le kadimo ya tjhelete ya banka ya r65 000 le mekitlane e mengatanyana ya mabenkeleng a diaparo e ile etswa ka lebitso la hae.

src: the debt was close to r100 000.
tgt: molato kaofela o ne o ka etsa r100 000.

src: "just before the national level 5 lockdown, i lost my id book.
tgt: "pelenyana ho qala mohato wa bohlano wa naha wa ho kginwa ha ditshebeletso le maeto, ke ile ka lahlehelwa ke bukana ya ka ya boitsebiso.

src: i thought it was somewhere in the house and wasn’t too worried because i had my smart card id," he says.
tgt: ke ile ka nahana hore e mpa e patehile ka tlung, mme ka se ke ka tshwenyeha hakaalo hobane ke ne ke se ke ena le karete ya boitsebiso" o rialo.

src: after realising that someone was creating debt in his name, mabitsela opened a case of stolen identity at the south african police service (saps).
tgt: ka morao ho hlokomela hore ho na le motho ya etsang melato ka lebitso la hae, mabitsela o ile a tlaleha ho utswetswa mangolo a boitsebiso sepoleseng sa afrika borwa (saps).

src: he had to write an affidavit stating that he lost his identity book and take it to credi tors with his case number to avoid being blacklisted.
tgt: o ile a tlameha ho ngola afidafiti e hlalosang hore o ile a lahlehelwa ke bukana ya hae ya boitsebiso, mme a e isa ho bao a nang le mekitlane ya bona hore a qobe ho senngwa lebitso ka ho iswa phatlalatsong ya ba hlolehang ho lefa mekitlane.

src: support for businesses and workers vukuzenzele unnamed starting and building a business is a lot like raising a family.
tgt: tshehetso ya dikgwebo le basebetsi vukuzenzele unnamed ho qala le ho aha kgwebo ho tshwana haholo le ho hodisa lelapa.

src: it takes time, patience, con stant support and consistent nurturing from infancy to maturity.
tgt: ho nka nako, mamelo, le tshehetso ya kamehla le phepo e sa fetofetong ho tloha boseyeng ho isa boholong.

src: for many business owners, seeing a business that you grew from scratch struggling to survive, or even being forced to close its doors, is heartbreaking.
tgt: ho beng ba dikgwebo ba ba ngata, ho bona kgwebo eo ba iqaletseng yona fatshe e sokola, kapa e qobellwa ho kwala ma mati a yona, ho utlwisa bohloko.

src: since the onset of the covid19 pandemic, this has sadly been the situation facing many businesses both large and small, not just in our country but around the world.
tgt: ho tloha qalehong ya sewa sa covid19, ka maswabi bona ebile boemo boo bo tobaneng le dikgwebo tse ngata tse kgolo le tse nyane ka bobedi, eseng feela naheng ya rona empa lefatsheng ka bophara.

src: the pandemic and the meas ures we have had to take to contain the spread of the virus have had a detrimental impact on businesses.
tgt: sewa le mehato eo re ileng ra tlameha ho e nka ho laola ho ata ha kokwanahloko ena e bile le kgahlamelo e senya ng dikgwebong.

src: in dealing with the pandemic we have sought to adopt an evidencebased approach in both policy and practice, con sidering scientific research, clinical expertise and capabil ities, and impact on all sectors of the population.
tgt: ho lwantsheng sewa re ile ra batla ho sebedisa mokgwa o nang le bopaki ba tshebetso ho leano le tshebetsong ka bobedi, ho nahanisa diphuputso tsa saense, tsebo le bokgoni ba bongaka, le kgahlamelo makaleng ohle a setjhaba.

src: we have sought to have a balance between saving lives and preserving livelihoods.
tgt: re ile ra batla ho lekalekanyana ho boloka maphelo le ho boloka mekgwa ya ho iphedisa.

src: we have sought to mitigate the impact of the successive lockdown restrictions on people’s livelihoods, or risk a second and possibly worse epidemic of poverty and hunger in future.
tgt: re ile ra batla ho fokotsa kgahla melo ya dithibelo tsa ho kwala tse hlahlamanang ho mekgwa ya batho ya ho iphedisa, kapa ho ba kotsing ya sewa sa bobedi sa bofuma se ka bang mpehadi le tlala kamoso.

src: in the earliest days last year, we introduced measures such as the covid temporary employer/employee relief scheme (ters), the covid19 loan guarantee scheme and various mechanisms to support small businesses to provide immediate and shortterm relief to burdened employees and business owners.
tgt: matsatsing a pelepele a selemo se fetileng, re ile ra kenya mehato e jwalo ka ya morero wa kimollo wa nakwana wa mohiri/mosebetsi (ters) wa covid19 , le morero wa netefaletso ya loune ya covid19 le mekgwa e meng e fapaneng ya ho tshehetsa dikgwebo tse thuthuhang ka ho di fa kimollo ya hanghang ya nako e kgutshwanyane ho basebetsi le beng ba dikgwebo ba imetsweng.

src: in addition, the special covid19 social relief of distress grant and broadening access to existing social grants provided lifelines to indigent individuals and families.
tgt: hodimo ha moo, le letlole la kimollo la thuso ya setjhaba la covid19 le ikgethileng le ho atolosa phumantsho ya matlole a setjhaba a seng a le teng di fanne ka bophelo ho batho ba futsanehileng le ho malapa a bona.

src: through these interventions we were able to mitigate the worst effects of the pandemic, preventing the closure of many businesses and the loss of even further jobs.
tgt: ka bonamodi bona re ile ra kgona ho fokotsa kgahlamelo e mpehadi ya sewa, ho thibela ho kwalwa ha dkgwebo tse ngata le tahlehelo ya mesebetsi ho ya pele.

src: they pro vided a firm foundation for the economic reconstruction and recovery plan that we launched in october last year.
tgt: bo ile ba re neha motheo o tiileng wa leano la hlaphohelo le kahobotjha ya moruo leo re le thakgotseng selemong se fetileng ka mphalane.

src: as part of that plan, we introduced the presidential employment stimulus to provide income and livelihood support to millions of beneficiaries.
tgt: jwalo ka karolo ya leano, re kentse dihlasimollo tsa mosebetsi tsa bopresidente ho fana ka lekeno le tshehetso ya mekgwa ya ho iphe disa ho dimilione tsa ba tla unang molemo.

src: through the stimulus, over 300 000 young people have been placed as school assistants.
tgt: ka dihlasimollo tsena, batjha ba fetang 300 000 ba ile ba hirwa e le bathusi ba dikolong.

src: more than 100 000 subsistence farmers are registered on the firstever database of its kind where they have access to technical support.
tgt: dihwai tse iphedisang tse fetang 100 000 di ngodisitswe pokellotshedimo setsong ya pelepele ya mofuta wa yona moo di tla fuma ntshwang tshehetso ya dikeletso ka dihlahiswa tsa tsona.

src: more than 30 000 young people have been given opportunities in the cultural, creative and sports sectors.
tgt: batjha ba fetang 30 000 ba fuma ntshitswe menyetla ho makala a setso, boqapi le dipapadi.

src: young professionals have been given opportunities in infrastructure development, healthcare, environmental conservation and a number of other sectors.
tgt: ditsebi tsa batjha di ile tsa fuwa menyetla ho makala a ntshetsopele ya meralo ya metheo, tlhokomelo ya bophelo bo botle, paballo ya tikoloho le ho makala a mang hape a mmalwa.

src: there are promising indi cations that our economy is steadily recovering, with growth and job creation in a number of sectors, from manufacturing to mining to agriculture.
tgt: ho na le disupo tse tshepi sang tsa hore moruo wa rona o ntse o hlaphohelwa butlebutle, ka kgolo le ho thehwa ha mesebetsi ho makala a mmalwa, ho tloha ho la tlhahiso ho ya ho la merafong le la temothuo.

src: at the same time we know that this ‘bigger picture’ is cold comfort to workers and business owners who have suffered immeasurably over the past year and a half, and were hoping to see their situa tions improve as the economy slowly opened up.
tgt: ka mokgwa o tshwanang re a tseba hore ‘se bohlokwahlokwa’ ke matshediso a sa lekaneng ho basebetsi le beng ba dikgwebo ba ileng ba sotleha haholo nakong ya selemo se feti leng le halofo, ba neng ba tshepile hore maemo a bona a ntlafala ha moruo o ntse o buleha hanyanehanyane.

src: the rapid rise in infections being fueled by the new delta variant necessitated the imposing of tighter restric tions on the movement of persons, on the operation of certain businesses and on public gatherings, among others.
tgt: ho phahama ka potlako ha tshwaetso e atiswang ke mofuta o motjha wa tshwaetso wa delta o ile wa baka tlhokeho ya di thibelo tse matla tsa motsamao wa batho, le tshebetso ya di kgwebo tse itseng le dikopano tsa setjhaba, ho tse ding.

src: these were not been easy decisions to make, mindful of their impact on people’s livelihoods.
tgt: tsena e ne e se diqeto tse bobebe ho di nka, haholo ha re shebile kgahlamelo ya tsona ho mekgwa ya batho ya ho iphedisa.

src: just as we did at the beginning of the pandemic, we engaged in deliberations with all social partners, business, labour and civil society to see what financially sustainable measures we could intro duce to support businesses and individuals in distress at this time.
tgt: jwalo ka ha re ile ra etsa maqalong a sewa, re ile ra buisana dipuisanong le balekane ba rona ba tshebetso, kgwebo, mosebetsi le setjhaba ho bona hore na ke mehato e fe e tshwarellang ya ditjhelete eo re ka e kenyang ho tshehetsa dikgwebo le batho ba tlasa matshwenyeho nakong ena.

src: the negotiations at the national economic development and labour council resulted in consen sus that the most practical and financially sustainable measure that can provide urgent relief is extending the covid19 ters scheme to sectors that have been affected by the adjusted level 4 restrictions.
tgt: dipuisano le lekgotla la ntshetsopele ya moruo le mosebetsi la naha di ile tsa phethela ka tumellano ya hore mehato e ka tshwarellang ya ditjhelete e ka fanang ka kimollo ka potlako ke ho atolosa moremo wa ters wa covid19 ho makala a mang a ileng a hahlamelwa ke dithibelo tse feto tsweng tsa boemo ba bone.

src: to support businesses whose operating licenses and per mits expired between march 2020 and june 2021, we are extending their validity until 31 december 2022. in addition, new business licenses or permits that are issued from the 1 july will also be valid until 31 december 2022, and no license fee will be payable.
tgt: ho tshehetsa dikgwebo tseo dilaesense le diphemiti tsa tsona tsa tshebetso tse fele tsweng ke nako dipakeng tsa tlhakubele 2020 le phuptjane 2021, re atolosa nako ya tsona ya tshebetso ho fihlela ka la 31 tshitwe 2022. hodima moo, dilaesense tsa kgwebo kapa diphemiti tse ntjha tse ntshi tsweng ho tloha ka la 1 phupu le tsona di tla sebetsa ho fihlela ka la 31 tshitswe 2022, ntle le ho lefiswa tefiso ya laesense.

src: over the past year, we have also been working consist ently to protect vulnerable workers whose jobs were at risk, particularly in hardhit sectors like retail, food and beverage and the metals industry.
tgt: selemong se fetileng, re ne re sebetsa ntle le ho fetofe toha ho tshireletsa basebetsi bao mesebetsi ya bona e leng ko tsing, haholoholo ba maka leng a thefulehileng haholo a jwalo ka a thekiso, dijo le dino le indastri ya tshepe.

src: sandf fights covid19 more matshediso the south african national defence force (sandf) is helping fight the coronavirus disease (covid19) pandemic in gauteng, which is currently the epicentre of the third wave.
tgt: sandf e lwantsha covid19 more matshediso lebotho la tshireletso ya naha la afrika borwa (sandf) e thusa ho lwantsha sewa sa lefu la kokwa nahloko ya corona (covid19) gauteng, moo leqhubu lena la boraro le qhomileng teng.

src: the sandf is assisting with mass community test ing, screening and contact tracing, and is also lending a hand at hospitals.
tgt: sandf e thusa ka ho etsa setjhaba diteko ka bongata, ditlhahlobo le ka ho batla ba kopaneng le ba tshwaedi tsweng, mme e boela e thuso dipetleleng.

src: the south african military health service was deployed in the province to ease the burden on healthcare workers.
