tgt: re na le boikarabelo boo e leng ba rona bohle ba ho ntshetsa pele matsapa a ho tsetselela bbbee hobane e reretswe ho fedisa ho se lekalekane.

src: unequal economies breed unequal societies, and unequal societies don’t grow and flourish.
tgt: meruo e hlokang tekatekano e tswala ditjhaba tseo ho seng tekatekano ho tsona, ditjhaba tse hlokang tekatekano ha di hole, mme ha di atlehe.

src: it is not only wrong, but also unsustainable, for businesses to keep their management and ownership structures mostly white or male.
tgt: ha se feela hobane ho le phoso, empa ho boetse ho hloka mokoka, hore e be di kgwebo di bolokile dibopeho tsa tsona tsa botsamaisi le thuo ka kakaretso e le batho ba basweu kapa ba batona.

src: it is, after all, the south african public that are the primary consumers of their goods and services.
tgt: hantlentle, ke setjhaba sa maafrika borwa seo e leng bona bareki ba mantlha ba thepa le ditshebeletso.

src: this should be reflected in diversity of hiring and management practices, in ownership and in procurement.
tgt: sena se tshwanetse ho bonahala ho fapapfapaneng ha ditlwaelo tsa kgiro le botsamaisi, thuong le tshebetsong ya theko.

src: broadbased black economic empowerment will only be achieved through partnership and a shared commitment to transformation.
tgt: matlafatso e metheo e batsi ya batho ba batsho moruong e tla atlehiswa feela ka bolekane le boitlamo bo kopanetsweng ba ho tlisa diphetoho.

src: safe and legal abortion is free allison cooper there is no justification for women to use an illegal and unsafe abortion clinic if they want to end their pregnancy.
tgt: ho ntshuwa ha mpa ho bolokehileng le ho molaong ha ho lefellwe allison cooper ha ho lebaka la hore basadi ba sebedise ditliliniki tsa ho ntsha mpa tse seng molaong le tse sa bolokehang ha ba batla ho fedisa boimana ba bona.

src: this is according to deputy minister of health dr sibongiseni dhlomo, who explains that, by law, all women have the right to terminate their pregnancy, for free, at a government hospital or clinic during the first 12 weeks.
tgt: maikutlo ana a hlahisitswe ke motlatsi wa letona la bophelo, ngaka sibongiseni dhlomo, ya hlalosang hore, ho ya ka molao, basadi bohle ba na le tokelo ya ho fedisa boimana ba bona, kantle ho tefo, dipetleleng kapa ditliliniking tsa mmuso nakong ya dibeke tsa pele tse 12.

src: "it pains us as government leaders to see our people leaving safe and free health services, for whatever reason, to go and spend the last money they don’t have to pay someone to put their life at risk.
tgt: "re le baetapele ba mmuso re utlwa bohloko ha re bona batho ba habo rona ba siya ditshebeletso tse bolokehileng le tse sa lefellweng, le ha e le ka lebaka le ha e le lefe, ba ya moo ba ilo ntsha tjheletana ya bona ya ho qetela eo ba sa hlokeng ho e sebedisetsa ho lefa motho ya tla beha bophelo ba bona kotsing.

src: illegal abortion is not an answer," says dr dhlomo.
tgt: ho qhala mpa ka mokgwa o seng molaong ha se tharollo," o rialo ngaka dlomo.

src: the department of health has 346 public health facilities that provide safe termination of pregnancy services, he adds.
tgt: lefapha la bophelo le na le ditsha tse 346 tsa mmuso tse fanang ka ditshebeletso tsa ho fedisa boimana tse bolokehileng, o boetse a rialo.

src: these are located in the eastern cape (46), free state (16), gauteng (25), kwazulunatal (56), limpopo (54), mpumalanga (27), northern cape (six), north west (26) and western cape (90).
tgt: ho tsena, tse kapa botjhabela di 46, freistata di 16, gauteng di 25, kwazulunatal di 56, limpopo di 54, mpumalanga di 27, kapa leboya di tsheletse, leboya bophirima di 26, mme kapa bophirima di 90. mathata a bakwang ke ho ntshuwa ha mpa ho seng molaong molaodi ya tshwaretseng wa lekala la bophelo ba batswetse le basadi lefapheng la bophelo la kwazulunatal, phalanndwa muthupei, o re basadi ba ka tjamelana le mathata ha ba qhala mpa tliliniking e seng molaong ya ho qhalwa ha mpa.

src: illegal abortion complications the acting director for maternal child and women’s health at the kwazulunatal department of health, phalanndwa muthuphei, says women can face many complications when having an abortion at an illegal abortion clinic.
tgt: "mathata a a tla bonahala kapelepele a kenyeletsa ho lahlehelwa ke madi a mangata ho taboha ha molomo wa popelo, ho lemala ho matla ha ditho tsa botshehadi le mpa, tshwaetso ka mpeng le tjhefo ya madi.

src: "the immediate complications include severe bleeding, tearing of the cervix, severe damage to the genitals and abdomen, internal infection of the abdomen and blood poisoning.
tgt: "mathata a ka iponahatsang ka morao honako e telele, basadi ba ka shebana le kotsi e batlang e le kgolwanyane ya ho hloka pelehi, ho ima ho etsahalang sethong se sa tshwanelang, ho senyehelwa kapa pelehi e tlang pele ho nako, kapa le lona lefu," o rialo muthupei.

src: "in the longterm, women could face a slightly increased risk of infertility, an ectopic pregnancy, a miscarriage or premature delivery or even death," says muthuphei.
tgt: "basadi ba ka boela ba tshwarwa ke ditlamorao tse amang maikutlo tse bakilweng ke ho ntshuwa ha mpa ho seng molaong, tse kenyeletsang lefu la kgatello ya maikutlo, kgatello ya maikutlo ya nako e telele e matla le mathata a dikamano le batho ba bang.

src: "women could also suffer emotional effects from an unsafe, illegal abortion, which include posttraumatic stress disorder, depression and problems with interpersonal relationships.
tgt: "diketso tsa ho qhalwa ha mpa tse seng molaong di ka boela tsa kgannela kgahlamelong ya mathata a maphelong le boiphedisong ba basadi, bana, malapa le setjhaba sa bodulong," o tswetse pele a rialo.

src: "unsafe abortions can also lead to negative socioeconomic impacts on women, children, families and communities," she adds.
tgt: metjha e molaong ya ho ntsha mpa muthupei o re basadi ba batlang ho fedisa boimana ba bona ba na le metjha e bolokehileng le e sa lefellweng eo ba ka e nkang ditliliniking le dipetleleng tsa mmuso.

src: legal abortion options muthuphei says women who want to end their pregnancy have safe and free options to do so at public clinics and hospitals.
tgt: "mekgwa ya boikgethelo e tshwanela ho ba teng, eo kaofela ha yona e tshwanelang ho phethahatswa ke ngaka e kwetlisitsweng, hape e nang le boiphihlelo, kapa mooki ya nang le boitsebelo," o tswela pele jwana.

src: "a choice of methods should be available, all of which must be performed by a trained and experienced doctor or professional nurse," she adds.
tgt: mekgwa ena, e ka ba ya tshebediso ya meriana kapa ya ho buuwa, e itshetlehile tabeng ya hore na boimana bona bo se bo hatetse pele hakae.

src: the options, either medical or surgical abortion, depend on how far along the woman’s pregnancy is.
tgt: ho ntshuwa ha mpa ka meriana, ho etsuwang ka ho kenngwa ha mefuta e mmedi ya dipidisi tsa ho qhala mpa, ho ka etswa ha mpa e sa fete dibeke tse robong tsa boimana.

src: medical abortion, which involves taking two sets of pills to end the pregnancy, can be done up until nine weeks of pregnancy.
tgt: "moimana o tla sebedisa dipidisi tsena tse tla ntsha mpa a le hae, e seng tliliniking kapa sepetlele," o rialo muthuphei.

src: "the patient would then abort the foetus at home and not at a clinic or hospital," says muthuphei.
tgt: ho ntshuwa ha mpa ka ho buuwa ho ka etswa ke mooki ya ingodisitseng (haeba mpa ya moimana e so qete dibeke tse 12) kapa ngaka (haeba mpa ya moimana e na le nako ya dibeke tse 12 ho ya ho tse 20).

src: surgical abortions are performed by a registered nurse (up to 12 weeks) or a doctor (from 12 to 20 weeks).
tgt: ho ya ka molao wa boikgethelo ba ho ntsha mpa wa 92 wa selemo sa 1996 (molao wa 92 wa 1996), ho ntshuwa ha mpa ho ka boela ha etsuwa ho tloha dibekeng tse 13 ho ya ho tse 20 haeba ngaka, ka morao ho ho rerisana le moimana, e dumela hore: ho tswela pele le boimana bona ho bonahala ho ka beha kotsing bophelo ba moimana enwa mmeleng wa hae kapa kelellong.

src: according to the choice on termination of pregnancy act no 92 of 1996 (the act), an abortion can also be performed from 13 to 20 weeks if a doctor, after consultation with a pregnant woman, believes that: the continued pregnancy poses an injury risk to the woman’s physical or mental health.
tgt: ho na le kotsi e kgolo eo senamane sena se ka tshwarwang ke bokowa bo matla ba mmele kapa ba kelello.

src: the pregnancy resulted from rape or incest.
tgt: boimana bo etsahetse ka lebaka la peto kapa thobalano le mong ka motho.

src: the continued pregnancy would significantly affect the woman’s social or economic circumstances.
tgt: ho tswela pele ka boimana bona ho ka ba le dipoelomorao maemong a mosadi a ho iphedisa le ho phedisana le ba bang.

src: an abortion can also take place after the 20th week if a doctor, after consultation with a registered midwife, believes that the continued pregnancy would endanger the woman’s life, result in a severe malformation of the foetus or pose a risk of injury to the foetus.
tgt: ho ntshuwa ha mpa ho ka boela ha etsuwa ha moimana a na le nako ya dibeke tse 20 a imme haeba ngaka, ka morao ho therisano le mmelehisi ya ingodisitseng, e dumela hore ho tswela pele le mpa ena ho ka ba kotsi bophelong ba mosadi ya immeng, ha baka bofokodi leseeng kapa lesea la ba kotsing ya ho lemala.

src: according to the act, all women, even if they are a minor under the age of 18, have the right to terminate a pregnancy.
tgt: ho ya ka molao, basadi bohle, le ha e ka ba bana ba dilemo di ka tlase ho 18, ba na le tokelo ya ho kgaola boimana.

src: they do not need permission from their parents or guardian.
tgt: ha ba hloke tumello ya motswadi kapa mohodisi.

src: rising cost of living calls for a united response over the past few months, south african consumers have been hit by steep price increases that have dramatically affected their quality of life.
tgt: ho nyoloha ha ditjeho tsa ho iphedisa ho hloka karabelo ya kopanelo dikgweding tse mmalwa tse fetileng, bareki ba afrika borwa ba tobane le keketseho ya ditheko e hlweleng mokwalaba e ameng boleng ba maphelo a bona hampe haholo.

src: it has become increasingly more expensive to buy food and other essentials, to pay for basic services and to use public or private transportation.
tgt: jwale ho se ho tura haholo ho reka dijo le dintho tse ding tsa bohokwa, ho lefella ditshebeletso tsa motheo le ho sebedisa dipalangwang tsa setjhaba kapa tsa poraefete.

src: while these rising costs affect everyone, lowincome households are feeling them the most.
tgt: le hoja ditjeho tsena tse ntseng di nyoloha di ama motho e mong le e mong, malapa a nang le meputso e tlase ke ona a utlwang ka letlalo ka ho fetisisa.

src: the latest consumer price index for april 2022 published by stats sa shows there has been little respite for hardpressed south africans.
tgt: tshupane ya moraorao ya ditheko tsa bareki ya mmesa 2022 e phatlaladitsweng ke lekala la dipalopalo tsa afrika borwa (stats sa) e bontsha hore ho bile le kimollo e nyenyane ho maafrika borwa a jereng ka thata.

src: food inflation was recorded at 6.2 per cent.
tgt: infleishene ya dijo e nyolohetse ho 6.2%.

src: the most basic foodstuffs cost more than a year ago, with staples like cooking oil recording the highest increases.
tgt: boholo ba dijo tse jewang haholo di bitsa tjhelete e ngata ho feta selemo se fetileng, moo dijo tsa bohlokwa tse kang mafura a phehang di nyolohileng haholo ho feta tse ding kaofela.

src: the price of fuel, which affects the price of almost everything else, has risen by a third in the twelve months to march 2022. south africa is not alone in this regard.
tgt: theko ya mafura, e amang theko ya ntho e nngwe le e nngwe, e nyolohile ka makgetlo a mararo dikgweding tse 12 tse fetileng ho fihlela ka hlakubele 2022. afrika borwa ha se yona feela e bothateng bona.

src: a recently published poll for the world economic forum shows that nearly a quarter of people globally, including those in developed economies, are struggling financially due to rising prices.
tgt: hlahlobo e sa tswa phatlalatswa ya foramo ya lefatshe ya moruo e bontsha hore hoo ka bang kotara ya batho lefatsheng ka bophara, ho akarelletsa le dinaha tsa morou o tswetseng pele, di hula ka thata ditjheleteng ka lebaka la ho phahama ha ditheko.

src: these increases, particularly the price of fuel, are the consequence of events over which we have little control.
tgt: dikeketseho tsena, haholoholo ya theko ya mafura, ke ditlamorao tsa diketsahalo tseo re nang le taolo e fokolang hodima tsona.

src: the ongoing conflict between russia and ukraine has had a significant impact on the price of fuel and food.
tgt: kgohlano e ntseng e tswela pele dipakeng tsa russia le ukraine e bile le kgahlamelo e kgolo ho theko ya mafura le dijo.

src: both countries are major exporters to international markets of fertilisers, grains and oilseeds that are needed for a range of items such as cooking oil.
tgt: dinaha tsena ka bobedi ke barekisi ba ka sehloohong ho dimmaraka tsa matjhaba tsa menontsha, dijothollo le dipeo tsa mafura tse hlokehang bakeng sa mefutafuta ya dintho tse kang mafura a phehang.

src: another factor is lower agricultural output due to extreme weather events caused by climate change, such as flooding and droughts.
tgt: lebaka le leng ke la tlhahiso ya temothuo e fokotsehileng ka lebaka la maemo a mabehadi a lehodimo a bakwang ke phetoho ya tlelaemete, jwalo ka dikgohola le komello.

src: while many of these events are beyond our control, government is doing what it can to shield the south african from current and future price increases.
tgt: le hoja boholo ba diketsahalo tsena di se matleng a rona, mmuso o etsa seo o kgonang ho se etsa ho sireletsa afrika borwa ho nyolloheng ha ditheko hajwale le nakong e tlang.

src: one of our greatest advantages as a country is a strong, independent reserve bank that has managed to keep inflation within a narrow target range, well below what many other countries are experiencing.
tgt: o mong wa melemo ya rona e meholo re le naha ke banka ya poloko ya ditjhelete e matla, e ikemetseng, e kgonneng ho boloka infleishene e le ka hara tekanyo e tlase haholo ho feta e leng dinaheng tse ding.

src: we recently announced that the fuel levy will be suspended for another two months to august, which will bring some relief to households.
tgt: re sa tswa phatlalatsa hore lekgetho la lefii ya mafura le tla fanyehwa dikgwedi tse ding tse pedi ho fihlela ka phato, e leng se tla imollang malapa mojaro hanyane.

src: the suspension of the levy has provided essential relief to south africans since it began in april.
tgt: ho fanyehwa ha lekgetho la lefii ho fane ka kimollo e bohlokwa ho maafrika borwa ho tloha ka mmesa.

src: since the suspension of the levy comes at a significant cost to public finances, which affects other programmes of government, it will be difficult to continue this indefinitely.
tgt: kaha ho fanyehwa ha lekgetho la lefii ho tla ka ditshenyehelo tse kgolo tsa ditjhelete tsa setjhaba, tse amang mananeo a mang a mmuso, ho tla ba thata ho tswelapele ka sena ka ho sa feleng.

src: there are, however, other things we can do.
tgt: le ha ho le jwalo, ho na le dintho tse ding tseo re ka di etsang.

src: improving our nation’s food security is vital to withstanding this and future shocks.
tgt: ho ntlafatsa polokehelo ya dijo tsa naha ya rona ho bohlokwa haholo bakeng sa ho mamella ditshenyehelo tsena le tse tlang.

src: we have a strong agricultural sector that continues to grow and create jobs.
tgt: re na le lekala le matla la temothuo le ntseng le tswela pele ho hola le ho theha mesebetsi.

src: to further increase agricultural production and strengthen our food sovereignty, we are investing heavily in improving local capacity, supporting commercial and smallscale farmers alike and helping more people to grow their own food.
tgt: ho eketsa tlhahiso ya temothuo le ho matlafatsa boikemelo ba rona tlhahisong ya dijo, re tsetela haholo ho ntlafatseng bokgoni ba tlhahiso ba lehae, ho tshehetsa dihwai tsa kgwebo le tse nyane ka ho tshwana le ho thusa batho ba bangata ho itemela dijo tsa bona.

src: through the presidential employment stimulus, input vouchers have been given to over 65,000 smallholder farmers, and work is underway to reach 250,000 such farmers.
tgt: ka lenaneo la moporesidente la kgothalletso ya khiro, divautjhara tsa dithuso di fuwe dihwai tse thuthuhang tse fetang 65 000, mme mosebetsi o ntse o tswela pele ho fihella dihwai tse jwalo tse 250 000. mmuso o boetse o fa dihwai tse iphedisang ka thuso ya menotsha le disebediswa tse hlahisang dijo, le ho thusa dihlopha ka batho ho iqella dirapa tsa meroho.

src: government is also providing subsistence farmers with fertilisers and equipment to produce food, and helping groups or individuals to start their own food gardens.
tgt: diprofenseng tse kang leboya bophirima, dihwai tse thuthuhang di tshehetswa ka "distarterpack" tsa temothuo tsa dipeo le dikgoho, tse tswang dikoletjheng tsa moo tsa temothuo tse sebedisanang le mmuso.

src: in provinces like north west, smallscale farmers are supported with agricultural ‘starterpacks’ of seedlings and poultry, in partnership with local agricultural colleges.
tgt: ka leano le tswelang pele la kabelo ya mobu le phano ya mobu wa mmuso bakeng sa tsa temothuo, re tshehetsa dihwai tse ngata tse thuthuhang ho atolosa dikgwebo tsa tsona le ho di atlehisa kgwebong.

src: through the proactive land acquisition strategy and the release of stateowned land for agriculture, we are supporting more smallscale farmers to expand their businesses and make them commercially successful.
tgt: re boetse re tsepamisitse maikutlo ho theheng dikamano tse ngata tsa setjhaba le tsa poraefete ho tshehetsa katoloso ya bohwai ba batho ba batsho temothuong ya lekeno ka mananeo a kang bomphato ba ditharollo tsa mobu wa temothuo le kemedi ya ntshetsopele ya temothuo.

src: we are also focusing on establishing more publicprivate partnerships to support the expansion of black commercial farming through initiatives like the partners in agri land solutions and the agricultural development agency.
tgt: ho matlafatsa tshireletso ya tlhaho le ho sireletsa maphelo a diphoofolo kgahlano le mafu a kang mokaka, re matlafatsa mehato ya rona ya taolo ya metsamao wa mehlape le bokgoni ba tlhahiso ya ente.

src: to enhance biosecurity and safeguard animal health against diseases like footandmouth, we are strengthening our animal movement control measures and vaccine production capabilities.
tgt: ho tlatselletseng matlafatso ya tlhahiso ya dijo tsa lehae, tshebetso e pharelletseng ya dithuso tsa matlole a setjhaba le ho se be le lekgetho ho thepa ya motheo ho thuso ho sireletsa mafutsana kgahlanong le ditshenyehelo tse ntseng di phahama.

src: in addition to boosting local food production, our extensive social grants system and zerorating of basic goods helps to protect the poor from rising costs.
tgt: ka ditshebeletso tsa motheo tsa mahala tse kang ka metsi le motlakase bakeng sa malapa a hlokang, re ka netefatsa ha ho lelapa le hlokang ditshebeletso tsa motho.

src: to get through this difficult period, all of society should get involved.
tgt: ho feta nakong ena e boima, setjhaba sohle se lokela ho nka karolo.

src: for our part, government will continue to monitor the situation closely and will do everything within its power to protect south africans from unsustainable increases in the cost of living.
tgt: ho tswa lehlakoreng la rona, mmuso o tla tswelapele ho beha maemo leihlo ka kelahloko mme o tla etsa sohle se matleng a ona ho sireletsa maafrika borwa kgahlano le keketseho e sa tsitsang ya ditjeho tsa ho iphedisa.

src: corporate south africa should ensure that consumers do not pay more for food than they have to.
tgt: lekala la koporasi la afrika borwa le hloka ho netefatsa hore bareki ha ba lefelle dijo ho feta kamoo ba tlamehang ho di lefella.

src: we welcome the indications from food manufacturers and retailers that they are putting measures in place to help consumers get more for their money.
tgt: re amohela ditshupo tse tswang ho bahlahisi le barekisi ba dijo tsa hore ba kenya mehato ya ho thusa barekisi ho fumana tse ngata bakeng sa tjhelete ya bona.

src: in march this year the competition commission released for public comment the terms of reference for a market enquiry into the fresh produce market.
tgt: ka hlakubele monongwaha komishene ya dikgabisano e ile ya lokolla tshwaelo ho ya ka setjhaba ka dipehelo tsa dipatlisiso tsa mmaraka mabapi le mmaraka wa dihlahiswa tse foreshe.

src: it noted that the cost of fresh produce has been increasing at aboveinflation levels, and that this has had a disproportionate effect on the poor.
tgt: e hlokometse hore ditshenyehelo tsa dihlahiswa tse foreshe di ntse di eketseha ho feta infleishene, le hore sena se bile le kgahlamelo e sa lekanyetswang ho ba futsanehileng.

src: the inquiry will examine if there are any distortions in the value chain that make food more expensive.
tgt: patlisiso e tla hlahloba hore ho na le diphetoho tse seng tsa nnete tsamaisong ya boleng ba tlhahiso le thekiso ya dihlahiswa tse bakang hore dijo di ture.

src: we will use our competition policy to protect consumers against unjustifiable price increases and anticompetitive practices by businesses, as we did during the covid19 pandemic.
tgt: re tla sebedisa leano la rona la tlhodisano ho sireletsa bareki kgahlano le nyollo ya ditheko e hlokang mabaka le ditlwaelo tse kgahlanong le tlhodisano ya dikgwebo e hantle, jwalo ka ha re entse nakong ya sewa sa covid19.

src: the ongoing process of structural reform of our economy will support these efforts.
tgt: tshebetso e tswelang pele ya ntlafatso ya sebopeho sa moruo wa rona e tla tshehetsa matsapa ana.

src: reforms in the energy, transport and telecommunications sectors aim to reduce the cost of electricity, logistics and data in the long term through greater competition and efficiency.
tgt: diphethoho makaleng a eneji, dipalangwang le a dikgokahano di ikemiseditse ho fokotsa ditshenyehelo tsa motlakase, thepa le datha nakong e telele ka tlhodisano e kgolokgolo e nang le bokgabane.

src: child support grant misuse is illegal more matshediso if you are aware that the child support grant received by a caregiver is being misused, you have the responsibility to report the matter to the south african social security agency (sassa).
tgt: tshebediso e mpe ya letlole la dithuso tsa bana ha e molaong more matshediso haeba o tseba hore letlole la dithuso tsa bana le fumanwang ke mohlokomedi e sebediswa hampe, o na le boikarabelo ba ho tlaleha ketso ena ho kemedi ya matlole a dithuso tsa setjhaba a afrika borwa (sassa).

src: according to sassa spokesperson paseka letsatsi, the child support grant is paid to the caregiver, but is intended for the care of the child.
tgt: ho ya ka mmuelli wa sassa, paseka letsatsi, letlole la dithuso tsa bana le lefuwa ho mohlokomedi, empa le rere tswe tlhokomelo ya ngwana.

src: the grant is currently r480 per month per child.
tgt: ha jwale letlole leo ke r480 ka kgwedi ho ngwana ka mong.

src: the child support grant was introduced by government to provide financial support to children who live in poor households.
tgt: letlole la dithuso tsa bana le ile la thakgolwa ke mmuso ho fana ka tshehetso ya ditjhelete ho bana ba dulang malapeng a futsanehileng.

src: "as soon as misuse is reported, an investigation is undertaken.
tgt: "hang ha tshebediso e mpe e tlalehwa, ho etswa dipatlisiso.

src: if the investigation finds that the money received does not benefit the child, sassa may appoint someone else to receive and administer the grant on behalf of the child," says letsatsi.
tgt: haeba dipatlisiso di fumana hore tjhelete e fumanwang ha e sebedisetswe molemong wa ngwana, sassa e ka kgetha motho e mong ya tlang ho amohela le ho sebedisa letlole leo lebitsong la ngwana."

src: he adds that it is critical that the primary caregiver, who actually cares for the child on a daytoday basis, is the registered beneficiary.
tgt: haeba dipatlisiso di fumana hore tjhelete e fumanwang ha e sebedisetswe molemong wa ngwana, sassa e ka kgetha motho e mong ya tlang ho amohela le ho sebedisa letlole leo lebitsong la ngwana," ho rialo letsatsi.

src: "in an instance where a child moves from one caregiver to another, the grant is supposed to follow the child.
tgt: o tlatsetsa ka hore ho bohlokwa hore mohlokomedi wa mantlha, eo a hlokomelang ngwana letsatsi le le tsatsi, e be yena ya ngodisetsweng ho tla fumantshwa letlole.

src: the original caregiver is expected to report to sassa that the child is no longer in his/her care, and the new primary caregiver must then come in to apply for the grant," adds letsatsi.
tgt: "boemong boo ngwana a tlohang ho mohlokomedi e mong ho ya ho e mong, le tlole le lokela ho latela ngwana morao.

src: letsatsi says people who continue to receive child support grants after the children are no longer in their care, will be required to repay the amount received unlawfully.
tgt: mohlokomedi wa pele o lebeletswe ho ya tlaleha ho sassa hore ngwana ha a sa le tlhokomelong ya hae, mme mohlokomedi e motjha wa mantlha o tlameha ho tla ho etsa kopo e ntjha ya letlole," ho tlatseletsa letsatsi.

src: the same consequences apply to people who misuse care dependency grants – which are given by sassa to provide financial support to children with severe disabilities who require fulltime care, disability grants or older persons grants.
tgt: letsatsi o re batho ba ntseng ba tswela pele ho fumana le tlole la dithuso tsa bana kamora hore bana ba se ba hlola ba eba tlasa tlhokomelo ya bona, ba tla tlameha ho lefa tjhelete eo ba e fumaneng ka mokgwa oo o seng molaong.

src: "if the money is used for alcohol, drugs or gambling, and not for the support of the person who qualifies for the grant, the same process of reporting should be followed," says letsatsi.
tgt: ba ka boela ba qoswa ka botlokotsebe haeba morero wa ho qhekella naha o ka netefatswa e le bobodu.

src: according to letsatsi, any south african citizen, permanent resident or documented refugee who cares for a child, whether or not that child is his or her biological child, may apply for a child support grant, provided he/she meets the criteria listed below: the child and caregiver must live permanently in south africa.
tgt: ditlamorao tse tshwanang le tseo di sebediswa le ho batho ba sebedisang ha mpe matlole a ho hlokomela batho ba hlo kang hlokomelo e tebileng – a fanwang ke sassa ho fana ka tshehetso ya ditjhelete ho bana ba nang le boqhwala bo mpefetseng bo hlokang tlho komelo ya letsatsi le leng le le leng, matlole a boqhwala kapa matlole a maqheku.

src: the child must be younger than 18. the grant recipient must be the child’s primary caregiver and the child must live with him/her.
tgt: mohlokomedi o tlameha ho ba le dilemo tse 16 (maemong a malapa a ete lletsweng pele ke bana) kapa ho feta.

src: the recipient must meet the requirements of the means test (income test).
tgt: ngwana o tlameha ho ba ka tlasa dilemo tse 18. moamohedi wa letlole o tlameha ho ba mohlokome di wa mantlha wa ngwana mme ngwana o lokela ho dula le yena.

src: if the primary caregiver is single (never married, divorced or widowed), his/ her income cannot be more than r4 800 per month.
tgt: moamohedi o tlameha ho fihlella ditlhoko tsa tlhahlobo ya mekgwa ya ho iphedisa (tlhahlobo ya lekeno).

src: if the primary caregiver is married, the combined income of the applicant and his/her spouse cannot be more than r9 600 per month.
tgt: haeba mohlokomedi wa mantlha a sa nyala/nyalwa (a so nyale/nyalwe ho hang, kapa a hlalane le molekane wa hae kapa a hlokahalletswe ke molekane), moputso wa hae ha wa tlameha ho feta r4 800 ka kgwedi.

src: the spouse’s income will be considered in all instances – regardless of whether the couple is married in or out of community of property, under customary or asian rites, are in a civil union or if the applicant and his/her spouse are not the child’s birth parents.
tgt: haeba mohlokomedi wa mantlha a nyetse/nyetswe, tjhelete ya makeno a mokopi le molekane wa hae ha ya tlameha ho feta r9 600 ka kgwedi ha a kopantshitswe.

src: our nation mourns the young lives lost in enyobeni tavern tragedy vukuzenzele unnamed a few weeks ago the families of a township in scenery park outside east london, received news that every parent prays they never get to hear.
tgt: setjhaba sa rona se iletse koduwa ya ho hlokahala ha batjha tameneng ya enyobeni vukuzenzele unnamed dibekeng tse mmalwa tse fetileng, malapa a lekeishene la scenery park haufi le east london, a ne a fumane ditaba tseo ho seng motswadi ya ratang ho di utlwa.

src: they were told that 21 of their children had been found dead, in a tavern.
tgt: a ne a bolellwe ha bana ba 21 ba fumanwe ba hlokahetse tameneng.

src: the youngest child was only 13 years old.
tgt: e monyane ho bona kaofela o ne a le dilemo di 13 feela.

src: the police investigation into the tragedy is proceeding apace.
tgt: diphuputso tsa sepolesa di tswelapele ka potloko e kgolo.

src: flowing from the investigations, the buffalo city metro is looking into whether the tavern violated any municipal regulations.
tgt: ntle le diphuputso tsena, mmasepala e moholo wa buffalo city, le ona o lekola taba ya hore na e be tamene eo ha e a tlola e meng ya melawana ya mmasepala.

src: our thoughts and prayers are with the families who are struggling to come to terms with this unspeakable horror.
tgt: malapa ana re tla dula re a hopola mme re tla a beha le dithapelong hore a kgone ho amohela masisapelo ana.

src: we commend the eastern cape provincial government for assisting the affected families, as well as avbob that has pledged to assist the families with the burials.
tgt: re leboha mmuso wa kapa botjhabela ka ho thusa malapa a amehileng le avbob ka ho thusa malapa ana mabapi le ho boloka bana bana.

src: even as the relevant authorities deconstruct what happened to ensure there is justice for the victims, there is a conversation we do need to have as a country.
tgt: leha diphuputso di ntse di tswela pele ho netefatsa hore malapa a mahlatsipa a qetella a tsebile se etsahetseng, empa ho na le mathata ao re tlamehang ho tobana le ona jwalo ka setjhaba.

src: it is the problem of underage drinking.
tgt: mathata ao ke pharela ya tahi baneng.

src: the footage and images posted online of the socalled ‘pens down’ party at the venue that night show revelling youngsters clutching bottles of alcohol.
tgt: ditshwantsho tse neng di tletse ho inthanete tsa moketjana ona wa ‘ho thabela ho qeta ho ngola ditlhahlobo’, di ne di bontsha batjha ba neng ba phahamiseditse dibotlolo tsa jwalo hodimo.

src: a number of young people from scenery park have told the media of having seen a post circulated on social media, offering free rounds of alcohol to all who attended the event that night.
tgt: bongata ba bona bo ne bo bonahala hore bo dilemong tse ka tlase ho tse 18. bongata ba batjha ba scenery park ba neng ba bue le boraditaba ba ne ba bolele ha ba ne ba fumane molaetsa metjheng ya kgokahano ya hore bohle ba tla ya moketjaneng oo ba tla fumana jwala ba mahala.

src: the increased social acceptability of young people drinking alcohol has become a serious problem in a country where the majority of the drinking population are already classified by the world health organization as binge drinkers.
tgt: ho nwa ha batjha ke pharela e kgolo naheng ena, le mokgatlo wa matjhaba wa tsa bophelo bo botle o bolela ha naha ena e le e nngwe ya tse nwang haholo.

src: alcohol use amongst adolescents is associated with impaired function, absenteeism from learning, alcoholrelated injuries, suicidal thoughts and attempts, and risky behaviour.
tgt: botahwa batjheng bo tsamaisana le mathata a kang ho thisa sekolong, ho lemala ka lebaka la botahwa bona, ho ba le menahano ya ho ipolaya esitana le boitshwaro bo hlephileng.

src: we must come together to combat this vice that is robbing our young people of the best years of their lives, and making them susceptible to alcohol addiction.
tgt: re tlameha ho kopana mmoho re le setjhaba ho lwantsha bothata bona bo senyetsang batjha ba rona maphelo, bo ba etse makgoba a tahi.

src: as families it means having open and frank conversations about alcohol and setting boundaries.
tgt: jwalo ka malapa, re tlameha ho bua ka bothata bona ba jwala mme re nke le mehato e lokelang.

src: children under the age of 18 consuming alcohol is against the law.
tgt: ke tlolo ya molao ho nwa jwala ha ngwana ya dilemo di ka tlase ho tse 18. jwalo ka batho ba baholo, re tlameha ho kgaotsa mokgwa wa ho roma bana jwala, kapa hona ho ba rekela bona.

src: a common denominator between enyobeni tavern, the throb nightclub disaster in durban in 2000, and the osi’s tavern tragedy in khayelitsha in 2015, is that these establishments were selling liquor to minors.
tgt: ho ne ho etsahale se tshwanang tlelapong ya throb mane thekong ka selemo sa 2000, le tameneng ya osi mane khayelitsha ka selemo sa 2015. se tshwanang ka ketsahalo tsena le ena ya tameneng ya enyobeni, ke ho rekisetsa batjha ba tlase dilemong jwala.

src: the proliferation of establishments openly flouting the law points to failings on the part of authorities to enforce regulations.
tgt: ho sebetsa leha e le ha jwang ha dibaka tsena ho bontsha ho hloleha ha ba ka taolong ho qobella melao e behilweng.

src: under the national liquor act, owners of establishments with liquor licenses may not sell alcohol to anyone under the age of 18. they must also take reasonable steps to ensure anyone they are selling alcohol to is of age.
tgt: ka ho ya ka molao o laolang jwala, beng ba dibaka tse rekisang jwala dilaesense tsa bona ha di ba dumelle ho rekisetsa batjha ba dilemo di ka tlase ho tse 18 jwala.

src: we call on communities to work with authorities to ensure that taverns, shebeens, entertainment venues and outlets breaking the law face the consequences.
tgt: re ipiletsa ho setjhaba ho sebedisana le ba ka taolong ho netefatsa hore ditamene, dishibini, dibaka tsa boithabiso le tse rekisang jwala hore di fumana kotlo e di tshwanelang ha di tlola molao.

src: we call upon our police to step up the enforcement of laws that prohibit the sale of alcohol close to schools and enhance monitoring of outlets to ensure alcohol is not being sold to minors.
tgt: re ipiletsa le ho mapolesa ho netefatsa hore ha ho dibaka tse rekisang jwala haufi le dikolo le hore ha ho jwala bo rekisetswang bana.

src: another reality is that alcohol is a form of escapism for young people in communities were opportunities for safe and ageappropriate recreation are few.
tgt: e nngwe ntho eo re e hlokometseng ke hore mathata a tahi batjheng a atile haholo dibakeng tseo dibaka tsa boithabiso tsa batjha di leng mmalwa ho tsona.

src: the scenery park community has pointed to the lack of sports, learning and other developmental facilities for young people, leading them to resort to ‘tavern hopping’.
tgt: setjhaba sa scenery park se boletse ha dibaka tsa dipapadi, tsa thuto mmoho le tse thusang kgolong ya batjha e le leqeme feela, e leng se etsang batjha ba qetelle ba ‘kena ditameneng’.

src: in the wake of the tragedy, the community has pointed out that there are no viable sports grounds, community libraries or youth centres in scenery park.
tgt: ho latela koduwa ena, setjhaba se boletse ha ho se na mabala a dipapadi scenery park, dilaeborari kapa tsona ditsi tsa batjha.

src: as government at national, provincial and local level we need to respond to the pleas of this community and those of other communities by developing more recreational spaces, facilities, programmes, and projects for our young people in disadvantaged areas in the province.
tgt: jwalo ka mmuso boemong ba naha, profensi le ba mmasepala, re tlameha ho mamela sello sa setjhaba sena, le tse ding, ka hore re ahe dibaka tsa boithabiso, re thehe le mananeo le diprojeke tse tla tswela batjha ba rona molemo profensing.

src: other social partners such as the business community should also assist with sponsorship.
tgt: re ipiletsa le ho borakgwebo hore le bona ba kenye letsoho tabeng ena.

src: as communities we must work with our community policing forums, with our civics organisations and with our school governing bodies and play a more active role in the lives of our children and in ensuring their safety and wellbeing.
tgt: re le setjhaba, re tlameha ho sebedisana le mekga ya setjhaba e shebaneng le bonokwane mekgatlo ya setjhaba le ya taolo ya dikolo boitekong ba ho netefatsa paballo le tshireletso ya bana ba rona.

src: as they say in our african indigenous classics "it takes a community to raise a child".
tgt: re tlameha ho toboketsa mantsweng a reng "ngwana o hodiswa ke setjhaba".

src: let us work together to protect our precious future generation from the ravages of alcohol and drug abuse and their effects.
tgt: ha re sebetseng mmoho ho sireletsa setjhaba sena sa kamoso ho bolaweng ke dithethefatsi le jwala.

src: let us work together to ensure that those who put profit before the lives of our children are not allowed to operate.
tgt: ha re kopaneng ho netefatsa hore bohle ba shebaneng feela le ho etsa tjhelete ba sa kgathalle maphelo a bana ba rona ha ba dumellwe ho rekisa moo re dulang.

src: let us also set a positive example in our own relationship with alcohol.
tgt: le rona ha re beng mohlala o motle tshebedisong ya jwala.

src: monkeypox in south africa vukuzenzele unnamed health health minister dr joe phaahla has confirmed that monkeypox has been detected in south africa during a recent media briefing in pretoria, gauteng.
tgt: monkeypox afrika borwa vukuzenzele unnamed letona la tsa bophelo ngaka joe phaahla, o netefaditse taba ya hore monkeypox e fumanehile afrika borwa sebokeng sa boraditaba, tshwane, gauteng.

src: he said he received a report from the national health laboratory services (nhls) that they have confirmed monkeypox in south africa through laboratory tests.
tgt: o boletse hore o fumane tlaleho ho mokgatlo wa naha wa ditshebeletso tsa dilaboratori (nhls) hore ditekong tsa bona ba fumane hore monkeypox e se e le teng afrika borwa.

src: the virus has been detected in gauteng and the western cape.
tgt: kokwanahloko ena e fumanehile profensing ya gauteng le ya kapa bophirima.

src: monkeypox is usually a mild disease manifesting as blisters or sores on the skin.
tgt: monkeypox ke bohloko bo seng matla, bo hlahella ng e le matjhatjhetsi kapa diso letlalong la motho.

src: it is usually mild and with a fatality rate of 1 percent.
tgt: ke bohloko bo seng bohale mme sekgahla sa bona sa ho bolaya ke persente feela.

src: the disease has previously been reported in african countries such as nigeria, democratic republic of the congo, central african republic and ghana in the early 2000s.
tgt: mathwasong a dilemo tsa bo 2000, bohloko bona ho ile ha tlalehwa ha bo atile dinaheng tsa afrika tse kang nigeria, democratic republic of the congo, central african republic le ghana.

src: the current outbreak is dominated by high numbers in europe with the uk leading with over 700 cases, spain with just over 500, followed by germany, portugal and france.
tgt: hona jwale bohloko bona bo atile haholo yuropa mme uk ke yona e nang le palo e hodimo ya bakudi ba fetang 700, ho latele spain ka ba fetang 500 mme ho latele jeremane, portugal le fora.

src: the minister said the national institute for communicable diseases (nicd) is conducting online inservice training for health workers to be able to detect the disease so that necessary laboratory tests can be done.
tgt: letona le boletse ha mokgatlo wa naha wa mahloko a tshwaetsanang (nicd) o rupella basebeletsi ba tsa bophelo bo botle ka inthanete hore ba kgone ho bona matshwao a bohloko bona mme ho etsuwe diteko tse tlamehileng ho etsuwa tsa bohloko bona dilabora toring.

src: "the disease only spreads through close contact, so you cannot get it by being in the same room with an infected person," the minister said.
tgt: "bohloko bona, bo tshwaetsana feela ka ho thetsana, ka hoo, o ke se tshwaetsehe ka ho ba ka tlung le mokudi wa bohloko bona," letona le boletse jwalo.

src: minister phaahla assu red south africans that monkeypox is not a virus which has never been seen before and scientists have information about it.
tgt: letona phaahla o netefaleditse maafrika borwa hore monkeypox ha se kokwanahloko e ntjha, ka hoo, borasaense ba rona ba na le tsebo ka yona.

src: chairperson of the minis terial advisory committee (mac) on covid19 and executive member of nhls, professor koleka mlisana, said monkeypox is a disease that is endemic in central and northern africa which has been known to be mild.
tgt: modulasetulo wa komiti ya matona ya dikeletso mabapi le covid19, eo hape e boetseng e le setho sa nhls, profesara koleka mlisana, o re monkeypox ke sewa haholo dinaheng tse bohareng le leboya ho afrika mme le teng ha e matla hakalo.

src: an endemic disease is a condition regularly found among particular people or in a certain area.
tgt: bohloko bo sa atang ke boo hangata bo fumane hang bathong ba itseng kapa sebakeng se itseng feela.

src: she said there are simila rities between monkeypox and smallpox.
tgt: o boletse ha monkeypox kae kae e ntse e itshwanela le smallpox.

src: "there are vaccines and treatment available for monkeypox.
tgt: "monkeypox e na le ente le meriana ya yona.

src: the disease presents itself with flu like symptoms and legionnaires.
tgt: bohloko bona bo itlhahisa e ka mokgohlane le legionnaires.

src: the important thing is that somebody who comes up with a clinical picture is easy to diagnose and most importantly it is difficult to transmit, unlike a respiratory virus, because it is by contact.
tgt: se molemo ke hore ha o kgona ho hlalosetsa ngaka bothata ba hao, ho ba bobebe hore o etswe diteko tsa bohloko bona mme hape ha ho bobebe hore e tshwaetsane jwalo ka kokwanahloko tsena tse amang matshwafo, yona e tshwaetsana ka ho thetsana.

src: you would only get it when you have come in direct contact with somebody who is infected," she said.
tgt: o tshwaetseha feela ha o ile wa thetsana le mokudi wa bohloko bona," o boletse jwalo.

src: legionnaires' disease is a severe form of pneumonia.
tgt: bohloko ba legionnaires bo tshwana le ba nyomonia e matla.

src: professor mlisana said contact tracing is important in this case and the health department will continue to do that.
tgt: profesara mlisana o boletse hore ho bohlokwa ho tsomana le batho ba ileng ba thetsana le bakudi ba bohloko bona, mme lefapha la bophelo bo botle le tla tswela pele le ho etsa jwalo.

src: she assured south africans that the laboratory infrastructure has all the adequate resources to be able monitor any new infections that may arise.
tgt: o netefaleditse maafrika borwa hore dilaboratori tsa rona di na le disebediswa tse lekaneng ho ka kgona ho hlwaya ditshwaetso tse ntjha tse ka hlahang.

src: "through her training agency, dr zulu explained that she worked across six provinces, helping women and young people to run their farming operations.
tgt: o sebdisa tsebo ya hae e kenelletseng ya tsa phepo le dilemo tse ngata tsa boiphihlelo bakeng sa ho hla hisa meroho le dikgoho tse hodisitsweng ka mokgwa wa setho polasing ya hae ka morero wa ho matlafatsa basadi ba bang ho ba dihwai.

src: commercial poultry farmingin 2017, dr zulu realised that her training was meaningless without results, so she bought a farm to put her knowledge into action.
tgt: ngaka zulu a dilemo tse 48, a nang le lengolo la bongaka ho tsa phepo, o na le polasi ya dihektara tse 23 cullinan haufi le tshwane, moo a hlahisang le ho pheha meroho le dikgoho tse a di romellang mabenkeleng a maholo a mmalwa.

src: today, she has become a commercial poultry farmer with more than 7 500 broilers.
tgt: polasi ya hae e amohetse le ho rupella baithuti ba 20 ba ithutelang bolemirui.

src: south africa's first female paratrooper dr ethel zulu is leading from the front on her farm where she grows organic vegetables and freerange chickens she supplies to the established supermarkets.
tgt: "ngaka zulu o hlalositse hore o sebeditse diporofenseng tse tshelela ka khamphane ya hae, a thusa basadi le batjha ka tsa temo le ho rua.

src: within two years, we produced 5 000 broilers and started to supply local supermarkets.
tgt: tsatsing lena e se e le morui wa dikgoho tse reki swang tse fetang 7 500. qalong leano la hae e ne e le ho hlahisa meroho fela.

src: in addition to supermarkets, dr zulu supplies her produce to hawkers.
tgt: dilemong tse pedi, ke ha re hlahisitse paratrooper ya pele ya mosadi afrika borwa ngaka ethel zulu o etella pele jwalo ka mohlala polasing ya hae moo a lemang meroho le dikgoho tse hodisitsweng ka setho tse a di rekisetsang mabenkele a maholo.

src: small business urged to apply for support nosihle shelembe the minister of small business development, stella ndabeniabra hams, has encouraged small businesses in townships and rural areas to apply for support through the township and rural entrepreneurship programme (trep).
tgt: dikgwebo tse nyane di kgothalletswa ho kopa thuso nosihle shelembe letona la ntshetso pele ya dikgwebo tse nyane, stella ndabeniabrahams, o kgothalleditse dikgwebo tse nyane tsa metse setoropo le mahaeng ho kopa thuso ho lenaneo la bohwebi la metsesetoropo le mahae (trep).

src: "we are deliberate in addressing unemployment and poverty, but we also have a responsibility to grow the economy," minister ndabeni abrahams said.
tgt: "re ikemiseditse ho fedisa tlhokeho ya mesebetsi le bofuma, empa re boetse re na le maikarabelo a ho hodisa moruo," ho rialo letona ndabeniabrahams.

src: addressing the shetradesza youth seminar held recently in pretoria, the minister said the maximum value of trep stands at r1 million, with one com ponent being a grant and the other a loan.
tgt: ha a bua sebokeng sa batjha sa shetradesza se sa tswa tshwarelwa tshwane, letona le itse boleng bo hodimodimo ba trep ke miliyone e le nngwe ya diranta, karolo enngwe ya yona ke e o e fiwang mme enngwe ke e o e kadi ngwang.

src: township or ruralbased entrepreneurs can apply for support, including funding, through the common application template from the small enterprise development agency (seda), the small enterprise finance agency (sefa), the national empowerment fund (nef) and the national youth development agency (nyda).
tgt: bahwebi ba metsesetoropo kapa ba mahaeng ba ka kopa thuso, ho kenyeletsa le thuso ya tjhelete, ka foromo e tlwaelehileng e hlahang ho lefapha la ntshetsopele ya dikgwebo tse nyane (seda), lefapha la matlole a dikgwebo tse nyane (sefa), letlole la ntshetsopele ya naha (nef) le lefapha la ntshetsopele ya batjha ba naha (nyda).

src: the owners of the business must be south african nationals.
tgt: beng ba dikgwebo ba tlameha e be maafrika borwa hore ba kgone ho etsa dikopo.

src: the following schemes are available for qualifying entrepreneurs: smallscale bakeries and confectioneries support programme autobody repairs and mechanics support programme (as well as small and independent autospares shops and informal automotive entrepreneurs) butcheries support programme clothing, leather and textiles support programme personal care support programme spazashop support programme tshisanyama and cooked food support programme registration can be done on smmesa.
tgt: lenaneo la mabaka a manyane le mabenkele a dipompong lenaneo la tshehetso ya dikgwebo tsa ho kobolla le ho penta dipalangwang le ho teha dikoloi (mmoho le mabenkele a manyane a ikemetseng a rekisang dikarolo tsa dipalangwang le bahwebi ba banyane ba dikoloi) lenaneo la tshehetso ya dilakga lenaneo la tshehetso ya dikgwebo tsa diaparo, letlalo le masela lenaneo la dikgwebo tse hlahisang dihlahiswa tsa ho itlhokomela lenaneo la tshehetso ya dispazashopo lenaneo la tshehetso ya dikgwebo tsa ditshisa nyama le dijo tse phehi lwengo ka ingodisa ho smmesa.

src: gov.
tgt: gov.

src: za/.
tgt: za.

src: and complete the information required.
tgt: mme o fane ka lesedi le hlokehang.

src: in an effort to ensure the funding processes for small business is seamless and userfriendly, government is working toward merging entities for small businesses to form one agency.
tgt: jwalo ka matsapa a ho etsa bonnete ba hore metjha ya tshehetso ya tjhelete bakeng sa dikgwebo tse nyane e ba metle mme e ba bobebe, mmuso o ntse o sebetsana le ho kopanya ditheo bakeng sa dikgwebo tse nyane ho etsa setheo se le seng.

src: "we are currently in the process of merging sefa and seda as well as the cooperative banks development agency.
tgt: "hajwale re motjheng wa ho kopanya sefa le seda ha mmoho le khamphane ya ntshetsopele ya dibanka tsa mahatammoho.

src: "shetrades programme ndabeniabrahams said through various initiatives, government has assisted the small business sector to grow and create muchneeded employment.
tgt: "lenaneo la shetrades ndabeniabrahams o itse ka metjha e fapaneng, mmuso o thusitse lekala la dikgwebo tse nyane ho hola le ho theha mesebetsi.

src: "the department of small business development and seda formed a partnership with the international trade centre (itc), to bring the shetrades programme to south africa, and create a shetradesza hub.
tgt: "lefapha la ntshetsopele ya dikgwebo tse nyane le seda ba thehile tshebedisano mmoho le setheo sa matjhaba sa dikgwebo (itc), ho tlisa shetradesza afrika borwa, le ho theha shetradesza hub.

src: "the programme aims to empower womenowned enterprises to trade locally, regionally and internationally.
tgt: "leano lena le ikemiseditse ho matlafatsa dikgwebo tsa basadi hore di se sitiswe ho etsa kgwebo ka naheng, ka dinaheng tsa setereke le ka dinaheng tsa matjhaba.

src: the hub supports strengthening the business skills and competitiveness of at least 10 000 south african female entrepreneurs over a fouryear period," the minister said.
tgt: shetradesza hub e tshehetsa bahwebi ba basadi ba 10 000 ba afrika borwa ka ho ba matlafatsa ka tsebo ya kgwebo le tlhodisano bonyane sebaka sa dilemo tse nne," ho rialo letona.

src: we must act now and together to end violence against women vukuzenzele unnamed it has been a tragic start to women’s month.
tgt: re lokela ho nka bohato jwale, mmoho, ho fedisa dikgoka kgahlano le basadi vukuzenzele unnamed kgwedi ya basadi e qadile ka ketsahalo e nyarosang.

src: we are once more confronted with the dark and ugly side of our society.
tgt: re boetse re tobane le lehlakore le lebe a setjhaba sa rona.

src: last month, a group of men and women shooting a music video at a disused mine near krugersdorp were attacked by armed assailants who gang raped eight of the women.
tgt: kgweding e fetileng sehlopha sa banna le basadi ba neng ba etsa kgatiso ya vidiyo ya mmino morafong o seng o sa rashwe o haufi le krugersdorp se ile sa hlaselwa ke batho ba neng ba hlometse ba betileng basadi ba robedi.

src: these horrible acts of brutality are an affront to the right of women and girls to live and work in freedom and safety.
tgt: diketsahalo tsena tsa bo kgopo ke thohako tokelong ya basadi le banana ya ho phela le ho sebetsa ka bolo kolohi le ka polokeho.

src: while they pursue the suspects in this crime, the south african police service must also pay immediate attention to the concerns of the community of west village, where the incident occurred, who say they are under siege from armed gangs in the area.
tgt: nakong eo tshebeletso ya mapolesa afrika borwa (saps) e latellang babelae llwa ba ketso ena, e boetse e lokela ho mamela dingo ngoreho tsa baahi ba west village, moo ketsahalo ena e etsahetseng teng, ba reng ba phela ba dinonyana ke maqulwana a disenyi tse hlometseng sebakeng seo.

src: rapists have no place in our society.
tgt: ba betang ha ba batlehe hohang setjhabeng sa rona.

src: we call upon communities to work with the police to ensure that these criminals are apprehended and prosecuted.
tgt: re ipiletsa ho baahi ho sebetsa le mapolesa ho nete fatsa hore disenyi tsena di a tshwarwa le ho qoswa.

src: our communities must not shelter criminals in their midst.
tgt: baahi ba rona ha ba a lokela ho di sireletsa.

src: there is always someone in our communities who knows something, who heard something or who even witnessed something.
tgt: ho dula ho na le motho ya tsebang ho hong metseng ya rona, ya utlwileng ho hong kapa ya boneng ho hong.

src: the problem is many of us choose to keep quiet because the perpetrator is a friend, a partner or a colleague.
tgt: bothata ke hore bonga ta ba rona re kgetha ho itholela hobane sesenyi e le motswalle, molekane kapa mosebetsimmoho.

src: or we are just afraid and fear victimisation.
tgt: ka nako tse ding re a tshaba kapa re tshaba ho hlekefetswa.

src: it is important to remember that all tipoffs received by the saps crime stop contact centre are treated confidentiality.
tgt: ho bohlokwa ho hopola hore ha o hlabile mokgosi setsing sa mehala sa saps crime stop dintlha tsohle tsa hao di tla dula e le sephiri.

src: i call on anyone who has information about this crime to report it to the authorities so the perpetrators can be arrested.
tgt: ke ipiletsa ho bohle ba nang le tlhahisoleseding ka bosenyi bona ho e tlaleha mapoleseng molemong wa hore ho tshwarwe disenyi.

src: given the size of this problem in our country, it is no longer possible to avoid responsibility for reporting sex crimes.
tgt: ha ho sa kgonahala ho qoba ho tlaleha diketso tsa bosenyi tse amang motabo ho ya kamoo bothata bona bo seng bo atile naheng ya rona.

src: according to a new legal provision that has come into effect, in addition to our moral obligation, we all now have a legal duty to report to authorities when we have knowledge, reasonable belief or suspicion that a sexual offence has been committed against a vulnerable person.
tgt: ho ya ka molao o motjha o sa tswa kena tshebetsong, le haeba re hlompha matswalo a rona, re a lokela bohle jwale ho ya ka molao ho tlalehela mapolesa ha re na le tsebo, tumelo e lekaneng kapa pelaelo ya hore motho ya seng maemong a ho itshireletsa o hlekefeditswe ka motabo.

src: it is now a crime not to report such a sexual offence.
tgt: e se e le tlolo ya molao ho se tlalehe ketso ya mofuta oo.

src: this is part of one of three laws that i signed earlier this year that strengthen the fight against genderbased violence and offer greater support and protection to survivors.
tgt: ena ke karolo ya melao e meraro eo ke e saenneng pejana selemong sena e matlafatsang ntwa kgahlano le dikgoka tse amanang le bong mme e tshehetsa le ho sireletsa mahlatsipa.

src: among other things, the laws expand the scope of the national register of sex offenders, strengthen the vetting process, and introduce additional categories of sex offences.
tgt: hara tse ding, melao ena e atolosa mosebetsi wa rejistara ya naha ya disenyi tsa motabo, e matlafatse motjha wa ho fuputswa ha batho hore ha ba so etse bosenyi na, e boele e hlahise mefuta e meng ya bosenyi ba motabo.

src: processes are underway to put these laws into effect.
tgt: ho ntse ho sebetsanwa le ho kenya melao ena tshe betsong.

src: these include training of prosecutors and magistrates, issuing directives on bail to all saps officials, and revising charge sheets to include the newly created offences.
tgt: sena se kenyeletsa ho rupellwa ha batjhutjhisi le bomakgistrata, ho eletswa ha mapolesa ka ho nehwa ha babelaellwa beili, le ho tliswa ha diphetoho toko maneng ya diqoso kgahlano le motho hore di kenyeletse ditlolo tse ntjha tsa molao.

src: we are determined that all these building blocks are in place so that our law enforcement authorities and courts can investigate and prosecute genderbased violence more effectively.
tgt: re batla hore tsena tsohle di be teng ho thusa mapolesa le makgotla a dinyewe ho fuputsa le ho qosa diketso tsa dikgoka tse amanang le bong ntle le mathata.

src: genderbased violence and femicide is a deeprooted societal problem.
tgt: dikgoka kgahlano le bong le polao ya basadi le banana ke bothata bo seng bo iphile matla setjhabeng.

src: it is not enough for perpetrators to be apprehended, tried, convicted and sentenced.
tgt: ha ho a lekana ho tshwa rwa, ho qoswa, ho behwa molato le ho ahlolwa ha ba etsang diketso tsena.

src: we must work together to address the drivers of genderbased violence in our communities, including patriarchal attitudes and practices.
tgt: re lokela ho sebetsa mmoho ho lwantsha tse susumetsang dikgoka tse amanang le bong metseng ya rona, ho kenyeletsa tsela ya bophelo e reng banna feela ke dihlooho tsa malapa le baetapele.

src: eradicating genderbased violence demands that we act together as a people.
tgt: ntwa kgahlano le dikgoka tsa bong e batla hore re sebetse mmoho re le se tjhaba.

src: bursary opportunities for young people kgaogelo letsebe sonia malinga (23) from piet retief in mpumalanga says being a shoprite group bursary recipient has ensured a promising future for her.
tgt: menyetla ya dibasari kgaogelo letsebe sonia malinga (23) wa piet retief, mpumalanga o re ho fumana basari ya shoprite group ho mo netefaleditse bokamoso bo tjhatsi.

src: malinga received the bursary from the south african retailer in 2018. she applied for the bursary after finishing high school at hoërskool piet retief.
tgt: malinga o fumane basari lebenkeleng lena le leholo la afrika borwa ka 2018. o entse kopo ya ba sari kamora ho phethela dithuto tsa hae tsa se kolong se phahameng, hoërskool piet retief.

src: "growing up, i initially wanted to be a doctor, but later i started exploring other options.
tgt: "ha ke hola ke ne ke batla ho ba ngaka, empa hamorao ka batlisisa ka makala a mang.

src: i read about supply chain and logistics management and was almost instantly attracted to it.
tgt: ka bala ka supply chain and logis tics management mme ya nkgahla hanghang.

src: i remember i used to sit and watch the trucks drive in and out of my hometown and wonder who was ensuring that the quality and quantity of goods were correct and that they arrived at the correct delivery point.
tgt: ke a hopola ke ne ke dula ke shebella dilori di tsa di kena di etswa motseng wa heso ke ipotse hore ke mang ya netefatsang hore boleng le bongata ba thepa e nepahetse le hore e fihla moo e loketseng.

src: that’s when i found my passion," says malinga.
tgt: ka qala ka ba le thahase llo nakong eo," ho bolela malinga.

src: malinga obtained a bcom honours degree in logistics management at the university of johannesburg and started her career with shoprite as a distribution centre trainee manager in february 2021. she was recently promoted to store replenishment analyst.
tgt: malinga o ile a fumana lengolo la bcom honours ho logistics management yunivesithing ya johan nesburg mme a qala ho sebetsa shoprite a rupe llwa botsamaisi seba keng sa kabo ya thepa ka hlakola 2021. o sa tswa nyollelwa ho ba okamela tsa bolepi ba tlhokeho ya thepa mabenkeleng.

src: being part of the shoprite group has broadened malinga’s knowledge of the retail industry.
tgt: ho ba karolo ya shoprite group ho atolositse tsebo ya malinga ya indasteri ya mabenkele.

src: "it has taught me even more about logistics management and enabled me to continuously develop my skills and advance in my career," she says.
tgt: "ho nthu tile haholo ka tsamaiso ya tlhophiso mme ho nthu sitse hore ke tswele pele ka ho ntshetsa pele bo kgoni ba ka le ho imatla fatsa mosebetsing wa ka," ho boletse yena.

src: how to applyapplications for the shoprite group’s allinclusive bursary programme are open for the 2023 academic year.
tgt: ho etsa kopo dikopo di buletswe ba keng sa lenaneo la dibasa ri le kenyeletsang bohle la shoprite group la selemo sa dithuto sa 2023. basari e ntsha r45 000 ho ya ho r70 000 ka se lemo, ho latela lekala la thuto le setheo sa thuto.

src: zuluinspired food puts cape town restaurant on the map owen mngadi by showcasing pride in her heritage through traditional food, restaurateur mmabatho molefe has put her restaurant, emazulwini, on the world map after it was included in the 50 next list.
tgt: dijo tse nang le tshusumetso ya isizulu di behile restjhurente ena ya motse kapa mmapeng owen mngadi ka ho pepesa botjhaba ba hae ka dijo tsa botjhaba, mmarestjhurente mmabatho molefe o behile restjhurente ya hae,emazulwini, mmapeng walefatshe kamora hoba e kenyeletswe ho lenane la50 next .

src: this list names 50 of the world’s most exciting chefs, who have the potential to one day make the prestigious world’s 50 best restaurants list.
tgt: lenane lena le teka diapehi tse 50 tse kgahlisang ka ho fetisisa lefatsheng, tse nang le bokgoni ba hore ka le leng la matsatsi di kene lenaneng la direstjhurente tse 50 tse hlwahlwa ka ho fetisisa lefatsheng.

src: molefe (27) established her modern zulu restaurant in cape town at the v&a waterfront’s makers landing space in 2020, after she lost her job in the restaurant industry due to the covid19 pandemic.
tgt: molefe (27) o thehile restjhurente ya isizulu ya sejwalejwale motse kapa, tulong ya v&a waterfront’s makers landing ka selemo sa 2020, kamora ho lahlehelwa ke mosebetsi indastering ya direstjhurente ka lebaka la sewa sa covid19.

src: she says her cuisine was inspired by her upbringing in kwazulunatal where her grandmother used to cook traditional food.
tgt: o re mokgwa wa hae wa ho pheha o susumeditswe ke kgodiso ya hae kwazulunatal moo nkgono wa hae a neng a pheha dijo tsa botjhaba.

src: she believes that this worked in her favour and helped her stand out from the rest in the 50 next competition.
tgt: o dumela hore sena se bile molemo bophelong ba hae le ho mo thusa ho qatsoha ka hara ba bang tlhodisanong ya 50 next.

src: molefe says emazulwini, loosely translated as ‘the heavens’, has attracted interest from south africans and international visitors keen to try her zuluinspired food.
tgt: molefe o re emazulwini, e bolelang ‘mahodimo’ ha e fetolelwa, e hohetse kgahlehelo ya baeti ba maafrika borwa le ba matjhaba ba labalabelang ho ja dijo tsa hae tse nang le tshusumetso ya isizulu.

src: makers landing, which is a hub for south african food and culture, is the perfect venue for her, she says.
tgt: makers landing, e leng lepatlelo la dikgwebo tsa dijo le setso sa afrika borwa, ke tulo e phethahetseng hantle kgwebong ya hae, o rialo.

src: emazulwini offers a sevencourse set menu, which changes each season.
tgt: emazulwini e fana ka menyu wa mekgahlelo e supileng, o fetohang sehla ka seng.

src: molefe’s food is beautifully served, and includes dishes such as isijingi – pumpkin porridge, roasted pumpkin,peach gel and brown butter ice cream; isibindi nechakalaka – butter basted ox liver, yellow lentil chakalaka and onion jus; and iqanda, isibindi noshatini – tartlet with roasted tomato relish, chicken liver and biltongcured yolk crème.
tgt: dijo tsa molefe di fepelwa ka bokgabane, mme di kenyeletsa dijo tse kang isijingi – setjetsa, mokopu o hadikilweng, aesekerimi ya diperekisi le botoro e sootho; isibindi nechakalaka – sebete le chakalaka, chakalaka ya dilentile le moro wa eie; le iqanda, isibindi noshatini – mahe, sebete le tjhatini,dibete tsa kgoho le moro wa mothwebe le dihwapa.

src: "when you get to cape town, you may not get a true reflection of what south africa is about, so i decided to stay true to myself with traditional food to show visitors what we eat.
tgt: "ha o fihla motse kapa, o ka nna wa se bone seo afrika borwa e hlileng e leng sona, kahoo ke ile ka etsa qeto ya ho tsitlallela seo ke leng sona ka dijo tsa botjhaba ho bontsha baeti seo re se jang.

src: i tell myself every morning i am telling my story; my interpretation of what zulu food is.
tgt: ke a ipolella hoseng ho hong le ho hong hore mona ke pheta pale ya ka; kutlwisiso ya ka ya hore dijo tsa isizulu ke eng.

src: i hope people embrace it for what it is.
tgt: ke tshepa hore batho batla di ananela ho ya kamoo di leng kateng.

src: we hope to elevate ordinary dishes to the exceptional.
tgt: re rerile ho phahamisa maemo a dijo tse tlwaelehileng hore di itlhome pele.

src: cape town has a diverse population, apart from international tourists; they all get to learn about zulu food," she says.
tgt: motse kapa o na le ditjhaba tse fapafapaneng, ntle le ho kenyeletsa bahahlaudi ba matjhaba, mme kaofela ha tsona di tla ithuta ka dijo tsa isizulu," o rialodirestjhurente tse 50 tse hlwahlwa ka ho fetisisa lefatshenge ne e le tsela ya molefe ya ho etsa dijo tsa botjhaba hore e be tsa sejwalejwale e mo buletseng sebaka lenaneng la 50 next, leo selemo ka seng le ketekang batho ba 50 ba tlasa dilemo tse 35 ba bopang lepatlelo la dijo lefatsheng ka bophara.

src: the world's 50 best’s 50 next list it was molefe’s way of modernising traditional food that scored her a spot on the 50 next list, which each year celebrates 50 people aged under 35 who are shaping the worldwide food scene.
tgt: tlhodisano ena e thusa diapehi tse bohlale tse ntseng di thuthua ho pepesa mopheho wa tsona lefatsheng.

src: molefe attended the awards ceremony in june in bilbao, spain, and says it was an inspirational day of discussions with other foodies.
tgt: molefe o kenetse moketjana wa dikgau ka phuptjane bilbao, ho la spain, mme o re e ne e le letsatsi le kgothatsang la dipuisano le diapehi tse ding.

src: "i have been fortunate to get people from across the country and all age groups to come enjoy our food.
tgt: "ke lehlohonolo hobane batho ho phatlalla le naha le ba dilemo kaofela ka ho fapana ha tsona ba tla mona ho tla latswa dijo tsa rona.

src: people are prejudiced against offal (the internal organs of an animal used as food) and i want to show them that if you treat it right, it can taste just as delicious as any other cut of meat.
tgt: batho ba na le ho nena dikahare mme ke batla ho ba bontsha hore ha o di phehile hantle, di ka latsweha ha monate jwaloka leqa lefe kapa lefe la nama.

src: i also want to promote nosetotail dining, to champion this sustainable way of eating," molefe says.
tgt: hape ke batla ho hodisa mokgwa wa ho ja o kenyeletsang ditho kaofela tsa phoofolo, ho kgothaletsa mokgwa ona o phethahetseng wa ho ja," ho rialo molefe.

src: emazulwini also won the african restaurant of the year title at the fourth annual luxe restaurant awards earlier this year.
tgt: pejana selemong sena emazulwini e boetse e hapile hape sekola sa restjhurente ya seafrika ya selemo ho dikgau tsa selemo tsa luxe restaurant.

src: save money: buy zerorated goods allison cooper while the incre asing cost of living in south africa is taking its toll on citizens, especially those from lowincome households, you can ensure that your money goes further when shopping for groceries by buying zerorated goods.
tgt: boloka tjhelete: reka thepa e sa lefellweng lekgetho allison cooper ha ditjeo tsa bophelo di ntse di tswella ho phahama ka hara afrika borwa di thefula baahi ba yona, ka ho qolleha ba malapa a lekeno le tlase, motho a ka netefatsa hore tjhelete ya hae e ya mo sebeletsa ha a reka korosara ka ho reka thepa e sa lefellweng lekgetho.

src: zerorated goods are certain basic foods that people do not have to pay tax on, which means they are sold at a cheaper price.
tgt: thepa e sa lefellweng lekgetho ke dijo tse itseng tseo batho ba sa di lefelleng lekgetho, e leng se bolelang hore di rekiswa ka theko e tlase.

src: people who buy food off the zerorated list can get a little more for their money, which helps them to put nutritious food on the table.
tgt: batho ba rekang dijo tse lenaneng la tse sa lefellweng lekgetho ba ka fumana ho hongata bakeng sa tjhelete ya bona, e leng se ba thusang ho ja dijo tse nang le phepo.

src: according to statistics south africa (stats sa), food and nonalcoholic beverages (nab) cost 8.6% more in june this year than they did in june 2021. stats sa said the food products that have increased the most are bread and cere als (which includes maize meal), meat and oils and fats – all of which are staple foods in many households.
tgt: ho ya ka lefapha la dipalopalo la afrika borwa (stats sa), dijo le dino tse hlokang tahi (nab) di bitsa 8.6% ho feta ka phuptjane selemong sena ho feta kamoo di neng di bitsa kateng ka phuptjane 2021. ba stats sa ba itse dihlahiswa tsa dijo tse phahameng ka ho fetisisa ke borotho le disirele (tse kenyeletsang phofo ya papa), nama le dioli le mafura – tseo kaofela e leng dijo tsa letsatsi ka leng malapeng a mangata.

src: bread and cereal products have increased by 11.2% since june 2021, up from 8.4% in may this year, when the consumer price index (cpi) increased by 1.1%.
tgt: borotho le dihlahiswa tsa disirele di phahame ka 11.2% esale ho tloha ka phuptjane 2021, di tlohile ho 8.4% ka motsheanong selemong sena, ha lenane la ditheko tsa bareki (cpi) le phahame ka 1.1%.

src: the monthly increase was 2.6%, with notable price rises for maize meal (5.2%), brown bread (3.2%) and macaroni (3%).
tgt: ho phahama ha kgwedi ka nngwe e bile 2.6%, ka ho phahama ho bonahalang ha theko ya phofo ya papa (5.2%), bohobe bo bosootho (3.2%) le makharoni (3%).

src: in addition, meat prices increased by 9.5% from june 2021 to june 2022., and cost slightly more than they did in may 2022. oils and fats increased annually by 32.5%, compared with 26.9% in may when the cpi increased.
tgt: hodima moo, ditheko tsa nama di phahame ka 9.5% ho tloha ka phuptjane 2021 ho isa ka phuptjane 2022, mme di bitsa hanyane ho feta kamoo di neng di le kateng ka motsheanong 2022. dioli le mafura di phahame selemo ka seng ka 32.5%, ha ho bapiswa le 26.9% ka motsheanong ha cpi e ne e phahama.

src: the high cost of sunflower oil, in particular, is putting extra strain on budgets.
tgt: ditjeo tse hodimo tsa oli ya sonobolomo, ka ho qolleha, e behile kgatello e eketsehileng hodima ditekanyetso.

src: save with zerorated goodszerorated goods were introduced by government in 1991 to help lowincome households.
tgt: boloka ka thepa e sa lefellweng lekgethothepa e sa lefellweng lekge tho e ile ya tsebahatswa ke mmuso ka selemo sa 1991 ho thusa malapa a lekeno le tlase.

src: since the initial introduction, more items have been added to the list.
tgt: esale le tsebahatswa sethathong, dintho tse ngata di ile tsa eketswa lenaneng.

src: support the police to make south africa safe vukuzenzele unnamed there is growing public frustration and anger at the levels of crime in our country.
tgt: tshehetsa sepolesa hore afrika borwa e betulo e bolokehileng vukuzenzele unnamed ho na le ho nyahama le kgalefo ya setjhaba mabapi le maemo a ditlolo tsa molao ka hara naha ya bo rona.

src: the recent robbery and gang rape of eight young women in krugersdorp caused nationwide outrage and led to calls for decisive action against armed illegal mining gangs operating in the area.
tgt: ho kgothotswa le peto ya basadi ba batjha ba robedi ke banna ba fapanyetsana haufinyana tjena krugersdorp di bakile ditaba di hana ho fela naheng ka bophara mme ha lebisa kgoeletsong ya kgato e matla kgahlanong le maqu lwana a hlometseng a barafi ba seng molaong ba sebeletsang tulong eo.

src: the south african police service is to be commended for its decisive actions over the past three weeks in response to the gang rape and criminality in the area.
tgt: tshebeletso ya sepolesa ya afrika borwa (saps) e lokela ho thoholetswa bakeng sa mehato ya yona e matla dibekeng tse tharo tse fetileng ho arabela petong le diketsong tsa botlokotsebe tulong eo.

src: however, communities have rightly pointed out that it should not take a high profile crime for action to finally be taken against criminality.
tgt: leha ho le jwalo, badudi ba entse hantle ho supa hore ha ho a lokela hore ho etsahale botlokotsebe bo maemong a sisimosang hore e be hona ho qetellwang ho nkuwa mohato kgahlanong le botlokotsebe.

src: the reality is that there are serious challenges facing policing in south africa.
tgt: nnete ke hore ho na le diqholotso tse matla tse tobileng boemo ba sepolesa ka hara afrika borwa.

src: but we are working hard to overcome them.
tgt: feela re sebetsa ka thata ho di hlola.

src: like all government departments, the south african police service is feeling the effects of the country’s fiscal crisis, several years of understaffing and state capture.
tgt: jwaloka mafapha ohle a mmuso, saps le yona e utlwa ditlamorao tsa koduwa ya maemo a ditjhelete a naha, dilemo tse mmalwa tsa kgaello ya ho hirwa ha mapolesa le diketso tsa ho hula mmuso ka nko.

src: police members also work in a dangerous environment where they often have to face violence, injury or death.
tgt: ditho tsa sepolesa di boetse di sebetsa tikolohong e kotsi moo hangata di lokelang ho tobana le dikgoka, ditemalo kapa lefu.

src: crime in south africa cannot be eradicated without a strong, capable, professional police force.
tgt: ntle le lebotho la sepolesa le matla le nang le bokgoni le la seprofeshenale, botlokotsebe ka hara afrika borwa bo keke ba fediswa kgaello ya ho hirwa ha bahlanka ba saps e bile e nngwe ya dintlha tse tshwai lweng tlalehong ya phanele ya ditsebi ya merusu ya phupu 2021, eo re ntseng re nka mehato bakeng sa ho sebetsana le yona.

src: the capacity of the saps was one of the issues flagged in the report of the expert panel into the july 2021 unrest, which we are taking steps to address.
tgt: kaha re se re buseditse botsitso bo batlehang ka matla ketapeleng ya saps, jwale re tsepamisitse maikutlo tabeng ya ho ngotla dikgeo tsa bokgoni tse entseng maemong a hore mapolesa a iphumane a se malalaalaotswe bakeng sa ho sebetsana le diketsahalo tsa phupu selemong se fetileng.

src: understaffing and lack of adequate training has had a particularly dire impact on community and public order policing.
tgt: kgaello ya ho hirwa ha mapolesa le kgaello ya thupello e nepahetseng di bile le kgahlamelo e matla tshebeletsong ya sepolesa ya badudi le ya polokeho ya setjhaba.

src: government has allocated funding for the recruitment of 12,000 new police trainees, and the first cohort is undergoing basic training.
tgt: mmuso o abile matlole bakeng sa ho thaothwa ha matshwasana a matjha a sepolesa a 12 000, mme mokgahlelo wa pele o se o le thupellong ya bohlokwa.

src: the saps public order policing units will receive an additional 4,000 members this financial year, and arrangements are being made for appropriate training for members.
tgt: diyuniti tsa tshebeletso ya sepolesa sa polokeho ya setjhaba tsa saps di tla amohela mapolesa a tlatsetso a 4 000 selemong sena sa ditjhelete, mme ho ntse ho etswa ditlhophiso bakeng sa thupello e nepahetseng ya ditho tsa sepolesa.

src: drawing on the lessons of last july’s unrest, we are working to improve cooperation between law enforcement agencies and the private security industry in the fight against crime.
tgt: ha re nka malebela a merusu ya phupu ngwahola, re sebeletsa ho ntlafatsa tshebedisano pakeng tsa makala a qobello ya molao le indasteri ya tshireletso ya poraefete ntweng e kgahlanong le botlokotsebe.

src: we need close coordina tion with all stakeholders, including business, so that resources and crime intelligence are shared to both improve public safety and deal with crimes that disrupt economic activity.
tgt: re hloka kgokahano e matla le bankakarolo kaofela, ho kenyeletsa le dikgwebo, hore mehlodi le mautlwela a botlokotsebe di arolelanwe bakeng sa hore ka bobedi di matlafatse polokeho ya setjhaba le ho sebetsana le ditlolo tsa molao tse sitisang mesebetsi ya moruo.

src: an example is the colla boration between transnet freight rail and the saps to combat infrastructure theft and line sabotage.
tgt: mohlala ke tshebedisano e teng pakeng tsa khamphani ya tshebeletso ya diterene tsa thepa ya transnet le saps bakeng sa ho lwantsha boshodu ba infrastraktjha le sabotasi ya diporo.

src: these crimes seriously affect the economy as companies cannot move their products to the ports for export.
tgt: ditlolo tsena tsa molao di ama moruo haholo kaha dikhamphani ha di kgone ho tsamaisa thepa ya tsona ho leba madibohong bakeng sa ho romelwa ka ntle ho naha.

src: another example of cooperation is between mine security, private security and the saps to fight precious metals theft.
tgt: mohlala o mong wa tshebedisanommoho o pakeng tsa dikhamphani tsa tshireletso ya merafo, dikhamphani tsa tshireletso tsa poraefete le saps bakeng sa ho lwantsha boshodu ba dimetale tsa bohlokwa.

src: as a result of these joint efforts, we are seeing progress in areas like mpumalanga and limpopo that have been flashpoints of instability as stolen metals were moved to illicit markets abroad.
tgt: ka lebaka la mekutu ena e kopanetsweng, re bona kgatelopele dibakeng tse kang mpumalanga le limpopo tseo esale e le dintlhakgolo tsa ho hloka botsitso kaha dimetale tsa boshodu di ne di lebiswa mebarakeng e seng molaong mose.

src: through its national inter vention units, the saps has also been making progress in combating organised crime, including drug syndicates, gangs and illegal mining.
tgt: ka diyuniti tsa yona tsa boitshunyako tsa naha, saps le yona e ne e ntse e na le kgatelopele mabapi le ho thibela botlokotsebe bo hlophisitsweng, ho kenyeletswa maqulwana a dithethefatsi, maqulwana le ho rafa ho seng molaong.

src: the saps is establishing a task team to tackle illegal mining, alongside other task teams dealing with construction site extortion, copper and cable theft, and theft and vandalism of economic infrastructure.
tgt: saps e ntse e theha moifo wa tshebetso wa ho tobana le ho rafa ho seng molaong, hammoho le meifo e meng ya tshebetso e sebetsanang le ho lefisa ka boqhekanyetsi ditsha tsa kaho, boshodu ba koporo le dikheibole, le boshodu le tshenyo ya infrastraktjha ya moruo.

src: besides the successes of effective policing in tackling economic crimes, the hard work of the saps in dealing with broader crime often goes unacknowledged.
tgt: ntle le dikatleho tsa tshebetso e hlwahlwa ya sepolesa mabapi le ho lwantsha ditlolo tsa molao tsa moruo, mosebetsi o boima wa saps mabapi le ho sebetsana le botlokotsebe bo pharalletseng hangata ha o ananelwe.

src: in the last financial year, for example, saps crime investigations secured 206 life sentences against 209 accused, of which 154 were for murder and rape.
tgt: selemong se fetileng sa ditjhelete, ho tea ka mohlala, dipatlisiso tsa botlokotsebe tsa saps di entse hore ho be le dikahlolo tsa ho hlola bophelo bohle tjhankaneng tse 206 kgahlanong le babelaellwa ba 209, moo tse 154 e neng e le tsa polao le peto.

src: the saps family violence, child protection and sexual offences units secured 356 life sentences against 266 accused.
tgt: diyuniti tsa saps tsa dikgo ka tsa malapa, tshireletso ya bana le ditlolo tsa molao tsa thobalano di entse hore ho be le dikahlolo tsa ho hlola bophelo bohle tjhankaneng tse 356 kgahlanong le babelaellwa ba 266. ditshebetso tsa ho ba mohlaleng wa ditlokotsebe di lebisitse tshwarong ya batho ba fetang 13 000. ha re sheba maemo a phahameng a botlokotsebe ka hara setjhaba sa bo rona, ho hlakile hore mosebetsi o sa le mongata.

src: suspect tracing operations resulted in over 13,000 arrests.
tgt: feela dipalo tsena di bontsha hore ditlokotsebe tse ngata di a tshwarwa le ho tjhutjhiswa ka katleho.

src: the directorate for prio rity crime investigation, known as the hawks, achieved all of its targets for the last financial year, resulting in arrests and convictions, asset seizures, restraint and confiscation orders and forfeiture orders to the value of millions of rands.
tgt: tsamaiso ya dipatlisiso tsa botlokotsebe bo ka sehloohong, e tsejwang e le hawks, e fihlelletse merero ya yona yohle bakeng sa selemo se fetileng sa ditjhelete, e leng se bakileng ho tshwarwa le ho kwallwa, kgapo ya thepa, thibelo le kgapo le ditaelo tsa pusetso tse ka fihlang ho dimilione tsa diranta.

src: the arrests and convictions secured by the hawks included for illegal mining, damage to fuel pipelines, cash in transit heists and for police murders.
