tgt: ho tshwarwa le ho kwallwa tse entsweng ke hawks ho kenyeleditse le ho rafa ho seng molaong, tshenyo ya dipeipi tsa peterole, kgothotso ya makoloi a tsamaisang tjhelete le dipolao tsa mapolesa.

src: the hawks have started work with the npa investigating directorate on cases emanating from the state capture commission.
tgt: hawks di se di qadile ho sebetsa le tsamaiso ya dipatlisiso ya npa mabapi le dinyewe tse tswetsweng ke khomishene ya dipatlisiso tsa dipelaelo tsa melato ya ho hula mmuso ka nko.

src: the saps has been sup porting the fight against genderbased violence, establishing more victimfriendly rooms at police stations and procuring nearly half a million evidence collection kits to be distributed to stations.
tgt: saps e tshehetsa ntwa kgahlanong le dikgoka tsa bong, e theha diphaposi tse mofuthu bakeng sa mahlatsipa diteisheneng tsa sepolesa le ho etsa dithendara tsa ho reka thepa ho thusa ho bokella bopaki e ka fihlang ho halofo ya milione e tla fepelwa ditei shene tsa sepolesa.

src: policing cannot be suc cessful without the cooperation of communities.
tgt: sepolesa se keke sa atleha ntle le tshebedisanommoho ya badudi.

src: for this reason, we are focusing on expanding the network of community policing forums to improve both policing and community relations.
tgt: ka lebaka lena, re tsepamisitse maikutlo tabeng ya ho eketsa marangrang a diforamo tsa badudi tse thusanang le sepolesa bakeng sa ho ntlafatsa ka bobedi tshebeletso ya sepolesa le dikamano le badudi.

src: we commend the com munities that are taking responsibility for keeping their areas safe through street patrols, crime awareness campaigns and other activities.
tgt: re thoholetsa badudi ba nkang boikarabelo ba ho etsa dibaka tseo ba dulang ho tsona ho ba tse bolokehileng ka ho paterola diterateng, ka ho etsa matsholo a tlhokomediso ka botlokotsebe le ka ho etsa mesebetsi e meng.

src: using the report of the expert panel as a basis for organisational reform, we are reorganising and reprioritising resources, improving capacity and strengthening law enforcement capacity across the board.
tgt: ka ho sebedisa tlaleho ya phanele ya ditsebi jwalo ka motheo wa ho hlabolla sepolesa, re hlophisa botjha le ho beha botjha ka sehlohlolong mehlodi, ho ntlafatsa bokgoni le ho matlafatsa bokgoni ba qobello ya molao ka bophara.

src: being a policeman or policewoman must be one of the most difficult, pressured and dangerous jobs in our country, and often a thankless task.
tgt: ho ba lepolesa la monna kapa la mosadi ke o mong wa mesebetsi e thata, e nang le kgatello le ho ba kotsi ka ho fetisisa naheng ya bo rona, mme hangata ke mosebetsi o sa lebohuweng.

src: while public frustration with crime is understandable, it is unfortunate that this should give rise to hostility towards our police, who continue to serve and protect.
tgt: ha ho nyahama ha setjhaba mabapi le botlokotsebe ho utlwahala, ke bomadimabe hore sena se jala bora kgahlanong le sepolesa sa bo rona, se tswellang ho sebeletsa setjhaba le ho se sireletsa.

src: new approach to fight corruption gets results vukuzenzele unnamed the fight against corruption requires both firm political will and independent, capable crimefighting institutions.
tgt: mokgwa o motjha wa ho lwantsha bobodu o kgola ditholwana vukuzenzele unnamed ntwa e kgahlano le bobodu e hloka boikemisetso botiileng ba sepolotiki le ditheo tse ikemetseng, tsenang le bokgoni ba ho lwantsha ditlolo tsa molao.

src: in my first state of the nation address, in 2018, i made a commitment to turn the tide against corruption in our public institutions and fight fraud and collusion in the private sector with the same intensity and purpose.
tgt: puong ya ka ya pele ya pulo ya naha, ka 2018, ke ile ka itlama ka ho fetola mawa kgahlanong le bobodu ditheong tsa rona tsa setjhaba le ho lwantsha boqhekanyetsi le bohanyapetsi makaleng a poraefete ka sepheo le morero o tshwanang.

src: since then, we have been working hard to strengthen and support our law enforcement and related agencies.
tgt: ho tloha ka nako eo, esale re sebetsa ka thata ho matlafatsa le ho tshehetsa lekala la phethahatso ya molao la rona le dikemedi tse amehang.

src: we set up the investigating directorate in the national prosecuting authority to deal with serious corruption and the special tribunal to enable the special investigating unit (siu) to more easily recover stolen funds.
tgt: re thehile botsamaisi ba dipatli siso ka hara botjhotjhisi ba naha ho shebana le bobodu bo tebileng le lekgotla le ikgethileng la dipatlisiso ho thusa hore ho be bonolo hore yuniti e ikgethileng ya dipatlisiso ya naha (siu) e busetse ditjhelete tse utswitsweng.

src: we have also provided support and resources to other critical crimefighting bodies like the asset forfeiture unit, specialised commercial crimes unit and directorate for priority crime investigation, known as the hawks.
tgt: re ile ra boela re fana ka tshehetso le mehlodi ho ditheo tse ding tse hlokolotse tsa twantsho ya botlokotsebe tse kang yuniti ya ho nka thepa, yuniti e ikgethileng ya ditlolo tsa molao tsa dikgwebo le botsamaisi ba dipatlisiso tsa botloko tsebe bo ka sehlohlolong, bo tsebahalang e le dihawks.

src: these efforts are producing results.
tgt: matsapa ana a kgola ditholwana.

src: through collaboration with key entities in the criminal justice system, the investigating directorate has enrolled over 20 corruption cases in the last financial year and 65 accused have been charged.
tgt: ka tshebedisanommoho le dienthithi tse bohlokwa tsa tsamaisong ya toka e kgahlano le botlokotsebe, botsamaisi ba dipatlisiso bo ngodisitse dinyewe tsefetang 20 tsa bobodu selemong se fetileng sa ditjhelete mme batlodi ba molao ba 65 ba qositswe.

src: these include several ‘state capture’ and other serious corruption cases.
tgt: dinyewe tsena di kenye letsa dinyewe tse mmalwa tsa ‘ho hula mmuso ka nko’ le tsa bobodu bo tebileng.

src: in the past financial year, the asset forfeiture unit obtained freezing orders to the value of r5.4 billion relating to corruption offences, with r70 million paid into the criminal assets recovery fund.
tgt: selemong se fetileng sa ditjhelete, yuniti ya ho nka thepa e ile ya fumana ditaelo tsa ho kgina dithoto tsa boleng ba r5.4 bilione tse amanang le melato ya bobodu, mme r70 milione e lefetswe ho letlole la pusetso ya thepa ya botlokotsebe.

src: over the past eight years, the siu has recovered funds and assets to the value of r2.6 billion and set aside contracts to the value of r18 billion.
tgt: dilemong tse robedi tse fetileng, siu e buseditse matlole le dithepa tsa boleng ba r2.6 bilione mme ya behella ka thoko dikontraka tsa boleng ba r18 bilione.

src: a total of 119 cases worth more than r13 billion have been enrolled by the siu at the special tribunal.
tgt: ka kakaretso dinyewe tse 119 tsa boleng bofetang r13 bilione di ngodisitswe ke siu ho lekgotla le ikgethileng la dinyewe.

src: corruption is an extremely complex crime to prosecute.
tgt: bobodu ke tlolo ya molao e rarahaneng haholo ho qoswa.

src: perpetrators go to extraordinary lengths to cover their tracks.
tgt: batlodi ba molao ba etsa ka bohohlehohle ho pata mehlala ya bona.

src: they set up shelf companies to hide dodgy transactions, rapidly moving monies between multiple accounts, misrepresenting income to the tax authorities, and, in the case of government employees, using friends and relatives to apply for tenders to mask their involvement.
tgt: ba thehile dikhamphani tse sa sebetseng ho pata ditshebetsano tse mpe, ditjhelete tse tsamaiswang ka potlako dipakeng tsa diakhaonto tse ngata, ho hlahisa lekeno le fosa hetseng ho balaodi ba lekgetho, mme ntlheng ya basebetsi ba mmuso, ho sebedisa metswale le beng ka bona ho kenya dikopo tsa dithendara ho pata ho nkakarolo ha bona.

src: this means that the response of the authorities has to be just as sophisticated.
tgt: sena se bolela hore tsela eo bolaodi bo tla arabelang ditlo tsena tsa molao e tlameha ho ba e maemong a phahameng le yona.

src: in 2020, we established a multidisciplinary fusion centre as an operational hub to address priority financial crimes, including corruption.
tgt: ka 2020, re thehile setsi sa tshebetsommoho se nang le mekgwa e menga ta ya tshebetso e le setsi sa tshebetso le ho shebana le ditlolo tsa molao tsa ditjhe lete tse ka sehlohlolong, ho kenyeletsa bobodu.

src: the centre brings together the investigative capabilities of government’s crime prevention and security structures and those of the financial intelligence centre, which develops intelligence for law enforcement agencies to use in their investigations.
tgt: setsi sena se kopanya bokgoni ba mmuso ba ho etsa dipatlisiso tsa ho thibela botlokotsebe le makala a tshireletso le tsa setsi sa mautlwela a ditjhelete, se hlahisang boutlwela ba dikemedi tsa phethahatso ya molao ho bo sebedisa patlisisong tsa tsona.

src: two years since the fusion centre was established, its multidisciplinary approach to ‘follow the money’ has yielded significant results.
tgt: dilemong tse pedi esale setsi sa tshebetsommoho se thehilwe, mokgwa wa sona wa mekgwa e me ngata ya tshebetso wa ‘ho latela tjhelete’ o fihleletse diphetho tse kgolo.

src: in the last financial year, the work of the fusion centre supported 276 fraud and corruption investigations.
tgt: selemong se fetileng sa ditjhelete, mosebetsi wa setsi sa tshebetsommoho o ile wa tshehetsa dipa tlisiso tse 276 tsa bobodu.

src: approximately r659 million was restored to the state through preservation and recovery of the proceeds of crime.
tgt: tjhelete e ka bang r659 milione e ile ya busetswa mmusong ka mokgwa wa ho baballa le pusetso ya merokotso ya botlokotsebe.

src: approximately r613 million in suspected criminal proceeds were frozen.
tgt: tjhelete e ka bang r613 milione ya merokotso e belaelwang e le ya botlokotsebe e ile ya kginwa.

src: the fusion centre was initially set up to investigate corruption around covidrelated procurement.
tgt: setsi sa tshebetsommo ho qalonong se ne se the hetswe ho etsa dipatlisiso tsa bobodu bo mabapi le ditheko le dithendara tse amanang le covid .

src: its mandate is now being expanded to include moneylaundering, fraud, maladministration, terrorist financing and other serious financial crimes.
tgt: thomo ya sona ha jwale e ntse e atoloswa ho kenye lletsa tshebediso tse she bana le ho pata mehlodi ya tjhelete, boqhekanyetsi, tsamaiso e mpe, matlole a boferekanyi le ditlolo tsa molao tse ding tse tebileng tsa ditjhelete.

src: the hawks recently outlined some of the progress that has been made by the anticorruption task team, of which the fusion centre forms part.
tgt: haufinyane tjena, dihawks di hlalositse tse ding tsa kgatelopele tse entsweng ke sehlopha sa tshebetso sa twantsho ya bobodu, seo setsi sa tshebetsommoho e leng karolo ya sona.

src: between the 2019 and 2022 financial years, 554 suspects were arrested for corruption, of which 142 were convicted.
tgt: dipakeng tsa dilemo tsa ditjhelete tsa 2019 le 2022, babelaellwa ba 554 ba ile ba tshwarwa mabapi le bobodu, mme ba 142 ho bona ba ile ba fumanwa ba le molato.

src: another vital financial intelligence tool is the lifestyle audits conducted by the south african revenue service (sars).
tgt: sesebediswa se seng sa bohlokwa sa boutlwela ba ditjhelete ke tlhatlhobo ya mekgwa ya ho phela e entsweng ke ditshebeletso tsa lekgetho tsa afrika borwa (sars).

src: last year, sars completed 25 lifestyle audits to the value of over r450 million to resolve discrepancies between declared income and an individual’s lifestyle.
tgt: selemong se fetileng, sars e phe thetse ditlhatlhobo tse 25 tsa mekgwa ya ho phela ya boleng bofetang r450 milione ho rarolla diphapano dipakeng tsa lekeno le phatlaladitsweng le mokgwa wa motho wa ho phela.

src: it is clear that the measures we have taken as this administration to restore the capacity, capability and credibility of the institutions involved in the fight against corruption are having a demonstrable impact.
tgt: ho hlakile hore mehato eo re e nkileng jwalo ka mmuso ho busetsa bokgoni, boitsebelo le botshepehi ba ditheo tse amehang twantshong ya bobodu e na le kgahlamelo e bonahalang.

src: the synchronised work of all the law enforcement agencies is hitting criminals where it hurts most: in their pockets.
tgt: mosebetsi wa kopanelo wa dikemedi tsohle tse phethatsang molao o otla dinokwane moo ho utlwisang bohloko ka ho fetisisa: dipokothong tsa bona.

src: public funds that were looted and diverted are being recovered and those responsible for these acts are being prosecuted by our courts.
tgt: matlole a setjhaba a ileng a tlatlapuwa le ho kgeloswa a ntse a busetswa mme ba ikara bellang diketsong tsena ba ntse ba qoswa ke makgotla a dinyewe.

src: look out for early signs of childhood cancer more matshediso a lack of awareness of childhood cancer and its symptoms means that many south african children are diagnosed when the disease is at an advanced stage.
tgt: ela hloko matshwao a pele a kankere ya bongwaneng more matshediso ho hloka tlhokome diso ka kankere ya bongwaneng le matshwao a yona ho bolela hore bana ba bangata ba afrika borwa ba fumanwa ba ena le tshwaetso ha lefu lena le se le le boemong bo mpefetseng.

src: the earlier cancer is diagnosed and treated, the higher the chance of a full recovery.
tgt: ho fumanwa le ho phe kolwa ha kankere esale ka nako, ho eketsa menyetla ya ho fola ka botlalo.

src: childhood cancer foundation south africa (choc) communication coordinator taryn seegers says by knowing the common signs of cancer in young people, you could help save a life.
tgt: mohokanyi wa dipuisano wa mokgatlo wa kankere ya bana wa afrika borwa (choc), taryn seegers, o re ka ho tseba matshwao a tlwaelehileng a kankere batjheng, o ka thusa ho pholosa bophelo ba bona.

src: "the signs and symptoms can be difficult to spot amid the normal bumps, bruises, growth spurts and mood swings.
tgt: "matshwao a ka ba thata ho a bona hobane ho tlwaelehile hore bana ba hlahe maqhutsu, matetetso, kgolo e mahla hahlaha ya mmeleng, le phetophetoho ya maikutlo.

src: however, early detection is key," she says.
tgt: le ha ho le jwalo, ho e lemoha esale ka nako ho bohlokwahlokwa," o riaolo.

src: according to the cancer association of south africa (cansa), between 800 to 1 000 south african children are diagnosed with cancer each year.
tgt: ho ya ka mokgatlo wa kankere wa afrika borwa (cansa), bana ba maa frika borwa ba pakeng tsa 800 ho isa ho 1 000 ba fumanwa ba ena le ka nkere selemo le selemo.

src: however, the association estimates that half of the children with cancer in south africa are never diagnosed.
tgt: le ha ho le jwalo, mokga tlo o lekanya hore halofo ya bana ba nang le kankere afrika borwa ha etswe diteko tsa tlhatlhojo ho hang.

src: to help ensure cancer is spotted as soon as possible, choc runs awareness programmes in communities, telling parents and children about the early warning signs they must look out for.
tgt: ho thusa ho etsa bo nnete ba hore kankere e bonwa ka pele kamoo ho ka kgonehang ka teng, choc e etsa mananeo a tlhokomediso metseng, a rutang batswadi le bana ka matshwao a pele ao ba lokelang ho a ela hloko.

src: the foundation supports children and teenagers with cancer or lifethreatening blood disorders and their families.
tgt: mokgatlo o tshehetsa bana le batjha ba nang le kankere kapa mafu a madi a kotsikotsi le ba malapa a bona.

src: "we aim to improve early detection and facilitate effective treatment.
tgt: "re ikemiseditse ho ntlafatsa ho e lemoha esale ka nako le ho nolo fatsa phepelo ya kalafo e sebetsang.

src: at any one time, choc can have over 1 500 children and teenagers in its care, while offering psychosocial support to over 1 500 families," says seegers.
tgt: ka nako efe kapa efe, choc e ka ba le bana le batjha ba fetang 1 500 tlhokomelong ya yona, e ntse e boela e fana ka tshehetso ya maikutlo le kelello ho malapa a fetang 1 500," ho rialo seegers.

src: in the past financial year, seegers says choc was able to serve 1 724 children, 553 teenagers and 2 232 adults through its core programmes.
tgt: selemong se fetileng sa ditjhelete, seegers o re choc e kgonne ho thusa bana ba 1 724, batjha ba 553 le batho ba baholo ba 2 232 ka mananeo a yona a mantlha.

src: "our services include emotional support through their cancer journey, comfort, endoflife care and bereavement support," says seegers.
tgt: "ditshebeletso tsa rona di kenyeletsa tshehetso ya maikutlo ha ba ntse ba ena le kankere, ho ba kgothatsa, le ho ba hloko mela ha ntswe ba lwanela ho phela le ho tshehetsa ka tsa poloko bao ba hloka halletsweng," ho rialo seegers.

src: st siluan’s signs of childhood cancer s – seek medical help early for ongoing symptoms.
tgt: matshwao a ree letsweng ka st siluan a kankere ya bongwaneng s – batla thuso ya dingaka esale ka nako bakeng sa matshwao a sa iphodising.

src: i – white spot in the eye, new squint, sudden blindness or bulging eyeball.
tgt: i – letheba le lesweu ka leihlong, ho qepha ho hotjha, ho foufala ho sa tsejweng hore ho hlaha kae kapa thaka ya leihlo e ruruhang.

src: the n3 upgrade is empowering south africans owen mngadi mduduzi jijana is the owner of the disability empowerment movement, which is one of the companies that is currently benefiting from the r26 billion upgrade of the n3 highway between pietermaritzburg and durban in kwazulunatal.
tgt: ntlafatso ena ya n3 e matlafatsa maafrika borwa owen mngadi mduduzi jijana ke monga disability empowerment movement, eo e leng e nngwe ya dikhampani tseo ha jwale di fumanang molemo ntlafatsong ya dibilione tse 26 tsa diranta ya mmila o moholo wa n3 o pakeng tsa pietremaritzburg le durban provinseng ya kwazulunatal.

src: the project, which is being spearheaded by the south african national roads agency soc limited (sanral), is ensuring that entrepreneurs such as jijana not only benefit but in turn create employment for others.
tgt: projekte ena, e thakgolwang ke lekala la naha la mebila la afrika borwa (sanral), e netefatsa hore borakgwebo ba kang jijana ha ba fumane feela molemo, empa, ka nqa e nngwe, ba theha mesebetsi bakeng la ba bang.

src: jijana, who lives with a disability, says his company installs road signs between hilton and pietermaritzburg.
tgt: jijana, ya nang le bokowa, o re khamphani ya hae e hloma matshwao a mmila ho tloha hilton ho ya fihla pietermaritzburg.

src: he employs 13 people and says the project has changed their lives.
tgt: o hira batho ba 13, mme o re projekte ena e tlisitse phetoho maphelong a bona.

src: "as people living with a disability, we have shown that we are capable.
tgt: "jwalo ka batho ba nang le bokowa, re bontshitse hore re na le bokgo ni.

src: we no longer rely on grants.
tgt: ha re sa phela feela ka ho amohela diphallelo.

src: we do the actual work," says jijana.
tgt: re etsa mosebetsi ka sebele," o rialo jijana.

src: sanral n3 programme manager tsepo matekane says his company ensured that 30% of the work was assigned to local companies with the ability to provide various services.
tgt: molaodi wa lenaneo la sanral la n3, tsepo matekane, o re khamphani ya hae e entse bo nnete ba hore 30% ya mosebetsi e nehwa dikhamphani tsa sebaka seo tse nang le bokgoni ba ho fana ka ditshebeletso tse fapafapaneng.

src: this created many opportunities for small businesses owned by youth, previously disadvantaged people and women.
tgt: ketso ena e hlahisitse menyetla e mengata bakeng la dikgwebo tse nyenyane tsa batjha, tsa batho ba neng ba beheletswe ka thoko le basadi.

src: "there are 108 small, medium and micro enterprises currently working on the various projects," he says.
tgt: "ho na le dikgwebo tse 108 tse nyenyane, tse bohareng le tse nyenyane haholo tseo ha jwale di sebetsang diprojekteng tse fapafapaneng," o itsatso.

src: nokuthula zondi of ingqalabutho yamalinda multipurpose trading was awarded a contract to supply soil and install water drainage pipes.
tgt: nokuthula zondi wa ingqalabutho yamalinda multipurpose trading o ile a fumantshwa konteraka ya phepelo ya mobu le ho kenngwa ha diphaephe tsa phalliso ya metsi.

src: she says her company employed eight skilled workers, including drivers.
tgt: o re khamphani ya hae e hirile batho ba robedi ba nang le boitsebelo, ho kenyeletswa le bakganni.

src: zondi adds that women are as capable as men and her company has a good service track record.
tgt: zondi o boetse a re basadi le bona ba na le bokgoni jwalo ka banna, le hore kha mphani ya hae e na le setumo se setle phanong e ntle ya ditshebeletso.

src: "we understand the importance of time and meet all our targets to ensure the project runs accordingly.
tgt: "re utlwisisa hantle bohlokwa ba nako, mme re fihllella dipakana tsa rona ho netefatsa hore projekte e sebetsa ka tshwanelo.

src: we appreciate the opportunity and we hope more will come so that our company can grow according to construction levels," she adds.
tgt: re mo tlotlo ka monyetla ona, mme re tshepa hore re tla fumana menyetla e mengata ho feta, e le hore khamphani ya rona e tle e hole ho latela maemo a kaho," o boetse a rialo.

src: national government’s key projects matekane says the durbanfree stategauteng logistics and industrial corridor development has an estimated budget of r26 billion and is one of national government’s key strategic integrated projects.
tgt: ana ke maikutlo a motlatsi wa letona la ntshetsopele ya setjhaba, hendrietta bogopanezulu, ya sa tswa thakgola lenaneo la bobuelli le bitswang 999 la bohloko bo pharale tseng ba aklhohole maseeng a inngweng (fasd).

src: the affected section of the n3 has over the years experienced traffic congestion, particularly during peak hours because the majority of cargo trucks from the durban harbour use the highway to gauteng and other inland provinces.
tgt: kotsi e hlaiswang ke fasd e ama maphelo a bana ho ya ho ile, mme ha e na pheko, mme bana ba tswalwang le boemo bona ba ba le mathata a mmele le a kelello," o itsatso motlatsi wa letona bogopanezulu nakong ya thakgolo.

src: alcohol may damage your unborn baby’s health vukuzenzele unnamed pregnant women have the responsibility to not drink because alcohol can cause a condition that affects a baby’s development.
tgt: alkhohole e ka senya bophelo ba lesea la hao le inngweng vukuzenzele unnamed basadi ba baimana ba na le boikarabelo ba ho se nwe hobane alkhohole e ka etsa maemo a amang hampe popeho ya lesea.

src: this is according to the deputy minister of social development, hendrietta bogopanezulu, who recently launched the 999 foetal alcohol spectrum disorder (fasd) advocacy programme.
tgt: ana ke maikutlo a motlatsi wa letona la ntshetsopele ya setjhaba, hendrietta bogopanezulu, ya sa tswa thakgola lenaneo la bobuelli le bitswang 999 la bohloko bo pharale tseng ba aklhohole maseeng a inngweng (fasd).

src: the aim of the initiative is to encourage communities to help protect unborn babies by educating people, especially women of childbearing age, about the dangers of drinking alcohol while pregnant or breastfeeding.
tgt: sepheo sa morero ona ke ho kgothaletsa setjhaba sohle ho thusa ho tshireletsa masea a inngweng ka ho ruta batho, haholoholo basadi ba dilemong tsa ho beleha, malebana le kotsi ya ho nwa alkhohole nakong eo ba ithwetseng kapa ba nyantshang.

src: "it is important for all women who are pregnant and those who wish to give birth to healthy babies to avoid alcohol.
tgt: "ke taba ya bohlokwa ya hore basadi bohle ba immeng le bao ba lakatsang ho beleha masea a phetseng hantle ba qobe tshebediso ya alkhohole.

src: the damage caused by fasd is permanent and irreversible, and children born with this condition have physical and intellectual problems," said deputy minister bogopanezulu at the launch.
tgt: kotsi e hlaiswang ke fasd e ama maphelo a bana ho ya ho ile, mme ha e na pheko, mme bana ba tswalwang le boemo bona ba ba le mathata a mmele le a kelello," o itsatso motlatsi wa letona bogopanezulu nakong ya thakgolo.

src: she added that south africa is known to have a drinking problem, with the country ranking among the worst in the world for its levels of alcohol consumption.
tgt: o boetse a re afrika borwa e tumme hampe ka ho ba le bothata ba ho nowa ha alkhohole, moo naha ena e balellwang le tse mpe ka ho fetisisa lefatsheng ka lebaka la maemo a yona a ho nowa ha alkhohole.

src: deputy minister bogopanezulu recently visited different parts of the country, educating women about the dangers of drinking alcohol while pregnant as part of the 999 fasd campaign.
tgt: motlatsi wa letona bogo panezulu o sa tswa etela dikarolo tse fapaneng tsa naha, a ruta basadi ka mathata a ba kwang ke ho nowa ha alkhohole nakong ya boimana e le karolo ya letsholo la 999 la fasd.

src: when she was in boitekong in rustenburg in the north west, she told residents that the levels of alcohol abuse in the township are alarming.
tgt: ha a ne a le boitekong, motse ng wa rustenburg, leboya bophirima, o boleletse baahi hore maemo a tshebedisompe ya alkhohole lokeisheneng leo bo a tshosa.

src: a fourmonth pregnant woman and resident of boitekong, basetsana tlalang (28), who attended one of the campaigns, said she stopped drinking alcohol entirely after learning she was pregnant and said she is attending antenatal and information sessions at the clinic.
tgt: mosadi ya nang le dikgwe di tse nne a imme eo e leng moahi wa boitekong, basetsana tlalang (ya dilemo di 28), ya ileng a ba teng ho le leng la matsholo ana, o itse o ile a tlohela ho nwa alkhohole ho hang ka mora ho iphumana a imme, a ba a bolela hore o ba teng dithutong tse hlophiseditsweng baimana le tsa tlhahisoleseding tliliniking.

src: she urged other pregnant women to immediately stop drinking alcohol and doing drugs.
tgt: o kgothaleditse basadi ba bang ba immeng hore ba tlohele ho nwa alkhohole hanghang, esita le ho sebedisa dithethefatsi.

src: the struggle to give south africa a more human face vukuzenzele unnamed on 12 september 1977, stephen bantu biko died in police custody in pretoria central prison.
tgt: boitseko ba ho bopa afrika borwa e hlomphang haholo ditokelo tsa botho vukuzenzele unnamed ka letsatsi la 12 loetse 1977, stephen bantu biko o ile a shwela ditlamong tsa sepolesa tjhankaneng e bohareng ya pretoria.

src: human dignity, the principle at the heart of his black consciousness activism, was denied to him.
tgt: seriti sa botho, e leng motheo o kgubung ya boitseko ba hae ba ho ikelellwa ha batho ba batsho, ke seo a ileng a swetswa ka sona.

src: in the words of the family lawyer sir sydney kentridge, his was "a miserable and lonely death on a mat on a stone floor in a prison cell".
tgt: ka mantswe a ramolao wa lelapa sir sydney kentridge, e bile "lefu la mahlomola, hape le bodutu − hodima phate e adilweng hodima lejwe ka hara sele ya tjhankana".

src: it remains a source of great sorrow all these years later to recall that steve biko was just 30 years old when he died.
tgt: le hona jwale e ntse e le ntho e utlwisang bohloko haholo taba ya ho hopola hore steve biko o ne a ena le dilemo tse 30 feela ha a eshwa.

src: he was cut down in his prime by those who feared the power and resonance of his ideas of selfliberation and his efforts to infuse black men and women with pride and dignity.
tgt: o ile a bolawa a sa le motjha tjha ke bao ba ileng ba tshoswa ke matla le kamohelo ya molaetsa wa maikutlo a hae a boitokollo esita le matsapa a hae a ho kenya boikgantsho le seriti ho banna le basadi ba batsho.

src: he never got to see in his lifetime what he called ‘the glittering prize’, the realisation of a true humanity.
tgt: nakong ya bophelo ba hae, ha a ka a ba le hona ho bona seo a neng a se bitsa ‘kgau ya mabenyane’, e leng ho fihlelleha ha setjhaba sa sebele.

src: writing about this ideal, he famously said: "in time we shall be in a position to bestow upon south africa the greatest gift possible – a more human face.
tgt: ha a ngola ka maikemisetso ana, o hopoleha a ne a ye a re: "qetellong re tla ba boemong ba ho rwesa afrika borwa tlokola e kgolo ka ho fetisisa – tshobotsi e matla ya botho.

src: "when we won our freedom in 1994, we understood that the right to vote was just one part of our struggle for human dignity.
tgt: "nakong eo re fumanang tokoloho ya rona ka selemo sa 1994, re ile ra utlwisisa hore tokelo ya ho vouta e mpa e le karolo feela ya boitseko ba rona ba seriti sa botho.

src: twentyeight years into our democracy, we are confronted with many challenges, such as poverty, unemployment and inequality.
tgt: nakong ya dilemo tse mashome a mabedi a metso e robedi a demokrasi ya rona, re tjametswe ke diphephetso tse ngata, tse kang bofutsana, tlhokeho ya mesebetsi le ho se lekalekane.

src: as a result, we often lose sight of how far we have come in giving effect to the principles on which our constitution is founded and that anchored steve biko’s thought and teachings.
tgt: ka lebaka lena, ka dinako tse ding re ye re timellwe ke ho ananela hore na re se re kgathile tema e kae ho phediseng metheo eo molao wa rona wa motheo o theilweng hodima yona hape e le eo mohopolo le dithuto tsa steve biko di tsepameng ho yona.

src: in 1977 a heartless regime killed one of our country’s most promising leaders by depriving him of the food, water and medical treatment he urgently needed as a result of brutal beatings by the apartheid police.
tgt: ka selemo sa 1977, mmuso o kgopo o ile wa bolaya e mong wa baetapele ba hlwahlwa ba naha ya rona ka ho mo tima dijo, metsi le meriana eo a neng a e hloka ka ho fetisisa ka lebaka la ho tetekwa ho soto ke sepolesa sa puso ya kgenthollo.

src: twenty years later, in a 1997 judgment, the constitutional court said that fulfilling the fundamental rights of every citizen and striving to achieve their socioeconomic rights is the hallmark of a democratic society aiming to salvage lost dignity.
tgt: ka mora dilemo tse mashome a mabedi, nakong ya kahlolo e dihilweng ka 1997, lekgotla la molao wa motheo le ile la re ho phethwa ha ditokelo tsa mantlha tsa moahi e mong le e mong, le ho ikitlaeletsa hore a fumane ditokelo tsa hae tsa boiphediso ke letshwao la bohlokwa la setjhaba sa demokrasi se batlang ho lopolla seriti se ileng sa lahleha.

src: in south africa today, we continue to work to fulfil the basic rights of every south african so that they may lead quality lives free of disease, hunger and deprivation.
tgt: naheng ya afrika borwa kajeno, re ntse re tswela pele ho sebeletsa hore ho phethahatswe ditokelo tsa mantlha tsa moafrika borwa e mong le e mong e le hore a tle a phele bophelo ba boleng bo hlokang mafu, tlala le tshotleho.

src: successive democratic administrations have implemented policies to salvage the lost dignity of this country’s majority by providing education, health care, housing and basic services.
tgt: mebuso ya demokrasi ka ho hlahlamana e nnile ya ntshetsa pele maano a ho lopolla seriti sena se ileng sa lahleha sa batho bao e leng bona ba bangata ka ho fetisisa ba naha ena ka ho ba fumantsha thuto, tlhokomelo ya bophelo, matlo a bodulo le ditshebeletso tsa motheo.

src: in south africa today, a decent education is a fundamental right.
tgt: ka hara afrika borwa kajeno, thuto e nang le boleng ke tokelo ya mantlha.

src: the state invests in early childhood development, in supporting learning outcomes for our youngest citizens, and provides social relief through school feeding programmes to ensure young learners achieve the best outcomes possible.
tgt: mmuso o etsa matsete dithutong tsa dikolo tsa bana ba dikonyana, ka ho tshehetsa diphetho tsa thuto bakeng la baahi ba rona ba banyenyane ka ho fetisisa, moo o fanang ka diphallelo tsa kimollo ya setjhaba ka mokgwa wa mananeo a phepo dikololng ho netefatsa hore baithuti ba banyenyane ba fumana diphetho tse ntle ka ho fetisisa, ka moo ho ka kgonehang.

src: through the national student financial aid scheme and various other forms of state support, thousands of young south africans from poor backgrounds have been able to become doctors, lawyers, teachers, scientists, artisans and entrepreneurs.
tgt: ka morero wa naha wa thuso ya ditjhelete tsa ho ya sekolong wa baithuti le ka mekgwa e meng ya tshehetso ya mmuso, diketekete tsa maafrika borwa a manyeyane ho tswa malapeng a futsanehileng di nnile tsa kgona ho ba dingaka, boramolao, dititjhere, borasaene, ditsebi tsa mesebetsi ya matsoho le borakgwebo.

src: government supports poor and vulnerable citizens through an extensive social safety net and provides work opportunities through mass public employment programmes.
tgt: mmuso o tshehetsa baahi ba futsanehileng le ba fokolang ka morero o matla wa polokeho ya setjhaba mme o fana ka menyetla ya mosebetsi ka mananeo a phumantsho ya mesebetsi ya setjhaba.

src: in the repressive south africa in which steve biko died, freedom of speech was curtailed and political activism attracted detention or worse.
tgt: nakong ya afrika borwa ya kgatello eo steve biko a ileng a phela ho yona, bolokolohi ba puo bo ne bo kginnwe mme boitseko ba sepolotiki bo ne bo kgahlametswa ka hore motho a kwallwe tjhankaneng kapa ka ketso e bohloko ho feta ena.

src: in south africa today, young people of the same age as steve biko was and even younger are at the forefront of activism for causes closest to them, and they are able to organise free of harassment or banishment.
tgt: ka hara afrika borwa kajeno, batho ba batjha ba dilemo di lekanang le tsa steve biko kapa tse ka tlaase, ba moleng o ka pele wa boitseko malebana le dintho tse ba amang, mme ba kgona ho itlhopha kantle ho tlhekefetso kapa ho lelekwa.

src: freedom of speech and association, the right to protest and the right to equality before the law is upheld for all.
tgt: bolokolohi ba puo le ba ho ikamahanya, tokelo ya ho hwanta le tokelo ya tekatekano ka pele ho molao e fumantshwa batho bohle.

src: as a country, we have come a long way towards the fulfilment of human dignity, the principle that steve biko so cherished.
tgt: re le naha, re se re kgathile tema e kgolo malebana le ho baballwa ha seriti sa botho, e leng motheo oo steve biko a o babaletseng.

src: yet, we still have so much further to go.
tgt: le ha ho le jwalo, re sa ntse re na le tema e kgolo e re emetseng.

src: without a job, without a house, electricity or running water, without land, without skills or opportunities, millions of south africans are still deprived of the lives they seek and deserve.
tgt: kantle ho mosebetsi, kantle ho ntlo, motlakase kapa metsi a phallang, kantle ho mobu, kantle ho bokgoni ba ho etsa mosebetsi kapa menyetla ya ho fumana mosebetsi, dimilione tsa maafrika borwa di ntse di haellwa ke maphelo ao di a batlang le ao e leng tokelo ya tsona ho ba le ona.

src: that is why government is working with social partners to build an inclusive economy, create employment, enable businesses to thrive and tackle poverty and hunger.
tgt: ke ka hona mmuso o sebetsang mmoho le balekane ba setjhaba ho aha moruo o kenyeletsang bohle, ho theha mesebetsi, ho thusa dikgwebo ho tswela pele le ho lwantsha bofuma le tlala.

src: no quick fix for load shedding but real progress is being made vukuzenzele unnamed for every person living in this country, the past weeks of load shedding have been extremely frustrating and challenging.
tgt: ha re na tsela e potlakang ya mathata a ho tingwa ha motlakase ka sepheo sa ho o baballa, leha ho le jwalo, ho na le tema e seng e kgathilwe vukuzenzele unnamed motho ohle ya dulang naheng ena o ne a ferekane ke taba ya ho tingwa ha motlakase ka sepheo sa ho o baballa dibe keng tse pedi tse fetileng.

src: the widespread public anger is wholly justified.
tgt: mabaka a a utlwahala a etsang hore setjhaba se fele pelo.

src: with eskom forced to once more implement load shedding to protect the national grid, individuals, households and businesses have had to contend with power interruptions for up to four hours at a time.
tgt: dikgwebo le malapa a ile a timelwa motlakase nako e ka finyellang dihoreng tse nne ka bonako jwalo ka ha eskom e ile ya tlameha ho thakgola lenaneo la ho tingwa hona ha motlakase ka sepheo sa o ho baballa ka lebaka la mathata a yona a ho fehla motlakase.

src: it has dire consequences for nearly every part of our society from education to public safety to the provision of health services.
tgt: maemo ana a phatsamisa setjhaba ka kakaretso ho tloha ho tsa thuto, tshireletso ya setjhaba ho isa ho tsa bophelo bo botle.

src: large and small businesses alike are losing money and the energy crisis is endangering investment and our economic recovery.
tgt: dikgwebo tse kgolo le tse nyane, kaofela ha tsona di lahlehelwa ke phaello mme mathata a motlakase a na le kgahlamelo e mpe kahong botjha ya moruo wa rona.

src: there is a sense of despair that the situation does not seem to be improving and that there appears to be no end in sight to this crisis.
tgt: batho ba lahlile tshepo hore dintho di ka fetoha, mme ha ba bone mathata ana a tla phakisa ho fela.

src: yet, even in the darkness of load shedding there is and must be an end in sight to our electricity crisis.
tgt: leha mathata ana a ho tingwa ha motlakase a ntse a tswela pele, empa re tla meha ho ba le mokgwa wa ho rarolla mathat ana a motlakase.

src: we are making progress in the implementation of the additional actions i announced in july, even though the effects may not be immediately felt.
tgt: ho teng kgatelopele e bonahalang ho kengweng tshebetsong ha mehato eo ke neng ke e phatlalatse ka phupu, leha phapang ya teng e so ka e bonahala.

src: given the unpredictable performance of eskom’s fleet of coalfired power stations, we will not be able to eliminate load shedding in the short term.
tgt: jwalo ka ha eskom e sa ntsaneng e sebedisa tsela e sa tshepahaleng ya ho fehla motlakase ka tshebediso ya mashala, re ke se be le tharollo e potlakang ya ho tingwa hona ha motlakase.

src: this is the unfortunate reality of our situation, which has had a long history.
tgt: ke tsona ditaba tse bosula ka maemo ao re leng ho ona, a qadileng nakong e telele e fetileng.

src: our goal in the immediate term however is to reduce the frequency and severity of load shedding by addressing power station breakdowns.
tgt: maikemisetso a rona a ha jwale ke ho etsa hore ho tingwa hona ha motlakase ho se ke ha etsahala kga fetsa ka hore re shebane le mathata a ho robeha ha metjhini e fehlang motla kase.

src: this is a significant challenge given the average age of power stations, and that in the past critical maintenance was not undertaken at the necessary intervals.
tgt: ana ke mathata a maholo ha re sheba metjhini ena hore e se e sebeditse dilemo tse kae, le hore e ne e sa lokiswe ka nako e tshwa netseng nakong e fetileng.

src: eskom is urgently implementing measures to improve plant performance, which is a priority until new generation power projects are brought online.
tgt: ha jwale, eskom e leka ho etsa hore metjhini ena ya yona e sebetse hantle ho fihlela ditsi tse ntjha tse fehlang motlakase di qala ho sebetsa.

src: it is addressing the critical issue of coal supply, including working with transnet on the transportation of coal and monitoring the consistency of the supply from collieries to stations.
tgt: e boetse hape e shebana le mathata a ho thothwa ha mashala, ho kenyeletsa le ho buisana le transnet hore e be bona ba thothang mashala ho tloha merafong ya ona ho ya ditsing tse fehlang motlakase.

src: eskom is also addressing the poor quality of coal, which often leads to plant breakdowns.
tgt: eskom e boetse e rarolla taba ya mashala a boleng bo tlase, e leng ona ka dinako tse ding a etsang hore metjhini ya bona e robehe.

src: people with experience in running power stations are being brought back to help with plant operation, management and mentorship.
tgt: ho kgutli sitswe le batho ba nang le boiphihlelo tsamaisong ya ditsi tse fehlang motlakase ba neng ba se ba tsamaile eskom hore ba tlo thusa.

src: to ensure that critical maintenance is undertaken without delays, discussions are underway to ease local content requirements for spare parts and to use the equipment manufacturers to undertake maintenance.
tgt: ho leka ho rarolla mathata a tokiso ya metjhini, eskom e fetola tsela ya ho lokisa metjhini ka ho sebedisa baetsi ba yona ha e robehile ho ena le ho nna e sebedisa batho ba bang.

src: to address the immediate energy shortfall, eskom has since july worked on procuring emergency power, and in the last week launched power purchase programmes for 1 000 megawatts of emergency capacity from companies with existing generation capacity and to secure imports from neighbouring countries.
tgt: tsela e nngwe e potlakang ho rarolleng mathata ana a motlakase e bile hore ho tloha ka phupu, eskom e qadile ho reka motlakase wa tshohanyetso.

src: government is giving close attention to the skills, experience and capabilities of the eskom leadership to ensure that the company has the best people at all levels of the organisation.
tgt: mmuso o boetse o behile baetapele ba maemo ohle ba ha eskom leihlo hore na ba na le thupello le boiphihlelo bo hlokahalang.

src: these interventions will help to reduce the severity and frequency of load shedding as we are bringing new power onto the grid over the medium term to increase energy supply.
tgt: mehato ena kaofela e tla thusa ho fokotsa sekgahla le ho tingwa ha ona kgafetsa jwalo ka ha re sa emetse ho fela ha ditsi tse ntjha tse fehlang motlakase.

src: recently, government signed power purchase agreements for 420 mw with the first three preferred bidders under bid window 5 of the renewable energy programme.
tgt: haufinyane, mmuso o sa tswa tekena tumellano ya ho reka motlakase wa 420 mw dikhamphaneng tse ikemetseng tlasa lenaneo la bid window 5 la ho fehla motlakase ka mokgwa wa tlhaho.

src: the three projects are expected to connect to the grid in october 2024, and preparations are underway to sign with the remaining 22 preferred bidders.
tgt: motlakase ona o tla qala ho kena phepelong ya ha eskom ka mphalane 2024, mme hape ho boetse ho tla rekwa o mong ho bahlahisi ba bang ba 22. tlasa lenaneo la bid window 6 ho tla nyollwa sekala sa motlakase ho tloha ho 2 600 mw ho ya ho 4 200 mw.

src: the amount of generation capacity to be procured from bid window 6 will increase 2 600 mw to 4 200 mw.
tgt: komiti ya naha e she baneng le mathata a motlakase eo ke neng ke e kgethe ka phupu, e shebana le melao le dipehelo tsa ho tlisa diphetoho lekaleng lena la motlakase.

src: we have published for public comment the amendment that removes the licensing threshold for private generation projects.
tgt: re phatlaladitse diphetoho molaong o fetotseng teka nyetso eo dikhamphane tse ikemetseng di ka e fehlang hore setjhaba se ntshe maikutlo ka tsona.

src: this will pave the way for investment in larger, utilityscale projects that will rapidly add new generation capacity to the grid.
tgt: sena se tla thusa ho tlisa diprojeke tse ngata tse tla etsa hore re fumane motlakase o mong o tla kena phepelong.

src: the need for environmental authorisations has been waived for transmission infrastructure in strategic corridors where risk to the environment is low.
tgt: dipehelo mabapi le tsa tikoloho di tlositswe diba keng tseo ho fehlwa ha motlakase ho seng kotsi haholo ho tikoloho.

src: the timeframes for energy projects receiving land use authorisations and grid connection approvals has been substantially reduced, as has the national energy regulator’s registration process for generation facilities.
tgt: mokgatlo wa naha o laolang motlakase o fokoditse le nako eo dikhamphane di e emang ho fumana tumello ya tshebediso ya mobu le ho hokelwa ha motlakase wa tsona phepelong.

src: while we work to increase the supply of electricity, we must increase efforts to reduce demand, particularly at peak times.
tgt: jwalo ka ha re etsa matsapa a ho eketsa phe pelo ya motlakase, ka ho le leng re ntse re tlameha ho fokotsa le tshebediso ya ona, haholoholo nakong ya ka phirimana.

src: we must come together as citizens to alleviate the pressure on the national grid.
tgt: re tlameha ho tshwarisana re le maafrika borwa ho fokotsa kgatello phepelong ya motlakase.

src: this means using electricity sparingly, reporting illegal connections and paying for the electricity we use.
tgt: ka sena re bolela hore re sebedise mo tlakase ka nepo, re tlalehe ba o hokelang ka tsela e seng molaong mme re boele re o lefelle.

src: businesses, households and government departments that owe eskom must pay up so that eskom is better able to undertake the critical maintenance that is needed to keep the lights.
tgt: dikgwe bo, malapa le mafapha a mmuso a kolotang eskom, ba tlameha ho lefa dikoloto tsa bona hore eskom e tle e kgone ho lokisa metjhini ya yona e le hore motlakase o nne o dule o le teng.

src: as we continue to experience load shedding, there is a great tempation to give up hope that we will ever solve this problem.
tgt: jwalo ka ha ho tingwa ha motlakase ho ntse ho tswela pele, batho ba lahla tshepo hore mathata ana a tla qetella a fedile.

src: yet, if we look just beyond the most immediate crisis, there are real signs of progress and good reasons to be optimistic.
tgt: ha re tlohela mathata ana, mme re shebela dintho pejana, re bona matshwao a kgatelo pele, e leng lebaka le ka etsang hore re be le tshepo.

src: stem cell donation is a painless way to help save lives kgaogelo letsebe mfundo mxolisi ngwenya (30) from durban, kwazulunatal, is one of the few black stem cell donors in the country.
tgt: ho fana ka masole a mmele a fumanehang mokong, ha ho bohloko, e bile ho pholosa bophelo kgaogelo letsebe mfundo mxolisi ngwenya (30) wa thekong, kwazulunatal ke e mong wa batho ba mmalwa ba batsho ba fanang ka masole a fumanehang mokong naheng ena.

src: the south african bone marrow registry (sabmr) says more people of colour need to register as donors because a patient has the best chance of finding a match in their ethnic grouping.
tgt: ba sitsi se ngodisang batho ba fanang ka moko afrika borwa (sabmr), ba bolela ha ba kgothaletsa batho ba morabe wa ba mmala hore ba tlo ingodisa jwalo ka bafani hobane ha ngata mokudi o fumana masole a tshwanang le a hae morabeng wa ha habo.

src: according to the registry, only 10% of the 78 000 registered donors are black, while 9.9% are indian/asian and 67% are white.
tgt: ho ya ka sitsi sena, ke persente tse 10 feela bathong ba 78 000 ba ingodisitseng bao e leng ba batsho, ha maindiya ona e le persente tse 9.9 ha makgowa ona e le tse 67. ba ha sabmr ba bolela ha bafani ba bangata ba sebedisa mokgwa wa ho hula masole ana mading.

src: the sabmr says most donors donate through a process called peripheral blood stem cell collection.
tgt: ho bolelwa ha masole ana a fumanehang mokong, a fumaneha le mading a phallang.

src: it says the same stem cells found in your bone marrow are also found in your circulating blood.
tgt: sena se etswa ka hore ho hulwe madi ka nale sephakeng mme madi ao a fete motjhining o monyang masole ao mme madi a boele naleng e tla a kgutlisetsa mmeleng sephakeng se seng.

src: blood is removed through a needle in one arm, passed through a machine that collects stem cells and returned through a needle in your other arm.
tgt: masole ana, a thusa ho fodisa ditshwaetso mading tse kang ho fokola ha moko, ho fellwa ke moko kapa ho se hole ka nepo ha ditho tse itseng tsa mmele.

src: stem cells are important to cure blood diseases such as leukaemia, marrow failure or aplasia.
tgt: ngwenya, motsamaisi wa tsa dipapadi durban uni versity of technology, o ne a qale ho tseba ka mofuta ona wa masole a mmele ka 2012 nakong eo sabmr e neng e entse dipontsho sitsing se haufi sa mabenkele.

src: "i have always donated blood and am always eager to help, so i went for it.
tgt: "ke motho ya tlwaetseng ho fana ka madi, mme ke ha ke leba teng.

src: it was really easy because they just took a swab in the mouth and said i should expect a call."
tgt: ho ne ho le bobebe, ba ne ba nke lero feela ka hanong, mme ba mpolella hore ke lebelle mohala o tswang ho bona."

src: the sample taken from a potential donor’s mouth is tested and their details are stored so that they can be contacted if they become a match for someone in need of stem cells.
tgt: lero lena le kengwa ditekong mme dintlha tsa monga lona di bolokwe ho etsetsa hore ba tle ba mo letsetse haeba ho na le motho ya hlokang masole mme ya nang le masole a tshwanang le mofani eo.

src: "last year, i received a call that they had found a perfect match.
tgt: "ngwahola, ba ile ba nte tsetsa ba mpolella ha ho na le motho ya nang le masole a tshwanang le a ka ya hlokang mofani.

src: the process to donate is quite lengthy and involves about 13 different tests, ranging from a physical [to check overall health] to blood tests.
tgt: tsela e latelwang ha o se o fana e batla e le teletsana mme yona e kenyeletsa diteko tse 13 tse fapafapa neng ho tloha ho shahleng ha mmele [ho hlahloba bophelo ka kakaretso] ho isa ditekong tsa madi.

src: i also had to inject myself on a daily basis," he says.
tgt: ke ne ke boetse hape ke tlameha ho enta kamehla," o boletse jwalo.

src: the actual donation takes between six and eight hours.
tgt: ho fana hona ho nka pakeng tsa hora tse tsheletseng ho isa ho tse robedi.

src: more donors neededngwenya says people need to be made aware that the donation process does not involve surgery.
tgt: ho hlokahala bafani ba bangngwenya o re batho ba tlameha ho tsebiswa hore ho fana hona ha ho kenyeletse ophareishene.

src: he says in some cases, cultural beliefs may stop people from becoming donors.
tgt: o bolela hore ka dinako tse ding dikgollo tsa setso ke tsona tse thibe lang hore batho ba fane ka ditho.

src: the sabmr says it will be engaging traditional and religious leaders to promote stem cell donation.
tgt: ba ha sabmr ba bolela ha ba tla buisana le marena le baruti ho kgothaletsa batho ho fana ka masole ana.

src: victim empowerment programme restores hope owen mngadi the thohoyandou victim empowerment programme (tvep) strives to restore hope and confidence in the justice system through its intensive initiatives aimed at assisting survivors of genderbased violence (gbv) and rape by providing them with psychosocial services.
tgt: lenaneo la ho matlafatsa mahlatsipa le kgutlisa tshepo owen mngadi lenaneo la ho matlafatsa mahlatsipa la thohoya ndou (tvep) le sebetsa ka thata ho kgutlisetsa tshepo ho makala a toka ka boikgathatso ba ona bo tebileng bo reretsweng ho thusa batho ba phonyohileng tlhekefetso ya bong (gbv) le tlhekefetso ya motabo ka ho ba fumantsha ditshebeletso tsa ho thoba maikutlo le kelello.

src: founded in limpopo over 20 years ago, the tvep operates in tshilidzini and donald fraser hospitals under the thulamela local municipality.
tgt: e thehilwe limpopo dilemong tse fetang tse 20 tse fetileng, tvep e sebeletsa sepetleleng sa tshilidzini le sa donald fraser ka tlasa masepala wa lehae wa thulamela.

src: its acting director fhatuwani manthada says the programme aims to instil a zerotolerance attitude towards sexual assault, gbv and child abuse among thohoyandou residents, given the fact that these cases are prevalent in the area.
tgt: molaodi wa yona a tshwereng mokobobo, fhatuwani manthada, o re lenaneo lena le ikemiseditse ho ruta ho tshwela ka mathe boitshwaro ba tlhekefetso ka motabo, tlhekefetso ya bong le tlhekefetso ya bana ka hara setjhaba sa thohoyandou, hobane mefuta ena ya tlhekefetso e mengata tulong ena.

src: he says in the past, crime statistics indicated that there were many rape cases in thohoyandou, but the tvep has made great strides in raising awareness and providing trauma counselling services to curb the scourge.
tgt: o re nakong e fetileng, dipalopalo tsa botlokotsebe di ne di bontsha hore hona le dinyewe tse ngata tsa tlhekefetso ya motabo thohoyandou, empa tvep e nkile mehato ya ho hlaba mokgosi le ho fana ka ditshebeletso tsa ho thoba maikutlo a mahlatsipa bakeng sa ho thibela thohako ena.

src: as the world will be observing the 16 days of activism for no violence against women and children from 25 november to 10 december, manthada says the programme is satisfied with the progress made with encouraging residents to understand their rights and report crimes.
tgt: jwalo ka ha e le mona lefatshe le tla be le kena letsholong la matsatsi a 16 kgahlano le tlhekefetso ya basadi le bana ho tloha ka la 25 pudungwana ho fihlela ka la 10 tshitwe, manthada o re ba kgotsofetse ka tema e seng e kgathilwe ya ho kgothalletsa setjhaba ho utlwisisa ditokelo tsa bona le ho tlaleha botlokotsebe.

src: "the tvep receives between 80 and 100 victims of domestic violence every month, while 45 to 50 rape cases are reported monthly," says manthada.
tgt: "tvep e fumana palo e mahareng a 80 le 100 ya mahlatsipa a merusu ya malapeng kgwedi le kgwedi, athe ho tlalehwa dinyewe tsa tlhekefetso ya motabo tse 45 ho isa ho 50 ka kgwedi," ho bolela manthada.

src: the programme’s onestop centres offer a wide range of services to victims, including access to legal assistance, protection of victims against perpetrators, court case monitoring, counselling and empowerment through skills development, thus giving the victims a fresh start.
tgt: ditsha tse nang le lenaneo lena di fa mahlatsipa ditshebeletso tse ngata tse fapaneng, tse kenyeletsang thuso ya tsa molao, tshireletso kgahlano le bahlekefetsi ba bona, ho beha dinyewe leihlo, ho thojwa maikutlo le ho matlafatswa ka ntshetsopele ya tsebo, e leng dintho tse nehang lehlatsipa monyetla wa ho qala botjha.

src: manthada states that the tvep works closely with the south african police service, department of health and department of social development to prevent secondary traumatisation of victims in the process of opening a case.
tgt: manthada o bolela hore tvep e sebedisana mmoho le sepolesa sa aforika borwa, lefapha la bophelo le lefapha la ntshetsopele ya setjhaba bakeng sa ho thibela ho sithabetsa maikutlo a lehlatsipa hape ha ba ntse ba bula nyewe.

src: "in rape cases, healthcare workers and the police come to the tvep centres to assist victims to open criminal cases against the perpetrators and also provide counselling services," he says.
tgt: "dinyeweng tsa tlhekefetso ya motabo, basebetsi ba tlhokomelo ya bophelo le mapolesa ba tla ditsheng tsa tvep ho tla thusa mahlatsipa ho bula dinyewe kgahlano le bahlekefetsi ba bona, le ho ba fa ditshebeletso tsa ho thoba maikutlo," o rialo.

src: the tvep accommodates victims for up to 14 days, however, the arrangement could be extended in cases that involve the whole family or children.
tgt: tvep e fa mahlatsipa bodulo bakeng sa matsatsi a fihlang ho 14, le ha ho le jwalo, ho ka hlophiswa hore a eketswe ha eba tlhekefetso e kenyeletsa lelapa lohle.

src: "we have empowerment unity that conducts public dialogues and educates people about their rights.
tgt: "re na le lekala le matla fatsang, le etellang pele dipuisano le setjhaba le ho ruta batho ka ditokelo tsa bona.

src: we serve more than one million residents from thohoyandou and surrounding areas.
tgt: re sebeletsa setjhaba se fetang miliyone sa thohoya ndou le metse e mabapi.

src: we have managed to restore hope and people now have trust in the criminal justice [system] through our relationship with the police," he says.
tgt: re kgonne ho kgutlisetsa tshepo mme batho ba se ba tshepa ditshebeletso tsa toka ka kamano ya rona le mapolesa," o rialo.

src: the tvep has also created employment for 44 people who serve in various departments such as finance, human resources and evaluation.
tgt: hape tvep e thehile mesebetsi bakeng sa batho ba 44 ba e sebeletsang mafapheng a fapaneng a akgang la ditjhelete, la taolo ya tsa tshebetso le la tekolo.

src: despite receiving continuous funding of r90 000 quarterly from the limpopo department of social development, the tvep was affected by covid19 as many funders pulled out, thus negatively affecting the organisation’s operational processes.
tgt: le ha e le mona ba fumana tshehetso ya tjhelete e kana ka r90 000 kotara enngwe le enngwe hotswa ho lefapha la ntshetsopele ya setjhaba la limpopo, tvep e ne e anngwe ke covid19 jwalo ka ha batshehetsi ba yona ka tjhelete ba ikgutse, mme hona ho ile ha ama tshebetso ya mokgatlo ha mpe.

src: however, the genderbased violence and femicide (gbvf) response fund, which was launched by president cyril ramaphosa, together with the international women’s forum of south africa and social partners have assisted the programme.
tgt: le ha ho le jwalo, letlole le thusang kgahlano le tlhekefetso ya bong le dipolao tsa basadi le banana (gbvf), le kgakotsweng ke moporesidente cyril ramaphosa, mmoho le foramo ya matjhaba ya basadi ya afrika borwa le balekane ba yona setjhabeng ka tlhakola monongwaha, di thusitse lenaneo lena.

src: the tvep was among the first batch of the organisations, that fight against gbvf, to receive funding.
tgt: tvep ke enngwe ya me kgatlo ya pele e lwantshang tlhekefetso ya bong le dipolao tsa basadi le banana, ya ho fumana tshehetso ya tjhelete.

src: with the sum of r128 million that was raised through contributions by the private sector, multisectoral fund, the gbvf fund will assist and support the implementation of the national strategic plan on gbvf.
tgt: ka dimiliyone tse 128 tsa diranta tse bokeleditsweng ka dinehelo tsa lefapha la poraefete, letlole la mafapha a mangata, letlole la tlhekefetso ya bong le dipolao tsa basadi le banana le tla thusa le ho tshehetsa ho kenngwa tshebetsong ha leano la tshebetso la naha la gbvf.

src: the tvep has been allocated r250 000 for the current year and will receive more funding for 2023. manthada says the funds have enabled the tvep to reach out to more victims and keep the organisation running.
tgt: monongwaha tvep e abetswe r250 000 mme e tla fumana tshehetso enngwe ya tjhelete bakeng sa 2023. manthada o re matlole a na a entse ho be bobebe hore ba fihlelle mahlatsipeng a mangata le hore mokgatlo o dule o sebetsa.

src: murendeni vhengani (26) is a survivor who was rescued by the tvep from her abusive exboyfriend.
tgt: murendeni vhengani (26) o phonyohile tlhekefetsong mme o pholositswe ho mohlankana wa hae wa mehleng ke tvep .

src: she spent 46 months months at the centre, with her fouryearold daughter.
tgt: ena le moradi wa hae a dilemo tse nne ba dutse dikgwedi tse 46 lehaeng la mahlatsipa.

src: the centre assisted her to open charges against him and to file a protection order.
tgt: lehae le mo thusitse ho bula nyewe kgahlano le mohlankana enwa le ho kopa tshireletso ya molao.

src: "they welcomed me with warm hands after many years of suffering.
tgt: "ba ile ba nkamohela ka matsoho a mofuthu ka mora ho sotleha dilemolemo.

src: i felt safe.
tgt: ke ikutlwa ke bolokehile.

src: i have regained my confidence," she says.
tgt: ke ikutlwa ke na le tshepo hape," o rialo.

src: the gbvf fund chairperson, dr judy dlamini, says funding for 108 organisations whose applications have been successful are being processed.
tgt: modulasetulo wa letlole la gbvf, ngaka judy dlamini, o itse tshehetso ya ditjhelete bakeng sa mekgatlo e 108 eo dikopo tsa yona di atlehileng e ntse e hlophiswa.

src: information regarding the next round of applications will soon be available on the gbvf fund website: https://gbvf.
tgt: haufinyana lesedi la mokgahlelo o latelang wa ho etsa dikopo o tla fumanwa websaeteng ya letlole la gbvf: https://gbvf.

src: nsfas 2023 applications open vukuzenzele unnamed the national stu dent financial aid scheme (nsfas) 2023 application cycle has opened.
tgt: dikopo tsa nsfas tsa 2023 di buletswe vukuzenzele unnamed dikopo tsa matlole a thusang baithuti (nsfas) bakeng sa 2023 di buletswe.

src: higher education, science and innovation minister dr blade nzimande made the announcement recently during a media briefing.
tgt: letona la thuto e phahameng, saense le ntjhafatso, ngaka blade nzimande, o sa tswa phatlalatsa sebokeng sa ditaba.

src: minister nzimande says the scheme resolved to open the application cycle early, as opposed to the previous year, in order to give prospective applicants enough time to submit their applications and supporting documents.
tgt: letona nzimande o re letlole le dumellane ka ho bulela dikopo nako e sa le teng, papisong le selemo se fetileng, bakeng sa ho neha bakopi nako e ngata ya ho romela dikopo tsa bona mmoho le ditokomane tse hlokehang.

src: giving an update report on nsfas funding for the 2022 academic year, minister nzimande says a budget of r43 billion was allocated to the scheme towards the beneficiaries’ tuition fees, including food and travelling allowance, and study material.
tgt: ha a fana ka lesedi la tlaleho ya tshehetso ya tjhelete ya nsfas bakeng sa selemo sa dithuto sa 2022, letona nzimande o re tekanyetso ya tjhelete ya dibiliyone tse 43 tsa diranta e ile ya abelwa letlole bakeng sa ditefello tsa dithuto, ho kenyeletsa dijo, ditefello tsa maeto a hoya dithutong le ho kgutla, mmoho le disebediswa tsa thuto.

src: he says 985 672 applications were received with 140 636 application unsuccessful.
tgt: o re ho fumanwe dikopo tse 985 672 mme tse 140 636 ha di a atleha.

src: of the applications received, 739 526 applications were provisionally approved for funding pending registration from respective institutions.
tgt: hara dikopo tsohle tse fumanweng, tse 739 526 di amohetswe nakwana ho fihlela bakopi ba ingodisa ditheong tse fapaneng tsa thuto e phahameng.

src: "[the] majority of unsuccessful applicants failed to provide sufficient evidence to support their applications for funding; exceeded the financial eligibility threshold; already achieved the highest level of qualification that nsfas funds and being noncompliant to the academic pathways of the tvet college sector," minister nzimande explains.
tgt: "bongata ba bakopi ba sa atlehang ha bo a fana ka bopaki bo felletseng bakeng sa ho tshehetsa dikopo tsa bona; ba tlotse sekepele se hlokehang bakeng sa thuso ya tjhelete; ba se ba fihlelletse lengolo le hodimo ka ho fetisisa le nsfas e ka le tshehetsang ka tjhelete le ho se ikamahanye le dipehelo tsa metjha ya koletjhe ya tvet," ho hlalosa letona nzimande.

src: according to information on the nsfas website, as of the 2021 academic year, nsfas no longer provides funding for postgraduate courses.
tgt: ho latela lesedi le websaeteng ya nsfas, ho tloha ka selemo sa dithuto sa 2021, nsfas ha e sa tshehetsa dithuto tsa lengolo le ka hodimo ho dikri ya pele.

src: this includes postgraduate certificates, postgraduate diplomas, honours degrees, masters and phd degrees.
tgt: ho kenyeletsa postgraduate certificates, postgraduate diplo mas, honours degrees, masters le phd degrees.

src: this means the highest qualification that the scheme funds is a bachelor’s degree.
tgt: hona ho bolela hore lengo lo le hodimo ka ho fetisisa le tshehetswang ke letlole lena ke.

src: improving the application systemin a bid to improve its appli cation system and process to simplify it for prospective applicants, minister nzimande says this year, nsfas has implemented a number of enhancements to the system to ensure a seamless application experience.
tgt: ho ntlafatsa motjha wa ho etsa kopotekong ya ho ntlafatsa tsamaiso le motjha wa dikopo hore o be bobebe bakeng sa bakopi, letona nzimande o re sele mong sena, nsfas e entse ntlafatso tse ngata tsamaisong bakeng sa ho netefatsa hore ho ba le motjha o bobebe wa ho etsa dikopo.

src: he says the nsfas online application portal was redesigned to be more user friendly and closer to other platforms that prospective applicants are accustomed to such as whatsapp, twitter, facebook and instagram.
tgt: o re motjha wa ho etsa dikopo tsa nsfas inthaneteng o entswe hore o be bobebe mme o batla o tshwana le e bakopi ba seng ba e tlwaetse e jwalo ka whatsapp, twitter, facebook le instagram.

src: "the application process itself has been simplified and the questions asked are easier to understand by the public.
tgt: "motjha wa ho etsa kopo ka bo ona o se o bebofaditswe mme le dipotso tse botswang di bobebe ho utlwisiswa ke setjhaba.

src: additionally, applicants can pause the process and continue at a later stage without restarting from scratch, something that was not possible in previous cycles, he says.
tgt: hape, bakopi ba ka kgefutsa motjha wa ho etsa kopo mme ba tswela pele hamorao ntle le ho qala qalong, e leng ntho e neng e sa kgonehe nakong e fetileng, o rialo.

src: "over and above the enhancements, nsfas developed additional channels of application to cater for applicants from diverse backgrounds, also keeping in mind that most of the prospective applicants are young people who embrace the digital way of doing things," minister nzimande adds.
tgt: "ka hodima dintlafatso tsena, nsfas e entse metjha ya tlatsetso ya ho etsa dikopo bakeng sa bakopi ba bokgo ni bo fapafapaneng, hape re hopole hore bakopi ba bangata ke batjha ba tlwae tseng ho sebedisa mokgwa wa dijithale wa ho etsa dintho," letona nzimande o a phaella.

src: a million work and livelihood opportunities, and counting vukuzenzele unnamed less than two years ago, we launched the presidential employment stimulus to create jobs and support livelihoods as part of supporting the economic recovery from the covid19 pandemic.
tgt: mesebetsi e miliyone le menyetla ya lekeno, ebile menyetla e sa tswella pele vukuzenzele unnamed dilemong tse ka tlase ho tse pedi tse fetileng, re ile ra kgakola leano la moporesidente la ho susumetsa theho ya mesebetsi le ho tshehetsa lekeno e le karolo ya ho tshehetsa tsoseletso ya moruo ka mora sewa sa covid19.

src: the presidential employment stimulus has just reached the milestone of one million participants since its inception.
tgt: leano la moporesidente la ho susumetsa theho ya mesebetsi le fihlelletse boemo bo phahameng ba ho ba le bankakarolo ba miliyone ho tloha ha le ne le qala.

src: this achievement is the result of a collaborative effort across government and the wider society, including the private sector, communitybased organisations and many others.
tgt: phihlello ena ke sephetho sa tshebedisano mmoho ya mmuso le setjhaba ka kakaretso, ho kenyeletsa le makala a poraefete, mekgatlo ya setjhaba le tse ding tse ngata.

src: the programme is contributing to employment creation while the economy takes time to recover and create jobs at the scale we need.
tgt: leano lena le kenya letsoho thehong ya mesebetsi ha moruo o ntse o nka nako ho iphumana le ho theha mesebetsi ka sekgahla se re se hlokang.

src: as we pursue economic growth to deliver decent and sustainable employment at a much larger scale, we will continue to build on the success of the presidential employment stimulus and expand its reach.
tgt: ha re ntse re ntshetsa pele kgodiso ya moruo bakeng sa ho theha mesebetsi e tsitsi tseng e mengata, re tla tswela pele ho aha hodima katleho ya leano la moporesidente la ho susumetsa theho ya mesebetsi le ho hodisa moo le fihlella teng.

src: it is still very much needed to complement recovery of the job market.
tgt: le ntse le hlokeha haholo bakeng sa ho thusa tsoseletso ya mesebetsi.

src: it also supports economic recovery in important ways.
tgt: le boela le tshehetsa ho iphumana ha moruo ka ditsela tse bohlokwa.

src: in a context where a lack of work experience is a major barrier to finding work, these programmes are providing highquality work experiences.
tgt: maemong ana ao leqeme la boiphihlelo ba mosebetsi e leng tshita bakeng sa ho fumana mosebetsi, maano ana a nehelana ka boiphihlelo ba mesebetsi ba boleng bo hodimo.

src: in the largest programme supported by the stimulus, for example, nearly 600 000 young people have been placed as school assistants in over 22 000 schools in every corner of the country.
tgt: lenaneong le leholo ka ho fetisisa le tshehetswang ke tshusumetso ena, mohlala, palo e ka bang 600 000 ya batjha e sebetsa e le bathusi dikolong tse fetang 22 000 naha ka bophara.

src: school management, teachers and other stakeholders all agree that the contribution of the school assistants has improved the learning environment in schools.
tgt: batsamaisi ba dikolo, matitjhere le bankakarolo ba bang bohle ba a dumela hore karolo e bapa lwang ke bathusi ba dikolo e ntlafaditse maemo a thuto dikolong.

src: many selfemployed people found their livelihoods disrupted by the pandemic.
tgt: lekeno la bahwebi ba ba ngata le ile la sitiswa ke sewa sa covid19.

src: the creative sector was particularly badly affected.
tgt: makala a bonono a ne a amehile ka ho fetisisa.

src: in this sector, support was provided to people to create jobs for themselves and others.
tgt: makaleng ana, tshehetso e ne e fiwa batho hore ba ithehele mesebetsi mmoho le ho thehela ba bang.

src: the movies, music and plays produced are now able to generate further income from the sale of rights, tickets and royalties.
tgt: difilimi, mmino le dipapadi tsa kalaneng tse hlahisitsweng di se di kgona ho iketsetsa lekeno ka ho rekisa ditokelo, ditekete le ho fumana tjhelete e lefshwang bakeng sa tshebediso ya bonono bona.

src: all of this has been contributing to the growth of the sector.
tgt: tsena tsohle di nkile karolo kgolong ya makala ana.

src: the presidential employment stimulus has also supported sustainable livelihoods.
tgt: leano la moporesidente la ho susumetsa theho ya mesebetsi le tsheheditse le lekeno le tsitsitseng.

src: over 140 000 subsistence farmers have received production input vouchers to assist them to resume and expand production after the disruptions of covid19.
tgt: balemi ba fetang 140 000 ba fumane tshehetso le thuso ya ho kgutlela temong le ho hodisa tlhahiso kamora tshitiso e entsweng ke covid19.

src: one such beneficiary is 36yearold phindile ngcoya from richmond in kwazulunatal.
tgt: emong wa ba unneng molemo oo ke phindile ngcoya a dilemo tse 36 a dulang richmond kwazulunatal.

src: she is one of ten members of a family farming cooperative and says the voucher she received helped the new cooperative survive and become profitable.
tgt: ke emong wa ditho tse leshome tsa lelapa le lemang mmoho mme o re thuso eo a e fumaneng e thusitse ho boloka tshebetso mmoho ena e ntjha le hore e be le phaello.

src: the presidential employment stimulus is also supporting graduates, with opportunities provided to nurses, science graduates, artisans and others.
tgt: leano la moporesidente la ho susumetsa theho ya mesebetsi le boela le tshehetsa batho ba phethetseng dithuto tsa ka mora sekolo, mme menyetla e fiwa baoki, batho ba phethetseng dithuto tsa ka mora sekolo tsa saense, ba sebetsang ka matsoho le babang.

src: twenty six universities are helping to place unemployed graduates in work relevant to their qualifications.
tgt: diyunivesithi tse mashome a mabedi le metso e tshelela di thusa ho kenya batho ba phethetseng dithuto tsa ka mora sekolo mesebetsi ng eo ba e balletseng.

src: the department of science and innovation has introduced a range of innovative citizen science programmes, such as the duzi umngeni conservation trust, which employs local youth as envirochamps to empower communities to rehabilitate local water sources.
tgt: lefapha la saense le boqapi le sibollotse mananeo a baahi ba naha a fapaneng a saense, jwalo ka duzi umngeni conservation trust, e hirang batjha ba lehae e le bomampodi ba tikoloho bakeng sa ho matlafatsa setjhaba hore se ntlafatse mehlodi ya lehae ya metsi.

src: another programme by the department helps entrepreneurs to develop business proposals in the green economy.
tgt: lenaneo le leng la lefapha le thusa bahwebi ho etsa dikopo tsa kgwebo ya moruo o motala (o fedisang tshilafatso ya moya, o tshehetsang kgolo ya moruo ka mokgwa o sa silafatseng bophelo bo botle).

src: public employment programmes also have a direct positive impact on communities because they create work for the common good.
tgt: mananeo a khiro ya setjhaba a boela a na le molemo o qaqileng setjhabeng hobane a theha mosebetsi bakeng sa morero o tshwanang.

src: in the case of the presidential employment stimulus, this includes improving learning in schools, upgrading informal settlements, supporting survivors of genderbased violence, environmental conservation and innovating in wasterecycling.
tgt: boemong ba leano la moporesidente la ho susumetsa theho ya mesebetsi, bona bo kenyeletsa thuto dikolong, ho ntlafatsa dibaka tsa baipehi, ho tshehetsa mahlatsipa a tlhekefetso ya bong, tlhokomelo ya tikoloho le boqapi ho ntjhafatso ya matlakala hore a sebediswe hape.

src: the presidential employment stimulus was launched in response to the unemployment crisis that was deepened by the covid19 pandemic.
tgt: leano la moporesidente la ho susumetsa theho ya mesebetsi le kgakotswe bakeng sa ho lwantsha koduwa ya tlhokeho ya mesebetsi e feteleditsweng ke sewa sa covid19.

src: although the pandemic may have abated, unemployment has not.
tgt: le ha e le mona sewa se kokobetse, tlhokeho ya mesebetsi yona e jele setsi.

src: the incomes earned in presidential employment stimulus programmes have been an economic boost to small enterprises and informal businesses in local economies across the country.
tgt: mekgolo e kgotsweng mananeong a leano la moporesidente la ho susumetsa theho ya mesebetsi e thusitse moruo wa dikgwebo tse nyane mmoho le tse sa ngodiswang meruong ya lehae naha ka bopha ra.

src: school assistants employed in umgungundlovu are spending their wages in umgungundlovu.
tgt: bathusi ba dikolo ba sebetsang umgungundlovu ba sebedisa mekgolo ya bona hona umgungundlovu.

src: the same in putsonderwater.
tgt: ho jwalo fela le putsonderwater.

src: instead of the ‘trickle down’ effect, money is being put directly into the hands of communities that need it most.
tgt: ho fapana le leano la hore 'batho ba kojwana di mahe tleng ba tla una molemo ha barui ba ntse ba rua le ho feta', tjhelete e kenywa ka ko tloloho matsohong a setjhaba se e hlokang ka ho fetisisa.

src: that money then circulates locally and ‘trickles up’ into the wider economy.
tgt: tjhelete eo e fapanyetsanwa moruong wa lehae mme e be e boela e nyolohela moruong wa naha ka kakaretso.

src: that is why we call it a stimulus, because the entire economy benefits along with society.
tgt: ke ka hoo re e bitsang tshusumetso, hobane moruo ohle o una molemo mmoho le setjhaba.

src: through the presidential employment stimulus, we have unlocked energy, commitment, creativity, innovation and opportunities.
tgt: ka leano la moporesidente la ho susumetsa theho ya mesebetsi, re buletse matla, boitelo, boqapi, ntlafatso le menyetla.

src: in the process, we are building a society that works.
tgt: ka ho etsa jwalo, re aha setjhaba se sebetsang.

src: over one million people have benefited directly.
tgt: batho ba fetang miliyone ba unne molemo ka kotloloho.

src: many more people, in the families and communities of participants, have felt the impact of the stimulus.
tgt: batho ba bangata, malapeng le setjhabeng sa bankakarolo, ba kgotse molemo wa tshusumetso ena.

src: our task now is to expand and deepen the impact of this work.
tgt: mosebetsi wa rona hajwale ke ho eketsa le ho tebisa melemo ya mosebetsi ona.

src: as a result of the presidential employment stimulus, we now have hundreds of thousands of people with valuable work experience.
tgt: ka lebaka la leano la moporesidente la ho susumetsa theho ya mesebetsi, re se re na le makgolokgolo a dikete tsa batho ba fumaneng boiphihlelo ba mesebetsi ba boleng.

src: most of these people are easy to find through the sayouth.
tgt: ho bobebe ho fumana bongata ba batho bana ka sayouth.

src: early childhood development holds the key to our future vukuzenzele unnamed there are few pre sidential activities more fulfilling than spending a morning in the company of small children.
tgt: thuto ya bana ba banyenyane ke senotlolo sa bokamoso ba rona vukuzenzele unnamed di mmalwa dike tsahalo tse amang moporesidente tse kgotsofatsang tse fetang ho dula le bana ba banyenyane hoseng.

src: i recently attended the opening of the little flower early childhood development (ecd) centre in bizana in the eastern cape, where i got to spend time with some of the future leaders of our country, reading to them and listening to them.
tgt: ke sa tswa ya pulong ya setsi sa little flower sa thuto ya ba banyenyane (ecd), bizana, kapa botjhabela, moo ke bileng le nako le ba bang ba baetapele ba kamoso ba naha ena ya rona, ke ba balla le ho ba mamela.

src: the centre was recently built by the development organisation impande south africa through the support of the nelson mandela foundation.
tgt: setsi sena se sa tswa ahwa ke mokgatlo wa ntshetsopele wa impande south africa ka tshehetso ya nelson mandela foundation.

src: i was deeply touched by the dedication of the centre’s staff to supporting the community and its children.
tgt: ke ile ka ameha maikutlo ke kamoo basebetsi ba setsing ba inehetseng ho tshehetseng baahi le bana.

src: they told me how in the centre’s earliest days, staff struggled to get paid and yet still came to work.
tgt: ba mpole lletse hore matsatsing a pele, basebetsi ba setsi ba ne ba sa fumane meputso empa ba ntse ba etla mosebetsing.

src: they also told me that even if families are not able to pay the r20 fee for their child, the children are not turned away.
tgt: ba boetse ba mpolella hore leha malapa a mang a hloleha ho lefa r20 bakeng sa bana, bana ha ba kgutlisetswe morao.

src: the commitment of the ecd centre staff is so important because early childhood development centres play a pivotal role in our nation’s development.
tgt: boinehelo ba basebesetsi ba setsing sa ecd bo bohlokwa hobane ditsi tsena tsa bana ba banyenyane di na le karolo ya bohlokwa ntshetsopeleng ya setjhaba sa rona.

src: these centres can be found in every village, town and city in the country.
tgt: ditsi tsena di fumaneha motseng o mong le o mong wa mahae, toropong e nngwe le e nngwe le metsemeholong e meng le e meng naheng.

src: most were started by women in the community to support parents who need their children to be cared for when they are at work.
tgt: bongata ba tsona di qadilwe ke basadi ba me tseng ho tshehetsa batswadi ba batlang hore bana ba bona ba hlokomelwe ha ba le mose betsing.

src: many of these centres began as creches and daycare facilities.
tgt: bongata ba dibaka tsena bo qadile e le dikeretjhe le dibaka tsa tlhokomelo ya bana ya motsheare.

src: many have subsequently grown and expanded to incorporate a basic learning curriculum into their services.
tgt: bongata ba tsona di hodile tsa atoloha tsa kenyeletsa kharikhulamo ya motheo ya ho ithuta di tshebeletsong tsa tsona.

src: as government, we have taken up the task to improve the standards of care and make resources available for ecd centres to run suitable activities for young children to prepare them for formal education.
tgt: re le mmuso re inehetse mosebetsing wa ho ntlafatsa maemo a tlhokomelo le ho netefatsa boteng ba mehlodi e hlokehang ditsing tsa ecd molemong wa hore di be le diketsahalo tse loketseng bakeng sa bana ba banye nyane, ho ba lokisetsa ho ya sekolong.

src: in april 2022, we completed the move of the ecd function from the department of social development to the department of basic education.
tgt: ka mmesa 2022, re phethetse ho tloswa ha mose betsi wa ecd lefapheng la ntshetsopele ya setjhaba ho ya lefapheng la thuto ya motheo.

src: this is to link early childhood development to the formal school curriculum and to provide training, education and development to staff in ecd centres around the country.
tgt: sena se molemong wa ho hokahanya thuto ya bana ba banyenyane le kha rikhulamo ya sekolo, le ho nehelana ka thupelo, thuto le ntshetsopele basebetsing ba ditsi tsa ecd naheng ka bophara.
